1 of 507 DOCUMENTS




Washingtonpost.com


April 26, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 624 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Auto Dr., 4:30-5:40 p.m., April 13. A cellphone was stolen from a locker at an aquatic center.

VANDALISM

Vigilant Ct., April 15. Firecrackers were set off inside mailboxes. Two Dunkirk boys, both 16, were charged with destruction of property.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Harbor Dr., April 11 to April 12. A 17-foot boat and trailer were stolen from a residence.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Clifton Dr., 6:22 p.m., April 10. A 1967 Plymouth Barracuda and a 1974 Pontiac Grand Prix were stolen.

OWINGS AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Donald's Way, 3:30 p.m., April 9. Two wheels were stolen from a vehicle at a car-care business.

PRINCE FREDERICK SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Solomons Island Rd., April 13. A man was arrested in connection with the groping of a juvenile at a grocery store in January. He is also being charged in connection with two similar incidents at a store April 6. A Port Republic man, 54, was charged with three counts of third- and fourth-degree sex offense and three counts of second-degree assault. Child pornography charges are pending, and the man also is a suspect in two sexual assaults in St. Mary's County. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hospital Dr., 5:03 p.m., April 12. A purse was stolen from a locker at a birthing center.

Mason Ct., 7:35 p.m., April 10. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Ave., April 8 to April 9. An iPod charger was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Majesty Lane, 8 p.m., April 13 to 7 a.m., April 14. A camcorder and a camera were stolen from a vehicle.

Majesty Lane, 8 p.m., April 13 to 7 a.m., April 14. An unlocked vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

Regency Dr., 8 p.m., April 13 to 7 a.m., April 14. Two headrest-DVD players were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. LA PLATA AREA HOMICIDE

Kent Ave., 200 block, 8:30 p.m., April 18. While on patrol, police heard gunshots. The body of Martin Hawkins, 32, of La Plata was found on a street. He had suffered multiple gunshot wounds.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ROBBERIES

Three Notch Rd., 7:47 a.m., April 16. A man robbed a sandwich shop of cash at knifepoint.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: April 26, 2012


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Web Publication

All Rights Reserved


2 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


October 9, 2014 Thursday  
Every Edition


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 854 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Emmanuel Church Rd., 6:40 p.m. Sept. 23. Copper spouts and gutter pieces were stolen from a barn.  

Holland Cliffs Rd., Sept. 24 to Sept.25. A barn was broken into; two jet skis and windows were damaged.

NORTH BEACH AREA

VANDALISM

Wetlands Overlook Park, Sept. 22 to 23. A boardwalk was spray painted.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Industrial Dr., Sept. 19 to 22. Welding rods and copper wire were stolen from a business.

Investment Ct., 3:30 to 4:30 a.m. Sept. 23. Vehicles were entered by breaking door handles and windows; radios, batteries, cables and instrument clusters were stolen.

VANDALISM

Covenant Ct., Sept. 25 to 26. A door handle was broken off a vehicle.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd., 2:43 p.m. Sept. 26. Two men carried clothing from a store and fled in a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Blackberry Lane, Sept. 28. Graffiti was spray-painted on two vehicles and a lamppost at a home.

Whispering Dr., Sept. 28. Windows of a home and a mailbox were spray-painted with graffiti.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

NANJEMOY AREA

ARSON

Smith Point Rd., July 25. A 2005 A Cadillac CTS was set on fire. A Bryans Road man, 34, was charged Oct. 1 with first-degree malicious burning and insurance fraud.

WALDORF AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf, Sept. 29. A Waldorf man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of two male youths in March. An investigation concluded that the man had also allegedly abused a family friend in 2012. The man was charged with two counts of sexual abuse of a minor, two counts of third-degree sexual offense, two counts of fourth-degree sexual offense, one count of perverted practice and one count of second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Audrey Manor Ct., 2300 block, 2 to 10:30 a.m. Sept. 30. An amplifier was stolen from the trunk of a vehicle.

Crain Hwy., 6:15 p.m. Sept. 29. Two men were found behind a shopping center with a large amount of clothes, reportedly stolen from a nearby store. Two Indian Head men, 19 and 25, were charged with theft and possession of marijuana with intent to distribute.

Mattawoman Beantown Rd., 3200 block, 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 1. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle at a park-and-ride area.

Pimpernel Dr., 2400 block, Sept. 30. Items were stolen from several unlocked vehicles.

ARSON

Crain Hwy., 2800 block, 6:30 a.m. Sept. 28. A store roof was set on fire.

WHITE PLAINS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy. and Billingsley Rd., Sept. 29 and 30. Cable was stolen.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

St. Andrew's Church Rd., 10:15 a.m. Sept. 26. Items were stolen from a foreclosed residence. An Upper Marlboro man, 21, and a Valley Lee woman, 18, were charged with fourth-degree burglary.

GREAT MILLS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Great Mills, 6 a.m. Sept. 29. A woman, 22, was sexually assaulted at a residence. A Lexington Park man, 28, was charged with second-and fourth-degree sexual offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

Heather St., Sept. 29. During an argument, a man threw a can of wood stain at an acquaintance and cut the person on the arm with a knife. A Great Mills man, 34, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pope St., Sept. 30. Property was stolen from a residence.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Bridgette Lane, Sept. 30. During a fight, a man cut one person on the hand and another on the chest. A California man, 18, was charged with two counts of first- and second-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

Roosevelt Blvd., 10:09 p.m. Sept. 29. A manager of a movie theater was approached by a man who ordered her back into the theater and robbed her at gunpoint. A Leonardtown man, 21, was charged with armed robbery, first- and second-degree assault and theft.

Yowaski Mill Rd., 10:57 a.m. Sept. 29. A 2006 Subaru Legacy was set on fire. The vehicle had been reported stolen.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

ARSON

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: October 9, 2014


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DISTRIBUTION: Southern Maryland


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

The Washington Post


April 26, 2012 Thursday

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 547 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Auto Dr., 4:30-5:40 p.m., April 13. A cellphone was stolen from a locker at an aquatic center.  

VANDALISM

Vigilant Ct., April 15. Firecrackers were set off inside mailboxes. Two Dunkirk boys, both 16, were charged with destruction of property.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Harbor Dr., April 11 to April 12. A 17-foot boat and trailer were stolen from a residence.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Clifton Dr., 6:22 p.m., April 10. A 1967 Plymouth Barracuda and a 1974 Pontiac Grand Prix were stolen.

OWINGS AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Donald's Way, 3:30 p.m., April 9. Two wheels were stolen from a vehicle at a car-care business.

PRINCE FREDERICK

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Solomons Island Rd., April 13. A man was arrested in connection with the groping of a juvenile at a grocery store in January. He is also being charged in connection with two similar incidents at a store April 6. A Port Republic man, 54, was charged with three counts of third- and fourth-degree sex offense and three counts of second-degree assault. Child pornography charges are pending, and the man also is a suspect in two sexual assaults in St. Mary's County. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hospital Dr., 5:03 p.m., April 12. A purse was stolen from a locker at a birthing center.

Mason Ct., 7:35 p.m., April 10. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Ave., April 8 to April 9. An iPod charger was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Majesty Lane, 8 p.m., April 13 to 7 a.m., April 14. A camcorder and a camera were stolen from a vehicle.

Majesty Lane, 8 p.m., April 13 to 7 a.m., April 14. An unlocked vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

Regency Dr., 8 p.m., April 13 to 7 a.m., April 14. Two headrest-DVD players were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us.

LA PLATA AREA

HOMICIDE

Kent Ave., 200 block, 8:30 p.m., April 18. While on patrol, police heard gunshots. The body of Martin Hawkins, 32, of La Plata was found on a street. He had suffered multiple gunshot wounds.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ROBBERIES

Three Notch Rd., 7:47 a.m., April 16. A man robbed a sandwich shop of cash at knifepoint.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

4 of 507 DOCUMENTS




Washingtonpost.com


October 11, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1054 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

DUNKIRK AREA ASSAULTS  

Southern Maryland Blvd., 11:22 a.m., Sept. 29. During an argument at a nail salon, a man threatened an employee at knifepoint. A Prince Frederick man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault and attempted first-degree assault.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Big Bear Lane, Sept. 25 to Sept. 26. A vehicle window was broken. The interior was ransacked, but nothing was reported missing.

NORTH BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eighth St., 7 p.m., Sept. 23 to 4:30 p.m., Sept. 25. Hunting clothes and knives were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

Seventh St., Sept. 23 to Sept. 24. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sixes Rd., 7 a.m.-3 p.m., Sept. 24. Electronic items were stolen from a residence.

SUNDERLAND AREA VANDALISM

Valley Lane, Sept. 26. Two mailboxes were damaged.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

HUGHESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Quicktree Pl., 7000 block, 6 p.m., Sept. 29. Copper pipes were stolen from a house under construction. A Charlotte Hall man, 44, was charged with second-degree burglary, theft and destruction of property.

LA PLATA AREA ROBBERIES

Oriole Lane, 100 block, 11:45 p.m., Oct. 2. A man walking his dog was robbed of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hunter Harbor Lane, Sept. 22 to Oct. 3. An air conditioner was stolen from a yard at a vacant residence.

Hunters Ridge Ct., 4500 block, 11:30 a.m.-4:30 p.m., Oct. 1. Computers and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Valley Rd., 6900 block, Sept. 29 to Oct. 1. Lawn equipment and a toolbox were stolen from an unlocked shed.

WALDORF AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf area, Oct. 2. A Waldorf man, 46, was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a minor child in September. Charges included first- and second-degree rape, first- and second-degree assault, use of a firearm in commission of a felony and sexual solicitation of a minor.

ASSAULTS

Sextant Pl., 10400 block, 2:34 a.m., Sept. 29. During a fight at a party, two men were struck in the head with blunt objects. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mattawoman-Beantown Rd., Oct. 2 to Oct. 3. Property and cash were stolen from several vehicles at a commuter parking lot.

O'Donnell Pl., 10400 block, 1:39 a.m., Oct. 3. About 500 gallons of cooking oil were stolen from a tank outside a restaurant.

Smallwood Dr., 1200 block, 4:30 a.m., Sept. 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered through the roof and by removing ceiling tiles.

St. Peter's Church Rd., 3200 block, 2 to 7 p.m., Sept. 29. A computer, jewelry and electronic items were stolen from a residence.

WHITE PLAINS AREA ROBBERIES

White Plains, Oct. 3. A man was arrested in connection with the armed robbery Sept. 5 of a man trying to buy shoes in a transaction arranged over the Internet. A Bryans Road man, 18, was charged with armed robbery, robbery, first- and second-degree assault, use of a firearm in commission of a violent crime, illegal carrying of a handgun and theft.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA ROBBERIES

California, 2:55 p.m., Sept. 9. A pizza delivery person was robbed at gunpoint. A White Plains male, 17, was charged with armed robbery.

GREAT MILLS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chancellors Run Ct., 2:15 a.m., Sept. 29. A man who had been asked to leave a home returned a short time later and used a ladder to reenter the home through a second-story window. A Great Mills man, 25, was charged with fourth-degree burglary and destruction of property.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS

Leonardtown area, Oct. 3. During an argument, a man kicked and punched an acquaintance. A California man, 38, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park area, Oct. 2. A Lexington Park man, 22, was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a minor on several occasions during the first six months of the year. Charges included second- and third- and fourth-degree sex offenses.

ASSAULTS

Windsor Dr., Sept. 28. During an argument, a woman kicked, slapped and scratched an acquaintance. A Lexington Park woman, 36, was charged with second-degree assault.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Exploration Dr., Sept. 30. A man approached a woman from behind as she was walking to her vehicle, threatened her, grabbed her purse and drove away in her vehicle. A Lexington Park man, 19, was charged with motor vehicle theft, robbery, second-degree assault and theft.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: October 11, 2012


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Web Publication

Washingtonpost.com


October 9, 2014 Thursday 12:02 AM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 961 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Emmanuel Church Rd.,6:40 p.m. Sept. 23. Copper spouts and gutter pieces were stolen from a barn.

Holland Cliffs Rd., Sept. 24 to Sept.25. A barn was broken into; two jet skis and windows were damaged.

NORTH BEACH AREA VANDALISM

Wetlands Overlook Park,Sept. 22 to 23. A boardwalk was spray painted.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Industrial Dr.,Sept. 19 to 22. Welding rods and copper wire were stolen from a business.

Investment Ct., 3:30 to 4:30 a.m. Sept. 23. Vehicles were entered by breaking door handles and windows; radios, batteries, cables and instrument clusters were stolen.

VANDALISM

Covenant Ct.,Sept. 25 to 26. A door handle was broken off a vehicle.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd.,2:43 p.m. Sept. 26. Two men carried clothing from a store and fled in a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Blackberry Lane,Sept. 28. Graffiti was spray-painted on two vehicles and a lamppost at a home.

Whispering Dr.,Sept. 28. Windows of a home and a mailbox were spray-painted with graffiti.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

NANJEMOY AREA ARSON

Smith Point Rd.,July 25. A 2005 A Cadillac CTS was set on fire. A Bryans Road man, 34, was charged Oct. 1 with first-degree malicious burning and insurance fraud.

WALDORF AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf,Sept. 29. A Waldorf man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of two male youths in March. An investigation concluded that the man had also allegedly abused a family friend in 2012. The man was charged with two counts of sexual abuse of a minor, two counts of third-degree sexual offense, two counts of fourth-degree sexual offense, one count of perverted practice and one count of second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Audrey Manor Ct.,2300 block, 2 to 10:30 a.m. Sept. 30. An amplifier was stolen from the trunk of a vehicle.

Crain Hwy.,6:15 p.m. Sept. 29. Two men were found behind a shopping center with a large amount of clothes, reportedly stolen from a nearby store. Two Indian Head men, 19 and 25, were charged with theft and possession of marijuana with intent to distribute.

Mattawoman Beantown Rd.,3200 block, 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 1. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle at a park-and-ride area.

Pimpernel Dr.,2400 block, Sept. 30. Items were stolen from several unlocked vehicles.

ARSON

Crain Hwy.,2800 block, 6:30 a.m. Sept. 28. A store roof was set on fire.

WHITE PLAINS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy. and Billingsley Rd.,Sept. 29 and 30. Cable was stolen.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

St. Andrew's Church Rd.,10:15 a.m. Sept. 26. Items were stolen from a foreclosed residence. An Upper Marlboro man, 21, and a Valley Lee woman, 18, were charged with fourth-degree burglary.

GREAT MILLS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Great Mills,6 a.m. Sept. 29. A woman, 22, was sexually assaulted at a residence. A Lexington Park man, 28, was charged with second-and fourth-degree sexual offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

Heather St.,Sept. 29. During an argument, a man threw a can of wood stain at an acquaintance and cut the person on the arm with a knife. A Great Mills man, 34, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pope St.,Sept. 30. Property was stolen from a residence.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Bridgette Lane,Sept. 30. During a fight, a man cut one person on the hand and another on the chest. A California man, 18, was charged with two counts of first- and second-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

Roosevelt Blvd.,10:09 p.m. Sept. 29. A manager of a movie theater was approached by a man who ordered her back into the theater and robbed her at gunpoint. A Leonardtown man, 21, was charged with armed robbery, first- and second-degree assault and theft.

Yowaski Mill Rd., 10:57 a.m. Sept. 29. A 2006 Subaru Legacy was set on fire. The vehicle had been reported stolen.

The Washington Post


October 11, 2012 Thursday  
Every Edition


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 940 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

DUNKIRK AREA

ASSAULTS

Southern Maryland Blvd., 11:22 a.m., Sept. 29. During an argument at a nail salon, a man threatened an employee at knifepoint. A Prince Frederick man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault and attempted first-degree assault.  

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Big Bear Lane, Sept. 25 to Sept. 26. A vehicle window was broken. The interior was ransacked, but nothing was reported missing.

NORTH BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eighth St., 7 p.m., Sept. 23 to 4:30 p.m., Sept. 25. Hunting clothes and knives were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

Seventh St., Sept. 23 to Sept. 24. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sixes Rd., 7 a.m.-3 p.m., Sept. 24. Electronic items were stolen from a residence.

SUNDERLAND AREA

VANDALISM

Valley Lane, Sept. 26. Two mailboxes were damaged.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

HUGHESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Quicktree Pl., 7000 block, 6 p.m., Sept. 29. Copper pipes were stolen from a house under construction. A Charlotte Hall man, 44, was charged with second-degree burglary, theft and destruction of property.

LA PLATA AREA

ROBBERIES

Oriole Lane, 100 block, 11:45 p.m., Oct. 2. A man walking his dog was robbed of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hunter Harbor Lane, Sept. 22 to Oct. 3. An air conditioner was stolen from a yard at a vacant residence.

Hunters Ridge Ct., 4500 block, 11:30 a.m.-4:30 p.m., Oct. 1. Computers and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Valley Rd., 6900 block, Sept. 29 to Oct. 1. Lawn equipment and a toolbox were stolen from an unlocked shed.

WALDORF AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf area, Oct. 2. A Waldorf man, 46, was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a minor child in September. Charges included first- and second-degree rape, first- and second-degree assault, use of a firearm in commission of a felony and sexual solicitation of a minor.

ASSAULTS

Sextant Pl., 10400 block, 2:34 a.m., Sept. 29. During a fight at a party, two men were struck in the head with blunt objects. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mattawoman-Beantown Rd., Oct. 2 to Oct. 3. Property and cash were stolen from several vehicles at a commuter parking lot.

O'Donnell Pl., 10400 block, 1:39 a.m., Oct. 3. About 500 gallons of cooking oil were stolen from a tank outside a restaurant.

Smallwood Dr., 1200 block, 4:30 a.m., Sept. 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered through the roof and by removing ceiling tiles.

St. Peter's Church Rd., 3200 block, 2 to 7 p.m., Sept. 29. A computer, jewelry and electronic items were stolen from a residence.

WHITE PLAINS AREA

ROBBERIES

White Plains, Oct. 3. A man was arrested in connection with the armed robbery Sept. 5 of a man trying to buy shoes in a transaction arranged over the Internet. A Bryans Road man, 18, was charged with armed robbery, robbery, first- and second-degree assault, use of a firearm in commission of a violent crime, illegal carrying of a handgun and theft.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

ROBBERIES

California, 2:55 p.m., Sept. 9. A pizza delivery person was robbed at gunpoint. A White Plains male, 17, was charged with armed robbery.

GREAT MILLS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chancellors Run Ct., 2:15 a.m., Sept. 29. A man who had been asked to leave a home returned a short time later and used a ladder to reenter the home through a second-story window. A Great Mills man, 25, was charged with fourth-degree burglary and destruction of property.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS

Leonardtown area, Oct. 3. During an argument, a man kicked and punched an acquaintance. A California man, 38, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park area, Oct. 2. A Lexington Park man, 22, was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a minor on several occasions during the first six months of the year. Charges included second- and third- and fourth-degree sex offenses.

ASSAULTS

Windsor Dr., Sept. 28. During an argument, a woman kicked, slapped and scratched an acquaintance. A Lexington Park woman, 36, was charged with second-degree assault.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Exploration Dr., Sept. 30. A man approached a woman from behind as she was walking to her vehicle, threatened her, grabbed her purse and drove away in her vehicle. A Lexington Park man, 19, was charged with motor vehicle theft, robbery, second-degree assault and theft.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Southern Maryland crime reportSouthern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1164 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

ASSAULTS

Ridgeway Terr., 4300 block, 7:14 a.m. June 3. Intervening in a dispute between two acquaintances at a residence, a 46-year-old man was stabbed in the neck. A 40-year-old St. Leonard man who had fled to the back yard of the residence was arrested a short time later and charged with first- and second-degree assault. The stabbing victim drove himself to a hospital for treatment. A woman involved in the altercation reported no injuries.

SOLOMONS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Williams St., 100 block, May 27. Property was stolen from a vehicle. 

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA

ASSAULTS

Charles St. and La Plata Rd., June 3 (domestic).

Crain Hwy., 6800 block, June 2.

Crain Hwy., 6800 block, June 7 (domestic).

Crain Hwy., 6800 block, June 8.

Garrett Ave., 1-100 block, June 2.

Garrett Ave., 1-100 block, June 4.

Garrett Ave., 1-100 block, June 6.

Harford St., 300 block, June 3.

Little Creek Lane, 1-100 block, June 5.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catalpa Dr., 1-100 block, June 9. A theft was reported.

Charles St, 600 block, June 4. A theft was reported.

Crain Hwy., 6600 block, June 4. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

Crain Hwy., 6800 block, June 2. A theft occurred.

Crain Hwy., 6800 block, June 7. Two incidents of theft occurred.

Little Creek Lane, 1-100 block, June 6. Property was stolen during a break-in.

Shining Willow Way, 1-100 block, June 3. A theft was reported.

Willow Lane, 1-100 block, June 1. A theft was reported.

St. CHARLES AREA

ROBBERIES

St. Charles Towne Center, 9:36 p.m. June 6. Two men wearing ski masks robbed a woman getting into her vehicle of personal property at gunpoint, then fled in a dark-colored sport-utility vehicle driven by an accomplice.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

Acton Lane, 11900 block, 10:12 p.m. June 6. A man robbed a department-store employee sitting in his vehicle during a work-break of the red 1994 Ford Mustang and other property at gunpoint. The vehicle has a black convertible top.

Robinson Place, 2:30 p.m. June 6. A man walking on a path was knocked to the ground and robbed of cash from his pockets. The victim said that just before he was attacked, he had seen a group of males approach him from behind. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lubbock Pl., 2600 block, 3:32 p.m. June 3. Responding to the report of a residential break-in during which an assault was committed, police found a homeowner suffering from several stab wounds in her abdomen. She was taken to a hospital and treated for injuries that were not life-threatening. An investigation determined that there had been no break-in and that the wounds were self-inflicted.

VANDALISM

Streamview neighborhood, 3 a.m. June 7. Several vehicles were struck with eggs and had side-view mirrors damaged. Charges are pending against several teenagers who were riding in a sport-utility vehicle in the area at the time of the incident.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

ASSAULTS

Three Notch Rd., 22700 block, May 28. Responding to a report of a large and disorderly crowd near a convenience store/gas station, police arrested an Avenue man, 24, and a Lexington Park man. 23.

GREAT MILLS AREA

ASSAULTS

Jay Dee Court, May 23. A man attacked an acquaintance at a residence. A Great Mills man, 21, was charged with second-degree assault. No serious injuries were reported.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Great Mills Road near Chancellors Run Road, May 30. Responding to a report that two men armed with handguns had identified themselves as federal agents, police made a traffic stop. A New Carrollton man, 23, and a Severn man, 38, were charged with carrying concealed handguns and illegal transport of handguns.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, May 24. A Park Hall man, 22, was charged with sexual assault of a person under the age of consent.

Leonardtown, June 8. A Waldorf man, 30, was charged with sexual assault of an acquaintance under the age of consent.

ASSAULTS

Point Lookout Rd.,13400 block, June 7 (domestice).

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Point Lookout Rd., 13300 block, May 24. A theft was reported.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Westberry neighborhood, May 29. Responding to a report of shots being fired, police confronted a man standing in a street, yelling and otherwise behaving erratically. A Lexington Park man, 22, was charged with disorderly conduct.

The Washington Post


September 2, 2001 Sunday  
Final Edition


St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 338 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

LANGLEY PARK WAY, 10 p.m. Aug. 25. A man, 19, and a male youth, 17, assaulted a female youth, 13. They were charged with second-degree rape; first-, second- and third-degree sexual assault; reckless endangerment; administering controlled dangerous substances to a victim during a crime of violence; and administering controlled dangerous substances to a victim during a third-degree sexual assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 9:15 a.m. Aug. 25. A man, 20, stole a cell phone from a vehicle. He was charged with theft of less than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

COLUMBIA COMMONS, 9:34 p.m. Aug. 24. A male youth, 17, after being arrested for indecent exposure, assaulted a trooper and attempted to flee. He was charged with possession of a controlled dangerous substance, second-degree assault and resisting arrest.

COLUMBUS DR., 3 p.m. July 30. A man, 18, assaulted two male youths, ages 16 and 17. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CARRIAGE POST LANE, 8:51 a.m. Aug. 19. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

LIBERTY ST., 6:51 a.m. Aug. 22. A Honda all-terrain vehicle was stolen from a parking lot.

SPRING VALLEY DR., 8:59 a.m. Aug. 21. Three fishing rods and four wheels with tires were stolen from a garage.

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 7:55 p.m. Aug. 23. A man assaulted a woman at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, Feb. 21 to March 22. A man, 24, illegally obtained a credit card from a bank and made numerous purchases throughout St. Mary's, Charles and Calvert counties. He was charged with forgery, theft and fraud.

-- Bonnie Smith

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 1043 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by the police departments of Montgomery County and Rockville.

Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

Bou Ave., 5700 block, 7:15 p.m. May 9. A man assaulted an acquaintance. A Rockville man, 31, was arrested. 

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Frederick Rd., 15400 block, May 8 to May 9. A vehicle was stolen from an auto dealership entered by force.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATION301-652-9200

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jensen Pl., 12:30 p.m. May 10. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

East-West Hwy., 1700 block, 11:10 p.m. May 10. A group of four to five males assaulted a person and took property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bethesda area, day and night hours May 5 to 13. Nine thefts from vehicles were reported. Two vehicles were entered by force. Cash, electronics and other items were stolen.

Bybrook Lane, 7400 block, daytime May 6. Property outside a residence was stolen.

Bybrook Lane, 7500 block, May 5 to May 8. Property outside a residence was stolen.

Daniel Rd., 2900 block, 1 p.m. May 6. A residence was entered by force.

Democracy Blvd., 7100 block, 5 to 6 p.m. May 6. Cash, purses and an iPad were stolen from two vehicles entered by force.

Montgomery Ave., 4300 block, 11 p.m. May 6. A residence was entered by force.

Rossmore Dr., 5900 block, 1 p.m. May 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Wisconsin Ave., 8300 block, overnight May 7 to 8. Property was stolen from a business. There was no sign of forced entry.

Wisconsin Ave., 7100 block, overnight May 7 to 8. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

Whittier Blvd., 8100 block, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 8. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATION301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Georgia Ave., 5:40 to 6:40 p.m. May 12. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Colesville Rd., 8300 block, 2:58 a.m. May 14. A female and three men, armed with a weapon, threatened a person at a gas station and took property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Childress Terr., Bald Hill Ct. and Angleton Terr., overnight May 9 to May 10. A wallet, cash and a laptop computer were stolen from two unlocked vehicles.

Fenton St., 7800 block, 6 p.m. May 9 to 9:30 a.m. May 10. Two storage units at a storage lot were entered by force.

Georgia Ave., 7900 block, 8 a.m. May 7. A purse and a cellphone were stolen from a vehicle entered by force at a convenience store.

Lockwood Dr., 11600 block, 5:06 a.m. May 11. Four thefts from vehicles were reported. Cash, a GPS device and a purse were stolen. A Silver Spring male, 16, was arrested.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

Dorsey Rd., 6500 block, 8 p.m. May 7 to 8 p.m. May 8. Property was stolen from a shed entered by force.

Harvest Glen Way, Palmetto Ct. and Caravan Dr., May 4 to May 12. Thefts from five unlocked vehicles were reported. Stolen items included laptop computers, purses, jewelry, sunglasses, cash and a GPS device.

Station St., Middlebrook Rd. and Country Ridge Dr., May 6 to May 11. Property was taken from three vehicles, two unlocked and one entered by force. Cash, a laptop computer, jewelry and a purse were stolen.

DISTRICT 6GAITHERSBURG STATION240-773-5700

ROBBERIES

Rio Blvd., 9:40 p.m. May 9. A male armed with a weapon assaulted a person and took property at a shopping mall parking garage.

Summit Hall Rd., 200 block, 7:40 p.m. May 11. Assault and robbery were reported at a park. A Gaithersburg male, 16, was arrested.

West Diamond Ave., 400 block, 4:47 p.m. May 9. Two males assaulted a person and took property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

East Diamond Ave., Hutton St., Blue Violet Ct. and Calypso Lane, May 5 to May 6. Thefts from six unlocked vehicles were reported. Stolen items included a video game, a cellphone, clothing, a wallet, a video camera, an iPod, gift cards, greeting cards, a pocketknife, sunglasses, a flashlight and papers.

Kinglet Pl. and Farmingham and Carlsbad drives, May 6 to May 9. Thefts from four unlocked vehicles were reported. Stolen items included an iPod, a laptop computer and auto parts.

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 842 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Fortuna Center Plaza, 4100 block, 10:22 p.m. Feb. 7. A male robbed a liquor store at gunpoint, then fled with three accomplices.

GAINESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Clubhouse Rd., 6:47 p.m. Feb. 5. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance, then forced her into a vehicle at gunpoint and drove her to an unknown location. She eventually persuaded him to take her back home. A 37-year-old Virginia Beach man was arrested Feb. 6. 

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Beckham Ct., 7700 block, Feb. 4. A video camera was used to film the inside of a bathroom at a residence where a party was being held. A 46-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Hensley Rd., 9400 block, 11:36 a.m. Feb. 10. During a fight with two men, a man was struck with a pipe. Two Catlett men, 40 and 47, were arrested. The victim was taken to a hospital for treatment.

Wichita Ct., 7300 block, 10:30 p.m. Feb. 5. A woman attacked a man and a woman during a dispute, then kicked a police officer responding to a report of a disturbance. She also spit at an officer after her arrest. A 30-year-old Manassas woman was charged with two counts of assault on a law enforcement officer and two counts of assault and battery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Coral Berry Dr., 10500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Feb. 5. A handgun, a TV, two laptop computers, two video game systems and a tablet computer were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Forest Greens golf course area, Jan. 5. A male sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A 15-year-old Triangle boy was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd. and Minnieville Rd. area, Feb. 8. A 59-year-old Baltimore County, Md., man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a juvenile acquaintance at this location in 1987.

ASSAULTS

Cass Brook Lane, 17000 block, 2 p.m. Feb. 9. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 54-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Featherstone Rd., 1500 block, 10:05 p.m. Feb. 7. Four males robbed a store at gunpoint.

Featherstone and Arizona roads, 12:02 a.m. Feb. 10. A group of men threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of cash. The victim was treated for a cut sustained during the incident.

Old Bridge Rd., 2000 block, 10:57 p.m. Feb. 5. Three males wearing masks robbed a gas station of cash at gunpoint.

Welsh Lane, 4300 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 8. Three males robbed a pizza deliveryman of cash and pizzas at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antietam Dr., 11800 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 8 to 12:46 a.m. Feb. 9. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

Directors Loop, 12700 block, 12:48 to 1:16 a.m. Feb. 12. A laptop computer, a cellphone and a hard drive were stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Freestone Ct., 12900 block, 5:45 a.m. to 3:40 p.m. Feb. 7. Four handguns, jewelry and cash were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Frontier Lane, 12800 block, 10:40 a.m. to noon Feb. 7. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Lake Ridge Dr., 12600 block, 8:13 p.m. Feb. 9. A laptop computer was stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

Point Pleasant Lane, 16900 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 8 to 6 p.m. Feb. 9. A handgun, a video game system and games were stolen from a residence.

Princeton St., 12200 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 26 to 10:20 a.m. Feb. 7. Medication was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front window.

Prince William Pkwy., 2400 block, 3:29 a.m. Feb. 9. Tablet computers were among property stolen from a store. A male who had hidden himself on the premises before closing time was seen fleeing with the property.

Woodmark Dr., 2800 block, 4:52 p.m. Feb. 5. A man entered a residence by forcing a front door. He fled empty-handed after threatening a returning resident at gunpoint.

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

As they were driving, the woman implied that she had a gun and started to go through the purse of the motorist, who then drove to a police station. After a brief foot chase, a 28-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Southern Maryland crime report

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. 16 of 507 DOCUMENTS




Washingtonpost.com


May 15, 2013 Wednesday 8:13 PM EST 


Hagel orders retraining amid new sex-crime case


BYLINE: Craig Whitlock


SECTION: A section; Pg. A01


LENGTH: 1023 words


Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel on Tuesday evening ordered the armed services to immediately "re-train, re-credential and re-screen" tens of thousands of military recruiters and sexual-assault prevention officers as the revelation of another sex-crime scandal rocked the Pentagon.

Hagel's order came in response to the Army's disclosure Tuesday that a sergeant first class responsible for handling sexual-assault cases at Fort Hood, Tex., had been placed under criminal investigation over allegations of abusive sexual contact and other related matters.  

Investigators are also scrutinizing allegations that the sergeant may have forced a subordinate into prostitution, according to a U.S. official familiar with the case.

The Army investigation comes just 10 days after a lieutenant colonel who led the Air Force's sexual-assault prevention programs was arrested in Arlington County on charges that he groped and battered a woman in a parking lot. That incident, along with fresh statistics showing that sex crimes have become endemic in the military, sparked a furious response from lawmakers on Capitol Hill and President Obama.

Hagel warned last week that the military's ability to recruit and perform its missions was becoming endangered by deepening public perceptions that the armed forces are unable or unwilling to cope with a sexual-assault crisis in the ranks. The latest embarrassment only made him more angry, Pentagon officials said.

"I cannot convey strongly enough his frustration, anger and disappointment over these troubling allegations and the breakdown in discipline and standards they imply," said George Little, the Pentagon press secretary.

Defense officials said Hagel learned of the Army investigation Tuesday morning from Army Secretary John McHugh. But the Pentagon did not publicly disclose the case until Tuesday evening, several hours after Hagel appeared at a town hall meeting for Defense Department employees at the Mark Center in Alexandria.

Neither the Pentagon nor the Army identified the sergeant because no charges have been filed. Special agents from the Army's Criminal Investigation Command are probing allegations that the sergeant first class mistreated subordinates, committed assault and abusive sexual contact, and engaged in pandering, the Pentagon said in a statement.

Officials said the noncommissioned officer had been suspended from duties as an "equal-opportunity adviser" and sexual-harassment and assault prevention officer at Fort Hood, one of the Army's biggest installations. The Pentagon did not disclose when the allegations first came to light or how many victims may have been involved.

Reaction from lawmakers was swift and livid.

"Tragically, the depth of the sexual-assault problem in our military was already overwhelmingly clear before this latest highly disturbing report," said Sen. Carl Levin (D-Mich.), the chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee. He said lawmakers would push ahead with a number of measures to address sexual assault in the armed forces, including changes to military law.

Rep. Niki Tsongas (D-Mass.), a member of the House Armed Services Committee, called the Fort Hood revelations "utterly abhorrent." She added that "it has become painfully evident that saying the military has a cultural problem in regard to sexual assault and sexual misconduct is a glaring understatement."

Rep. Howard P. "Buck" McKeon (R-Calif.), chairman of the House Armed Services Committee, said that he was "outraged and disgusted" and that his faith in the military to police sex crimes was "deeply shaken."

Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-N.Y.), also a member of the Senate Armed Services Committee, said she would introduce legislation Thursday to change military law so that independent prosecutors, not commanders, would be responsible for handling sex crimes and other serious offenses. Military leaders have strenuously resisted such proposals.

"It is time to get serious and get to work reforming the military justice system that clearly isn't working," Gillibrand said.

In addition to directing that hundreds of sexual-assault prevention coordinators be retrained and rescreened, Hagel ordered the same treatment for all military recruiters. That move alone would affect an estimated 20,000 recruiters for the Army, Air Force, Navy and Marine Corps.

The Washington Post reported Monday that military recruiters across the country have been caught in a string of sexual-assault scandals over the past year. The Pentagon, however, does not have a grasp on the extent of the problem because it does not track sex crimes committed by its personnel against civilians before they enlist.

Last week, the Pentagon released a report estimating that the number of military personnel victimized by sexual assault and related crimes had surged by about 35 percent over the past two years despite intensive efforts to confront the problem.

The Pentagon survey estimated that 26,000 troops experienced "unwanted sexual contact" last year. Yet only a fraction of that number - 3,374 - filed sexual-assault reports with military police or prosecutors.

Military officials said most victims are reluctant to press charges because they fear retaliation from their superiors or ostracism from their units, or that investigators won't take their cases seriously.

Lawmakers and victim advocates also blame an unwillingness among many commanders to deal with the problem forthrightly.

Members of Congress said they were outraged to learn about two cases in which Air Force generals granted clemency to convicted sex offenders, adding that the decisions would discourage other victims from reporting rape or sexual abuse.

"It is abundantly clear that the military cannot adequately handle its sexual violence crisis from within," said Anu Bhagwati, a former Marine captain and executive director of the Service Women's Action Network, an advocacy group. "If military culture is to transform in any meaningful way, we need to break down the doors of silence and make sure our troops who are harmed have access to the same legal remedies as all civilians whom they protect and defend."

whitlockc@washpost.com


LOAD-DATE: May 17, 2013


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1149 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

River Ridge Golf Course area, Sept. 28. A man sexually assaulted the child of an acquaintance. A 20-year-old South Carolina man was arrested Jan. 19.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Vanetta Ct., 3400 block, 6:30 a.m. Dec. 11 to 10:30 p.m. Jan. 17. A TV, a DVD player, computer equipment, jewelry and other property were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window. 

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Winnipeg Ct., 7200 block, 4:37 p.m. Jan. 23. A residence was entered through an unlocked window. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Bull Run Park area, Jan. 13. A man sexually assaulted the child of an acquaintance. A 49-year-old Manassas man was arrested Jan. 19.

Bull Run Park area, October to Jan. 17. A teenager was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance. On Jan. 18, a 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested on three counts of aggravated sexual battery.

ROBBERIES

Hollis Dr. and Willoughby Lane, 5:47 a.m. Jan. 19. Two males robbed a pedestrian of his wallet at gunpoint, then fled in a vehicle driven by an accomplice.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Community Dr., 8000 block, 11:30 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Jan. 23. Two laptops and a video game system were stolen from a residence.

West Point Ct., 7800 block, 2:30 p.m. Jan. 13 to 9 a.m. Jan. 17. A residence that is under construction was entered through an unlocked door. Nothing was reported missing.

Yates Ford Rd., 7000 block, Nov. 25 to Jan. 17. Jewelry and tools were stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hamill Mill Park area, December. A juvenile was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance. A 55-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested on Jan. 18.

ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd. and Mapledale Ave., 3:12 a.m. Jan. 11. A man who had been arguing with two people followed them as they drove to a restaurant, where he got out of his vehicle and broke their vehicle's windows with a tire iron. The victims tried to drive away. He sideswiped their vehicle, forcing it to spin out. The assailant then abandoned his vehicle in a ditch. A short time later, a 31-year-old man was arrested.

Gordon Blvd., 100 block, 8:35 a.m. Jan. 19. A woman forced her way into an acquaintance's residence, then threatened her at knifepoint. As the victim fled the premises, the assailant followed, then knifed a vehicle tire. A 22-year-old woman was arrested. No injuries were reported.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 10:20 p.m. Jan. 20. A stop sign was damaged by shot from a pellet gun. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Sunny Ridge Ct., 15000 block, 8:41 p.m. Jan. 19. A handgun was discharged inside a residence. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14000 block, 10:05 a.m. Jan. 21. Two men tried to rob a bank at gunpoint. When an employee refused to let them inside the building, they fled empty-handed.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14900 block, 6:01 p.m. Jan. 23. Three men tried to rob a pharmacy of narcotics at gunpoint. When an employee ducked behind the counter, they fled empty-handed.

Maurice Dr., 1500 block, 1:42 p.m. Jan. 18. Two males armed with a stun gun and a baseball bat robbed a man of a Global Positioning System device, prescription medication and cash.

Old Bridge Rd., 3200 block, 10:49 p.m. Jan. 22. A man attempted to rob a woman who was loading items into a vehicle. After a brief struggle, he fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

Pohick Creek Ct., 1900 block, Jan. 18. A man was arrested for his role in a plan to commit a home invasion in Dale City. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was charged with attempted armed robbery.

Tilletson Pl., 1700 block, 10:19 p.m. Jan. 18. A gunman demanded cash from a man near a trash-collection area, then fled empty-handed. The victim said that he was carrying a golf club and that it might have discouraged the assailant.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brickwood Dr., 15100 block, 5:58 a.m. Jan. 18. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked door. The intruder, confronted while looking through a purse, fled empty-handed.

Faith Ct., 14500 block, 1:14 a.m. Jan. 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a rear window.

Faith Ct., 14500 block, 1:15 a.m. Jan. 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a screen and forcing a rear window.

Hamilton Dr., 4400 block, 7:30 to 9:30 a.m. Jan. 18. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Horseshoe Lane, 15600 block, 12:30 to 5 p.m. Jan. 21. A residence was entered by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Sequoia Ct., 2000 block, midnight to 3 a.m. Jan. 17. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Park Ct. S., 4700 block, noon Jan. 18. A man followed an acquaintance from a store to his residence, then threatened him and robbed him of his vehicle.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Taney Rd., 9400 block, 1:50 p.m. Jan. 22. A man grabbed a purse from a pedestrian, who chased him and saw him go inside a residence. A 28-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burlington Ct., 8500 block, 11:30 p.m. Jan. 19 to 8 a.m. Jan. 20. A GPS device and a camera were stolen from a vehicle.

Liberia Ave., 9000 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 19 to 5:30 a.m. Jan. 20. Two air-conditioning units and construction equipment were stolen from a construction site.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 4:40 p.m. Jan. 18. A male stole a cellphone from a gas station.

Digital Dr., 9100 block, 7 p.m. Jan. 18 to 7 a.m. Jan. 19. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

Kent Dr., 200 block, 12:01 to 5:50 a.m. Jan. 18. Five nail guns and an air compressor were among property stolen from two vehicles.

Kent Dr., 200 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 17 to 7:30 a.m. Jan. 18. Three power drills were stolen from a vehicle.

Moseby Ct., 300 block, 5:30 p.m. Jan. 22 to 5:30 a.m. Jan. 23. A GPS device, CDs and a checkbook were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Kirby St., 2:46 a.m. Jan. 15. A man jumped on the hood and roof of a vehicle. A 33-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 786 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Foxfire Lane, March 16. Scrap aluminum, a propane tank and a spreader were stolen.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Red Cloud Rd., 8:30 p.m., March 17 to 7:15 p.m., March 18. A break-in at a residence was reported. Nothing appeared to be missing.

Rousby Hall Rd., March 9 to 15. A street sign was stolen. Floodlights directed at a sign were damaged.

Village Center Way, March 15 to 16. A cash register was stolen from a nail salon.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mac's Hollow Rd., 3:46 p.m., March 16. A large quantity of coins was stolen from a residence.

ST. LEONARD AREA ARSON

St. Leonard Rd., 6:35 a.m., March 15. A barn was set on fire.

St. Leonard Rd., 5:45 p.m., March 16. Two small fires were started inside a barn.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. LA PLATA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charles St., 10800 block, 2:39 p.m., March 14. Scrap metal was stolen from a garage. A Newburg man, 20, and a Hollywood man, 18, were charged with burglary and theft.

Trinity Church Rd., 10800 block, 1:30 a.m., March 18. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle, and a bicycle was stolen from a nearby location. Two 17-year-old males were charged with burglary, theft and with being rogue and vagabond.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 2400 block, 12:01 a.m., March 19. Cash was stolen from a car dealership. Break-ins also were reported at two other nearby auto-sales businesses, but nothing was reported missing.

Mattawoman, 3:30 to 7:15 p.m., March 19. A spare tire was stolen from a vehicle at a commuter lot. An unsuccessful attempt was made to steal a spare tire from a vehicle parked nearby.

VANDALISM

St. Ignatius Dr., 4:25 a.m., March 18. Several vehicles were damaged. A 14-year-old and a 15-year-old were charged with destruction of property.

ROBBERIES

Business Park Dr., 11700 block, 12:20 a.m., March 17. A male demanded cash from some teenagers at gunpoint and fired shots when the victims refused to comply. The gunmen then ran away. A male, 16, has been shot in the torso and was treated at a hospital for injuries that were not life-threatening.

Davis Rd., 4 p.m., March 9. A student was attacked on high school property and robbed of his cellphone. A 15-year-old boy was charged with strong-arm robbery and second-degree assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Leonardtown Rd., 3300 block, 11:10 p.m., March 20. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

DAMERON AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dameron, March 20. A man was arrested for sexually assaulting two minors. A Dameron man, 32, was charged with second-degree rape, two counts of second-degree sex offense, seven counts of third-degree sex offense and a continuing course of sexual misconduct with a minor.

CALIFORNIA AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

California, March 20. A 46-year-old California man was arrested for sexually assaulting a minor in incidents alleged to have taken place over five years. Charges included a continuing course of sexual abuse to a minor.

LEONARDTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Leonardtown, March 4 to 10. Flags on display outdoors were stolen from several locations.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Hilton Dr., 12:19 p.m., March 10. During an argument, a man attacked an acquaintance. A 41-year-old Lexington Park man was charged with second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 284 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.  

 Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

INDIAN HEAD HWY., 6900 block, 11 p.m. May 5 to 6 a.m. May 6. A Jeep, parked behind the post office, was entered and backed into a tree, causing damage.

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

PORT TOBACCO RD., 5600 block, 11 p.m. May 2. A man, 19, raped a female youth, 14, at an abandoned house. He was charged with second-degree rape.

ROBBERY

MALL CIR., 11000 block, 4:43 p.m. May 5. A male youth, 16, and two unidentified suspects knocked a woman, 80, to the ground and stole her purse. She was injured. Charged are pending.

KING ST., 10 block, 4:08 p.m. May 7. The SunTrust Bank inside the Safeway was robbed. The suspect fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WINTERGREEN PL., 3900 block, 6:45 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. April 28. Property was stolen from a residence.

VEHICLE THEFTS

NEW FOREST CT., 6000 block, 7 p.m. April 29 to 6 a.m. April 30. A 1985 Honda motorcycle was stolen from a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOUTHERN BUSINESS PARK DR., 4900 block, 12:44 a.m. May 7. Several high school letter jackets were stolen from Somthin' Special. Entry was gained through a shattered window.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 929 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Fortuna Center Plaza, 4100 block, 10:22 p.m. Feb. 7. A male robbed a liquor store at gunpoint, then fled with three accomplices.

GAINESVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Clubhouse Rd., 6:47 p.m. Feb. 5. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance, then forced her into a vehicle at gunpoint and drove her to an unknown location. She eventually persuaded him to take her back home. A 37-year-old Virginia Beach man was arrested Feb. 6.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Beckham Ct., 7700 block, Feb. 4. A video camera was used to film the inside of a bathroom at a residence where a party was being held. A 46-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Hensley Rd., 9400 block, 11:36 a.m. Feb. 10. During a fight with two men, a man was struck with a pipe. Two Catlett men, 40 and 47, were arrested. The victim was taken to a hospital for treatment.

Wichita Ct., 7300 block, 10:30 p.m. Feb. 5. A woman attacked a man and a woman during a dispute, then kicked a police officer responding to a report of a disturbance. She also spit at an officer after her arrest. A 30-year-old Manassas woman was charged with two counts of assault on a law enforcement officer and two counts of assault and battery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Coral Berry Dr., 10500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Feb. 5. A handgun, a TV, two laptop computers, two video game systems and a tablet computer were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Forest Greens golf course area, Jan. 5. A male sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A 15-year-old Triangle boy was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd. and Minnieville Rd. area, Feb. 8. A 59-year-old Baltimore County, Md., man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a juvenile acquaintance at this location in 1987.

ASSAULTS

Cass Brook Lane, 17000 block, 2 p.m. Feb. 9. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 54-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Featherstone Rd., 1500 block, 10:05 p.m. Feb. 7. Four males robbed a store at gunpoint.

Featherstone and Arizona roads, 12:02 a.m. Feb. 10. A group of men threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of cash. The victim was treated for a cut sustained during the incident.

Old Bridge Rd., 2000 block, 10:57 p.m. Feb. 5. Three males wearing masks robbed a gas station of cash at gunpoint.

Welsh Lane, 4300 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 8. Three males robbed a pizza deliveryman of cash and pizzas at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antietam Dr., 11800 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 8 to 12:46 a.m. Feb. 9. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

Bluefin Dr., 13800 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 2 to 9:30 p.m. Feb. 6. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Cornice Pl., 3500 block, 11:56 p.m. Feb. 8. Two males tried to break into a residence. Two Woodbridge males, 16 and 21, were arrested.

Directors Loop, 12700 block, 12:48 to 1:16 a.m. Feb. 12. A laptop computer, a cellphone and a hard drive were stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Freestone Ct., 12900 block, 5:45 a.m. to 3:40 p.m. Feb. 7. Four handguns, jewelry and cash were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Frontier Lane, 12800 block, 10:40 a.m. to noon Feb. 7. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Lake Ridge Dr., 12600 block, 8:13 p.m. Feb. 9. A laptop computer was stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

Point Pleasant Lane, 16900 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 8 to 6 p.m. Feb. 9. A handgun, a video game system and games were stolen from a residence.

Princeton St., 12200 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 26 to 10:20 a.m. Feb. 7. Medication was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front window.

Prince William Pkwy., 2400 block, 3:29 a.m. Feb. 9. Tablet computers were among property stolen from a store. A male who had hidden himself on the premises before closing time was seen fleeing with the property.

Woodmark Dr., 2800 block, 4:52 p.m. Feb. 5. A man entered a residence by forcing a front door. He fled empty-handed after threatening a returning resident at gunpoint.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Regiment Dr., 10300 block, 4:30 p.m. Feb. 10. A man pointed a gun at two people arguing with each in front of an apartment building. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Stonewall Rd., 9300 block, Feb. 10. A debit card was stolen from an unlocked vehicle. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kristy Dr., 2:45 to 6:14 p.m. Feb. 4. A package was stolen from the front porch of a residence.

VANDALISM

Cabbel Dr., 6:20 p.m. Feb. 8. A bedroom window was broken at a residence.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 890 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

VANDALISM

Alameda Dr., 4 p.m. April 15 to 9 p.m. April 16. A vehicle at a home was dented.  

Solitude Ct., 1:39 p.m. April 17. Eggs were thrown at a home, a vehicle's tires were deflated and a windshield wiper was broken. The vehicle was parked in the driveway.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rattlesnake Rd., April 20. A home was burglarized. Nothing was reported stolen.

Ropeknot Rd., April 20. A home was damaged while being entered. Nothing was reported taken.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Skinners Turn Rd., April 17. Property was stolen from a home.

PORT REPUBLIC AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broomes Island Rd., 7 p.m. April 15. Prescription drugs were among items taken from a locked file cabinet.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd., 8:10 p.m. April 16. During the sale of a laptop computer at an office supply store, a woman grabbed the laptop and fled in a gray or green Honda.

VANDALISM

Main St., 11:06 a.m. April 19. A vehicle was driven through a white plastic fence at a home.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catapla Rd., 6:29 p.m. April 18. A woman thought she had misplaced her cellphone. An investigation found that a St. Leonard man had it. A summons was issue, charging a man, 26, with theft and making a false statement to a police officer.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's office's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

NANJEMOY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Friendship Landing Park, 1:30 to 2:45 p.m. April 17. Two truck windows were broken, and a purse was stolen.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 2100 block, 7:50 p.m. April 21. A man with a gun approached two teenagers at a convenience store and demanded money. One of the teens punched the man, and he fled. An investigation revealed that the weapon was a BB gun. A Bryans Road man, 52, was charged with armed robbery.

Crain Hwy., 3100 block, 7:50 p.m. April 20. A motorist was pumping gas at a gas station when a man approached to talk. Another man took a pair of tennis shoes from the vehicle. Both men fled.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

ASSAULTS

California, April 20. A man hit an acquaintance with a bar stool. A California man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault.

CALLAWAY AREA

ASSAULTS

Callaway, April 21. During an argument, a man choked and punched an acquaintance. A Callaway man, 28, was charged with second-degree assault.

CHARLOTTE HALL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charlotte Hall, April 17. A woman attempted to use a fraudulent check at a grocery store. When a deputy tried to detain the woman, steaks fell out of her purse. An investigation revealed that she had used numerous fraudulent checks. A Hollywood woman, 35, was charged with forgery of private documents and possession of forged documents.

CLEMENTS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clements, April 25. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen.

HOLLYWOOD AREA

ASSAULTS

Clover Hill Rd., April 21. During an argument, a woman assaulted an acquaintance with a shoe and another object. A Hollywood woman, 31, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Leonardtown, April 21. Property was stolen from a shed at a home.

LEXINGTON PARK Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Lexington Park, April 24. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

Enterprise Rd., April 25. During an argument, someone stabbed two people.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lexington Park, April 19. During an investigation of a person riding a scooter on the roadway, it was discovered it had been stolen from a store. A Lexington Park man, 40, was charged with theft.

Pacific Dr., April 21. Property was stolen from a shed.

Spyglass Way, April 25. Property was stolen from a home.

Valley Ct., April 22. Two men were found sleeping in an apartment. A Lexington Park man, 22, and another man, 19, were charged with fourth-degree burglary. The 22-year-old was also charged with possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

Warwick Ct., April 24. Cash was stolen from a home.

Westbury, April 25. Property was stolen from a home.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Golden Beach, April 22. Several items were stolen from a work truck.

Patuxent Knolls Ct., April 21. Property was stolen from a shed.
