St. Mary's County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 462 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line, on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters, at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULT

AVENUE, Aug. 20. A woman, 44, and a man, 37, assaulted each other at a residence. They were charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

CALIFORNIA, 3:45 p.m. Sept. 2. A man, 18, was arrested for assaulting a woman at the Wal-Mart store. He was charged with fourth-degree sex offense.

ASSAULT

GREAT MILLS, 9 a.m. Aug. 31. A woman, 21, was arrested for assaulting another woman at the Brass Rail Saloon. She was charged with second-degree assault.

GREAT MILLS, 5:15 p.m. Aug. 26. A man, 34, assaulted a woman, 34, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREAT MILLS, 9 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. Aug. 26. A validation sticker was stolen from a license plate on a vehicle parked at a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HELEN, 2:25 a.m. Aug. 24. A man, 30, stole a license plate from a vehicle parked at a residence. He was charged with theft under $ 500.

ASSAULT

HOLLYWOOD, 12:15 a.m. Aug. 24. A man, 20, assaulted two women, ages 18 and 36, at a residence. He also kicked a hole

in the front door of the residence. He was charged with second-degree assault and malicious destruction of property under

$ 500.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HOLLYWOOD, midnight Aug. 16 to 3 p.m. Aug. 25. A boat trailer parked at Forest Landing Recreational Park was

damaged.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, noon to 6 p.m. Aug. 22. A Huffy bicycle was stolen from a residence.

NEWTOWNE NECK RD., 4 p.m. Aug. 31 to 6:39 a.m. Sept. 1. A 2001 Yamaha dirt bike was stolen from a shed at a residence. The bike was recovered later in a field.

ASSAULT

LEXINGTON PARK, 1:49 a.m. Aug. 30. A man, 31, assaulted officers who were arresting him. He was charged with five counts of second-degree assault, five counts of resisting arrest, disturbing the peace, attempting to disarm a police officer and being a fugitive from another area.

WILLOWS RD., 6:50 p.m. Aug. 15. A woman, 31, assaulted another woman, 52, at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, 1:30 p.m. Aug. 14. A man, 19, was arrested in the theft of several motorcycles. He was charged with theft over $ 500.

ASSAULT

MECHANICSVILLE, 8:05 p.m. Aug. 27. A man, 37, assaulted a female youth, 16. He was charged with child abuse.

MECHANICSVILLE, 6:20 a.m. Aug. 23. A man, 53, assaulted a woman, 38, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 893 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Arrowfield Trail, 5500 block, 11 p.m. July 14 to 7 a.m. July 15. Two bikes were stolen from a garage entered by using a garage door-opener device in a vehicle.

Piedmont Vista Dr., 13800 block, 5:40 to 9:40 p.m. July 12. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement door. 

MANASSAS AREA

ROBBERIES

Sudley Road and Lomond Drive, 2:03 a.m. July 15. A man hit a male pedestrian on the head with a bottle and robbed him of a briefcase containing a laptop, a camera and other property.

NOKESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristow Ridge Lane, 12400 block, 12:24 a.m. July 13. Police found a vehicle in a ditch. The vehicle contained a stolen air conditioner and burglary tools. A 26-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Fuller Heights Rd., 18700 block, 2:50 a.m. July 16. Three men assaulted a male motorist in a vehicle at a convenience store parking lot. They checked his pockets before allowing the motorist to drive away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Candice Dr., 18300 block, 6:45 to 8:15 a.m. July 14. Three long guns, a handgun, electronics and other property were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Pearson Drive, 10 a.m. July 13. A man raped a female juvenile acquaintance at a residence. A 26-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested at the residence and charged with rape. Police returned to the residence at 12:40 a.m. the next day after another man and two male juveniles had been seen running from the residence. The three had gone to the residence in retaliation of the sexual assault. An 18-year-old man and a 17-year-old male, both of Woodbridge, and a 15-year-old District male were arrested and charged with burglary.

ASSAULTS

Kelly Rd., 4700 block, 1:30 p.m. July 14. A man hit a male acquaintance on the head with a blunt object. The acquaintance was treated for injuries.

Madrigal Dr., 14100 block, 9:56 p.m. July 12. A man assaulted a male and female acquaintance, then spit at a police officer who was attempting to restrain him. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Whitaker Pl., 4600 block, 1:58 p.m. July 16. A man fired a shotgun toward a neighbor's dog as it ran across a parking lot. No injuries were reported. A 59-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 4300 block, 12:25 a.m. July 13. Three men assaulted two male pedestrians and robbed one of a wallet. The other pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Delaney Rd., 13500 block, 7:41 p.m. July 17. One of two male juveniles demanded money from a male juvenile acquaintance, threatening to beat him. The two fled with cash. A 13-year-old Woodbridge boy was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Farm Creek Dr., 15400 block, 4:59 a.m. July 19. Several generators and tools were stolen from a business entered by cutting a fence.

Fern Pl., 16600 block, 3:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. July 14. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Ferry Landing Lane, 13300 block, 7 a.m. July 13 to 5:30 a.m. July 14. A briefcase, a wallet and cash were stolen from four unlocked vehicles.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14300 block, 4 p.m. July 16 to 6:10 a.m. July 17. A business was entered by breaking a rear glass door.

Landings Point Loop, 2700 block, 9 a.m. July 14 to 1 p.m. July 15. Two TVs, a video game system and DVDs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Prather Pl., 4600 block, 5 p.m. June 26 to 10 a.m. July 14. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Ridge View Ct., 3200 block, 9:45 p.m. July 17 to 8 a.m. July 18. Someone attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maple St., 9300 block, 11 p.m. July 12 to 3 p.m. July 13. A CD player was stolen from a vehicle.

Phoenix Dr., 8500 block, 6 p.m. July 14 to 10:45 p.m. July 15. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Taney Rd., 9300 block, June 27 to July 13. An air conditioner was stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Portner Ave., 8800 block, 1 a.m. to 11:15 p.m. July 17. A window of a vehicle was broken.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

ASSAULTS

Kirby St., 300 block, 11:55 p.m. July 7. During a party at a residence, a man and a woman began fighting with guests. They left in a vehicle and reportedly refused to stop for police. The vehicle was stopped on Quarry Road in Manassas, and the two fled on foot. A 30-year-old man and a 26-year-old woman, both of Manassas, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Manassas Dr., 9300 block, 4:40 p.m. July 1 to July 6. A laptop was stolen after it was left on a train.

VANDALISM

Carondelet Dr., 9200 block, 10 p.m. July 13 to 6 a.m. July 14. A pool at a school was vandalized.

Manassas Dr., 9600 block, 11 a.m. July 9 to 10:30 a.m. July 10. The hood of a vehicle was dented.

Manassas Dr., 9700 block, 7:18 p.m. July 7. Eight male juveniles used a golf flagpole to scrape grass on the golf course.

Matthew Dr., 9200 block, 11 p.m. July 10 to 5:30 a.m. July 11. A vehicle was scratched with a key.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1011 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA VANDALISM  

Alameda Dr., 4 p.m. April 15 to 9 p.m. April 16. A vehicle at a home was dented.

Solitude Ct.,1:39 p.m. April 17. Eggs were thrown at a home, a vehicle's tires were deflated and a windshield wiper was broken. The vehicle was parked in the driveway.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rattlesnake Rd.,April 20. A home was burglarized. Nothing was reported stolen.

Ropeknot Rd.,April 20. A home was damaged while being entered. Nothing was reported taken.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Skinners Turn Rd.,April 17. Property was stolen from a home.

PORT REPUBLIC AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broomes Island Rd.,7 p.m. April 15. Prescription drugs were among items taken from a locked file cabinet.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd.,8:10 p.m. April 16. During the sale of a laptop computer at an office supply store, a woman grabbed the laptop and fled in a gray or green Honda.

VANDALISM

Main St.,11:06 a.m. April 19. A vehicle was driven through a white plastic fence at a home.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catapla Rd.,6:29 p.m. April 18. A woman thought she had misplaced her cellphone. An investigation found that a St. Leonard man had it. A summons was issue, charging a man, 26, with theft and making a false statement to a police officer.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's office's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

NANJEMOY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Friendship Landing Park,1:30 to 2:45 p.m. April 17. Two truck windows were broken, and a purse was stolen.

WALDORF AREA ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy.,2100 block, 7:50 p.m. April 21. A man with a gun approached two teenagers at a convenience store and demanded money. One of the teens punched the man, and he fled. An investigation revealed that the weapon was a BB gun. A Bryans Road man, 52, was charged with armed robbery.

Crain Hwy.,3100 block, 7:50 p.m. April 20. A motorist was pumping gas at a gas station when a man approached to talk. Another man took a pair of tennis shoes from the vehicle. Both men fled.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA ASSAULTS

California, April 20. A man hit an acquaintance with a bar stool. A California man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault.

CALLAWAY AREA ASSAULTS

Callaway,April 21. During an argument, a man choked and punched an acquaintance. A Callaway man, 28, was charged with second-degree assault.

CHARLOTTE HALL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charlotte Hall,April 17. A woman attempted to use a fraudulent check at a grocery store. When a deputy tried to detain the woman, steaks fell out of her purse. An investigation revealed that she had used numerous fraudulent checks. A Hollywood woman, 35, was charged with forgery of private documents and possession of forged documents.

CLEMENTS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clements,April 25. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen.

HOLLYWOOD AREA ASSAULTS

Clover Hill Rd.,April 21. During an argument, a woman assaulted an acquaintance with a shoe and another object. A Hollywood woman, 31, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Leonardtown,April 21. Property was stolen from a shed at a home.

LEXINGTON PARK Area SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park,April 24. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

Enterprise Rd., April 25. During an argument, someone stabbed two people.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lexington Park,April 19. During an investigation of a person riding a scooter on the roadway, it was discovered it had been stolen from a store. A Lexington Park man, 40, was charged with theft.

Pacific Dr.,April 21. Property was stolen from a shed.

Spyglass Way, April 25. Property was stolen from a home.

Valley Ct.,April 22. Two men were found sleeping in an apartment. A Lexington Park man, 22, and another man, 19, were charged with fourth-degree burglary. The 22-year-old was also charged with possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 938 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy., 5600 block, 2:26 a.m. Oct. 5. During an altercation at a convenience store, a 23-year-old man was stabbed by an unidentified male.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Disney Ave., 5200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 7. A man was seen leaving a vacant home that had been burglarized. A Baltimore man, 46, was charged with burglary, destruction of property and disorderly conduct.  

Wasena Ave., 5200 block, 3:27 a.m. Oct. 7. Three males broke into a trailer and stole an ATV. A Baltimore male, 17, was charged with theft and destruction of property.

CROWNSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Generals Hwy., 1200 block, 5:30 a.m. Oct. 7. A school bus was stolen from a lot at a bus company. The bus was damaged after it was crashed in a wooded area. There was an attempt to set the bus on fire. A Crownsville man, 24, and a Davidsonville woman, 24, were charged with first-degree burglary, theft, destruction of property and attempted arson.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy., Sept. 4. Officers went to a local hospital to investigate a report of a sexual assault of a female that had occurred Sept. 2 after she had asked for a ride from a stranger. The male drove to a parking lot and forced the female into sexual act.

ASSAULTS

East Furnace Branch Rd., 7500 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 7. During a dispute, a man assaulted an acquaintance and dragged her from an apartment to a back yard. A Glen Burnie man, 34, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, home invasion and third- and fourth-degree burglary.

ROBBERIES

Delaware Ave., 600 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 6. A 22-year-old pedestrian was assaulted, and an attempt was made to take his cellphone and bag. Two male robbers fled on bikes.

HANOVER AREA

ROBBERIES

East Plateau Dr., 7500 block, 10:35 a.m. Oct. 5. A 17-year-old pedestrian was assaulted and robbed by three male youths.

LINTHICUM AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Camp Meade Rd., 400 block, 4:02 p.m. Sept. 8. Glass in a front door at a store was broken, and 19 cartons of cigarettes were stolen.

ODENTON AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Odenton, Sept. 29. During an investigation of people soliciting sex from young females on the Internet, an Odenton man, 29, and an Annapolis man, 42, were arrested and charged with sexual solicitation of a minor.

PASADENA AREA

ASSAULTS

Huff Ct., 7800 block, Sept. 29. After a report of a gunshot, a man, 27, was found with gunshot wounds to his upper body. He was taken to an area hospital.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

ROBBERIES

Tyler Ave., 1300 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 3. A male pedestrian was hit on the head with a gun and robbed by male youths.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bestgate Rd., Sept. 12. Someone left an iPad on a display counter at an Apple Store in a mall, and it was stolen. A Capitol Heights male, 30, and a Capitol Heights woman, 24, were charged with theft.

Clay St., 200 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 1 to 9:30 a.m. Oct. 2. Tools were stolen from a work van.

WEAPONS

Frederick Douglass St., 1100 block, 1:35 p.m. Oct. 4. Officers responded to a report of a gunshot. Shell casings were found on the ground. No injuries were reported.

Madison St., 1100 block, 2:45 a.m. Oct. 3. Officers responded to a report of a gunshot. Shell casings were found on the ground. No injuries were reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Williams Dr., 6:45 p.m. Oct. 6 to 6 a.m. Oct. 7. A Toyota Corolla that had been involved in a single-vehicle accident was stolen.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Green Meadow Dr., 12200 block, 9:58 p.m. Oct. 2. A male was assaulted and robbed by three males.

Minstrel Way, 7100 block, 9:46 p.m. Oct. 4. A fast-food restaurant was robbed at gunpoint.

Procopio Cir., 7200 block, 11:41 p.m. July 30. Two men forcibly entered a home, threatened occupants with shotguns and robbed them of cellphones and cash. On Sept. 30, officers arrested two Ellicott City men, 31 and 35, and charged them with armed robbery, use of a firearm in commission of a robbery, assault, theft and several drug and weapon violations.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cardinal Lane, 6400 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 6 to 7 a.m. Oct. 7. Three bicycles were stolen from an open garage.

Dockside Lane, 7200 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 7. Two bicycles were stolen from a back yard.

Harpers Farm Rd., 5400 block, 10:41 a.m. Oct. 1. A man was found attempting to break into an apartment. A Norfolk, Va., man, 25, was charged with burglary and destruction of property.

Cradlerock Way, 7200 block, 10:07 p.m. Oct. 2. A 2011 Honda Accord was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Marie Curie Dr., 6600 block, 11:04 a.m. Oct. 3. A male exposed himself to a female motorist.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

MOUNT AIRY AREA

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 837 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

GAINESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Heythorpe Ct., 13600 block, 2 p.m. March 20. A man being served with a warrant attacked three police officers, breaking a pair of eyeglasses and causing a laceration to an officer's forehead. A 29-year-old Gainesville man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Bosna Ct., 10300 block, 7 p.m. March 19 to 6:45 p.m. March 21. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Bristow Rd., 14700 block, 3 a.m. March 22. Beer was stolen from a business entered by breaking a side window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Touchstone Circle area, 11:25 p.m. March 25. A man attacked a juvenile acquaintance. A 26-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Kellogg Dr., 4800 block, 4:31 p.m. March 25. Three male juveniles attacked a juvenile acquaintance on a basketball court and knocked him to the ground, then fled when a witness intervened. The victim was treated at the scene for serious but non-life-threatening injuries.

ROBBERIES

Bisbee Ct. and Bixby Rd., 11:36 p.m. March 23. Two males tried to take a purse from a pedestrian, then fled empty-handed when she resisted.

Build America Dr., 14800 block, 2:21 p.m. March 21. Two men robbed a business of cash at gunpoint.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 1:59 a.m. March 22. During a fight at a restaurant, a group of men knocked a man to the ground, then fled with his cellphone. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blackburn Rd., 15500 block, 4 p.m. March 16 to 9 a.m. March 21. A historically significant building was entered through an unlocked window. Nothing was reported missing.

Bobolink Dr., 15800 block, 3 p.m. March 19 to 8:30 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Cottonwood Ct., 1400 block, 9:30 p.m. March 25 to 5 p.m. March 26. A video game system and a video game were stolen from a residence.

Creekview Cir., 12200 block, 9 p.m. March 15 to 9 a.m. March 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing the front door.

Darlington Loop, 1900 block, 11:56 a.m. March 21. Two males trying to break into a residence through a rear window fled when confronted. Two Woodbridge males, ages 15 and 18, were arrested.

Featherstone Rd., 1400 block, 1:27 p.m. March 25. Two men entered a business by forcing a side door, then fled empty-handed.

Marina Way, 13200 block, 6:11 a.m. March 24. A man broke into a work trailer, took keys to a company truck, then crashed the vehicle into a locked gate. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Mendoza Lane, 15600 block, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 20. A video game system, a camera and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Royal Ct., 16500 block, 12:30 to 6:30 p.m. March 23. A computer was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Wigglesworth Way, 1800 block, 10:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. March 19. Two laptops, a desktop computer, two video game systems, a TV and games were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Wink Way, 2700 block, 4:15 p.m. March 23 to 7:15 a.m. March 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence under construction by forcing the front door.

Wyndale Ct., 3300 block, 4:15 to 8 p.m. March 21. Four computers were stolen from a residence.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Signal Hill Rd., 8700 block, 1:45 a.m. March 22. During an argument, a man struck a male in the face with a bottle. A 21-year-old Manassas man was charged with aggravated assault. During the ride to the police station, he was also charged with spitting in public.

ROBBERIES

Dumfries Rd., 14000 block, 3:25 a.m. March 23. A man armed with a pellet gun robbed a convenience store of cash and cartons of cigarettes.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Phoenix Dr., 8600 block, 6 to 6:20 p.m. March 20. Cash was stolen from an occupied motel room.

VANDALISM

Byrd Dr., 9200 block, 10:30 p.m. March 20. Two vehicles were damaged.

Wharton Ct., 9100 block, 1 a.m. March 22. A male was confronted while pouring sugar into a vehicle. He fled to a waiting vehicle.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Industry Dr., 9100 block, 7:35 a.m. March 24. More than 250 gallons of water were pumped into a vehicle from a municipal fire hydrant. Two Dale City men, ages 37 and 45, were arrested.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 983 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

HAYMARKET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Arrowfield Trail, 5500 block, 11 p.m. July 14 to 7 a.m. July 15. Two bikes were stolen from a garage entered by using a garage door-opener device in a vehicle.

Piedmont Vista Dr., 13800 block, 5:40 to 9:40 p.m. July 12. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement door. 

MANASSAS AREA ROBBERIES

Sudley Road and Lomond Drive, 2:03 a.m. July 15. A man hit a male pedestrian on the head with a bottle and robbed him of a briefcase containing a laptop, a camera and other property.

NOKESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristow Ridge Lane, 12400 block, 12:24 a.m. July 13. Police found a vehicle in a ditch. The vehicle contained a stolen air conditioner and burglary tools. A 26-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA ROBBERIES

Fuller Heights Rd., 18700 block, 2:50 a.m. July 16. Three men assaulted a male motorist in a vehicle at a convenience store parking lot. They checked his pockets before allowing the motorist to drive away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Candice Dr., 18300 block, 6:45 to 8:15 a.m. July 14. Three long guns, a handgun, electronics and other property were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Pearson Drive, 10 a.m. July 13. A man raped a female juvenile acquaintance at a residence. A 26-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested at the residence and charged with rape. Police returned to the residence at 12:40 a.m. the next day after another man and two male juveniles had been seen running from the residence. The three had gone to the residence in retaliation of the sexual assault. An 18-year-old man and a 17-year-old male, both of Woodbridge, and a 15-year-old District male were arrested and charged with burglary.

ASSAULTS

Kelly Rd., 4700 block, 1:30 p.m. July 14. A man hit a male acquaintance on the head with a blunt object. The acquaintance was treated for injuries.

Madrigal Dr., 14100 block, 9:56 p.m. July 12. A man assaulted a male and female acquaintance, then spit at a police officer who was attempting to restrain him. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Whitaker Pl., 4600 block, 1:58 p.m. July 16. A man fired a shotgun toward a neighbor's dog as it ran across a parking lot. No injuries were reported. A 59-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 4300 block, 12:25 a.m. July 13. Three men assaulted two male pedestrians and robbed one of a wallet. The other pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Delaney Rd., 13500 block, 7:41 p.m. July 17. One of two male juveniles demanded money from a male juvenile acquaintance, threatening to beat him. The two fled with cash. A 13-year-old Woodbridge boy was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Farm Creek Dr., 15400 block, 4:59 a.m. July 19. Several generators and tools were stolen from a business entered by cutting a fence.

Fern Pl., 16600 block, 3:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. July 14. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Ferry Landing Lane, 13300 block, 7 a.m. July 13 to 5:30 a.m. July 14. A briefcase, a wallet and cash were stolen from four unlocked vehicles.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14300 block, 4 p.m. July 16 to 6:10 a.m. July 17. A business was entered by breaking a rear glass door.

Landings Point Loop, 2700 block, 9 a.m. July 14 to 1 p.m. July 15. Two TVs, a video game system and DVDs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Prather Pl., 4600 block, 5 p.m. June 26 to 10 a.m. July 14. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Ridge View Ct., 3200 block, 9:45 p.m. July 17 to 8 a.m. July 18. Someone attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maple St., 9300 block, 11 p.m. July 12 to 3 p.m. July 13. A CD player was stolen from a vehicle.

Phoenix Dr., 8500 block, 6 p.m. July 14 to 10:45 p.m. July 15. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Taney Rd., 9300 block, June 27 to July 13. An air conditioner was stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Portner Ave., 8800 block, 1 a.m. to 11:15 p.m. July 17. A window of a vehicle was broken.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

ASSAULTS

Kirby St., 300 block, 11:55 p.m. July 7. During a party at a residence, a man and a woman began fighting with guests. They left in a vehicle and reportedly refused to stop for police. The vehicle was stopped on Quarry Road in Manassas, and the two fled on foot. A 30-year-old man and a 26-year-old woman, both of Manassas, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Manassas Dr., 9300 block, 4:40 p.m. July 1 to July 6. A laptop was stolen after it was left on a train.

VANDALISM

Carondelet Dr., 9200 block, 10 p.m. July 13 to 6 a.m. July 14. A pool at a school was vandalized.

Manassas Dr., 9700 block, 7:18 p.m. July 7. Eight male juveniles used a golf flagpole to scrape grass on the golf course.

Matthew Dr., 9200 block, 11 p.m. July 10 to 5:30 a.m. July 11. A vehicle was scratched with a key.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1050 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy.,5600 block, 2:26 a.m. Oct. 5. During an altercation at a convenience store, a 23-year-old man was stabbed by an unidentified male.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Disney Ave.,5200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 7. A man was seen leaving a vacant home that had been burglarized. A Baltimore man, 46, was charged with burglary, destruction of property and disorderly conduct.

Wasena Ave.,5200 block, 3:27 a.m. Oct. 7. Three males broke into a trailer and stole an ATV. A Baltimore male, 17, was charged with theft and destruction of property.

CROWNSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Generals Hwy.,1200 block, 5:30 a.m. Oct. 7. A school bus was stolen from a lot at a bus company. The bus was damaged after it was crashed in a wooded area. There was an attempt to set the bus on fire. A Crownsville man, 24, and a Davidsonville woman, 24, were charged with first-degree burglary, theft, destruction of property and attempted arson.

GLEN BURNIE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy.,Sept. 4. Officers went to a local hospital to investigate a report of a sexual assault of a female that had occurred Sept. 2 after she had asked for a ride from a stranger. The male drove to a parking lot and forced the female into sexual act.

ASSAULTS

East Furnace Branch Rd.,7500 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 7. During a dispute, a man assaulted an acquaintance and dragged her from an apartment to a back yard. A Glen Burnie man, 34, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, home invasion and third- and fourth-degree burglary.

ROBBERIES

Delaware Ave.,600 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 6. A 22-year-old pedestrian was assaulted, and an attempt was made to take his cellphone and bag. Two male robbers fled on bikes.

HANOVER AREA ROBBERIES

East Plateau Dr.,7500 block, 10:35 a.m. Oct. 5. A 17-year-old pedestrian was assaulted and robbed by three male youths.

LINTHICUM AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Camp Meade Rd.,400 block, 4:02 p.m. Sept. 8. Glass in a front door at a store was broken, and 19 cartons of cigarettes were stolen.

ODENTON AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Odenton,Sept. 29. During an investigation of people soliciting sex from young females on the Internet, an Odenton man, 29, and an Annapolis man, 42, were arrested and charged with sexual solicitation of a minor.

PASADENA AREA ASSAULTS

Huff Ct.,7800 block, Sept. 29. After a report of a gunshot, a man, 27, was found with gunshot wounds to his upper body. He was taken to an area hospital.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

ROBBERIES

Tyler Ave.,1300 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 3. A male pedestrian was hit on the head with a gun and robbed by male youths.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bestgate Rd.,Sept. 12. Someone left an iPad on a display counter at an Apple Store in a mall, and it was stolen. A Capitol Heights male, 30, and a Capitol Heights woman, 24, were charged with theft.

Clay St.,200 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 1 to 9:30 a.m. Oct. 2. Tools were stolen from a work van.

WEAPONS

Frederick Douglass St.,1100 block, 1:35 p.m. Oct. 4. Officers responded to a report of a gunshot. Shell casings were found on the ground. No injuries were reported.

Madison St.,1100 block, 2:45 a.m. Oct. 3. Officers responded to a report of a gunshot. Shell casings were found on the ground. No injuries were reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Williams Dr.,6:45 p.m. Oct. 6 to 6 a.m. Oct. 7. A Toyota Corolla that had been involved in a single-vehicle accident was stolen.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Green Meadow Dr.,12200 block, 9:58 p.m. Oct. 2. A male was assaulted and robbed by three males.

Minstrel Way,7100 block, 9:46 p.m. Oct. 4. A fast-food restaurant was robbed at gunpoint.

Procopio Cir.,7200 block, 11:41 p.m. July 30. Two men forcibly entered a home, threatened occupants with shotguns and robbed them of cellphones and cash. On Sept. 30, officers arrested two Ellicott City men, 31 and 35, and charged them with armed robbery, use of a firearm in commission of a robbery, assault, theft and several drug and weapon violations.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cardinal Lane,6400 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 6 to 7 a.m. Oct. 7. Three bicycles were stolen from an open garage.

Dockside Lane,7200 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 7. Two bicycles were stolen from a back yard.

Harpers Farm Rd.,5400 block, 10:41 a.m. Oct. 1. A man was found attempting to break into an apartment. A Norfolk, Va., man, 25, was charged with burglary and destruction of property.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cradlerock Way,7200 block, 10:07 p.m. Oct. 2. A 2011 Honda Accord was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Levering Ave.,5400 block, 11:47 a.m. Oct. 5. An employee at a parcel delivery business saw a man enter the business through a side door. A Millersville man, 56, was charged with burglary.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Marie Curie Dr.,6600 block, 11:04 a.m. Oct. 3. A male exposed himself to a female motorist.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA ROBBERIES

Rogers Ave.,3000 block, 12:08 a.m. Oct. 6. A convenience store was robbed at gunpoint.

JESSUP AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Guilford Rd.,9900 block, 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Oct. 7. An attempt was made to force open a shed.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Dorsey Run Rd.,8000 block, 7:11 p.m. Oct. 7. A tractor trailer was stolen.MOUNT AIRY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Watersville Rd.,1300 block, Oct. 3 to Oct. 6. Chain saws and a vehicle battery were stolen from a basement at a home.

June 28, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Anne Arundel and Howard crime report Anne Arundel and Howard crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1073 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with these and other felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment. Brooklyn Park area ROBBERIES

Park Rd., 11:47 a.m. June 15. A man forced his way into a residence at gunpoint and restrained an occupant, then fled with jewelry and cash in a white vehicle. The victim was treated for injuries at the scene.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ASSAULTS  

Warfield Dr. and Flamingo Rd., 1:21 a.m. June 21. A man and a woman offered a ride to a teenage acquaintance, picking him up in the 5600 block of Ritchie Highway. During the ride to the above location, the two males argued, and the man stabbed the teenager several times. The man and woman fled in the vehicle. The teenager was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries that were not considered life-threatening.

ROBBERIES

Carroll Rd., 100 block, 2:28 p.m. June 19. Three men knocked two males from their bicycles, then stole the bikes.

Crain Hwy., 1200 block, 5:35 a.m. June 18. A man robbed a restaurant of cash at gunpoint.

Parke West Dr., 7800 block, 3:47 a.m. June 21. Three males got out of a vehicle near an apartment building, then attacked a man smoking a cigarette, chasing him to the back of the building, where he fell to the ground. The men robbed him of a wallet and fled in a 1990s-model light-colored Cadillac with a red roof. No serious injuries were reported.

HANOVER AREA ROBBERIES

Annapolis Rd.,2600 block, 7:54 a.m. June 15. A man wearing what was described as a police uniform robbed a grocery store of cash at gunpoint, then fled in a light-colored Honda sedan.

ODENTON AREA ROBBERIES

Annapolis Rd., 1200 block, 12:09 a.m. June 16. A man robbed a pizza delivery driver loading a vehicle of cash at gunpoint, then fled on foot.

Quiet Spring Dr. near Town Center Blvd., 7:50 p.m. June 14. Two male teenagers asked a teenager a question, then punched and kicked him and robbed him of cash and property from his pockets. No serious injuries were reported.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or other suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Spa Creek area, June 16. An Annapolis man, 34, was arrested in connection with the attack of an acquaintance's child. Charges included rape, second- and third-degree sexual assault and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., 300 block, 2:30 p.m. June 16 to 1:45 a.m. June 17. A flat-screen TV was stolen from a home. There was no sign of forced entry.

Bay Forest Ct., 900 block, 3:34 a.m. June 19. Three unlocked vehicles were entered. Nothing was reported missing.

Bay Ridge Ave., 1800 block, 11 p.m. June 17 to 12:25 p.m. June 18. A cellphone was stolen from a vehicle.

Conley Dr., 100 block, 7 a.m. June 18 to 6:45 a.m. June 19. A credit card was stolen from a purse in an unlocked vehicle.

Fleet St., unit block, 9:30 p.m. June 14 to 5:30 a.m. June 15. A purse was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Hudson St., unit block, 10:30 p.m. June 21. An attempt was made to break into a garage by removing a pane from a door. Nothing was reported missing.

President St., 1000 block, 10 to 11:05 a.m. June 19. A purse was stolen from an office. It was recovered in a restroom. Cash was missing.

Prince George St., 100 block, 8 p.m. June 14 to 7:45 a.m. June 15. A bicycle was stolen.

Robert Small Rd., 1800 block, April 1 to June 16. Property was stolen from a storage room.

West St., 2000 block, 9:12 p.m. June 15. A tire was stolen from a bicycle.

Second St., 500 block, 6 p.m. June 20. A bicycle was stolen, and a witness saw a male riding it toward Severn Avenue. At 7:40 p.m., the bike was recovered in the 1100 block of Madison Street. An Annapolis man, 18, was charged with theft.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Croll Dr., 200 block, 6 to 9:45 p.m. June 20. A yellow-and-white scooter was stolen from a parking lot.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other crimes, call the Stop Crime tip line, 410-313-7867.

COLUMBIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

April Brook Cir., 6200 block, 7 p.m. June 16 to 7:45 a.m. June 17. Cash, credit cards and a cellphone were stolen from a garage. A Columbia man, 34, was arrested. Charges included burglary, credit-card fraud, drug possession, possession of a skimming device and theft.

Hyla Brook Dr., 10000 block, 7 p.m. June 15 to 8 a.m. June 16. Copper wire was stolen from a construction site.

Mallard Ct., 8900 block, 4:03 p.m. June 15. An attempt was made to enter a vacant house by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Woodpark Lane, 7600 block, 2 p.m. June 16 to 1:40 a.m. June 17. Jewelry was stolen from an apartment entered by prying open the front door.

ELKRIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Santa Barbara Rd., 6600 block, 11 p.m. June 15 to 12:44 a.m. June 16. A cash drawer was stolen from a business.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore National Pike, 8000 block, 9:45 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. June 15. DVD players and DVDs were stolen from a motel room entered by forcing a door.

Font Hill Dr., 3400 block, 12:30 to 11 a.m. June 16. Bicycles were stolen from a carport entered by forcing a screen door.

Rome Red Way, 5000 block, 9:11 a.m. June 16. A man entered an open garage at a residence, then fled in a vehicle when confronted. A Halethorpe man, 51, was charged with burglary.

Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T19


LENGTH: 1628 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

CROFTON AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ridgely Ct. and Aberdeen Dr., 3:20 p.m. Sept. 13. Two men sexually assaulted a teenager who was walking a dog, then drove away in a red, older-model four-door sedan. The victim was treated at a hospital. Anyone with information is asked to contact J. Widup, a detective with the Sex Offense Unit, 410-222-3468.

CROWNSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS
 

Walnut Trail, 300 block, 1:28 a.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from the back yard of a residence. A Ford F-350 pickup that had been identified by a neighbor was stopped a short time later and found to contain tools and wire taken from a vehicle parked at a residence on Walnut Trail and property that had been reported stolen from a truck on First Street in Annapolis. A Harwood man, 53, a Bowie man, 24, and a Davidsonville man, 25, were charged with several counts of burglary, theft, destruction of property and with being rogue and vagabond.

EDGEWATER AREA

ROBBERIES

Highland Dr., 300 block, 10:43 a.m. Sept. 9. Three males forced their way into a residence and robbed an acquaintance of property. An Edgewater male, 17, an Edgewater man, 21, and a Harwood man, 19, were arrested. Charges included armed robbery, assault, felony theft and burglary.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ROBBERIES

Lamplighter Ridge, 6400 block, 3:52 p.m. Sept. 14. A male teenager punched a younger boy and robbed him of a bicycle. No serious injuries were reported.

Ritchie Hwy., 7200 block, 3:47 a.m. Sept. 11. During an attempted robbery, a man stabbed a gas-station clerk, then fled on foot to a cemetery. A Glen Burnie man, 22, was charged with attempted second-degree murder, two counts of robbery, first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment. The victim was treated for non-life-threatening injuries at a hospital.

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block,1:21 a.m. Sept. 14. A man who implied that he had a weapon robbed a motel of cash, then fled on foot.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Laurel Fort Meade Rd., 3400 block, 9:53 p.m. Sept. 11. Two males wearing ski masks tried to rob a fast-food restaurant of cash at gunpoint. When employees proved unable to open the cash registers, the males robbed them of cash from their purses.

RIVA AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Riva and Centre roads, 3:20 p.m. Sept. 13. A man driving a white minivan offered a ride to a girl who had just gotten off a bus. The girl refused and ran away.

SEVERN AREA

SUSPICIOUS DEATHS

Gambrills Rd., 100 block, 7:45 a.m. Sept. 10. The body of Peter Anthony Dembrowicz, 30, was found in Severn Run stream, not far from his home. He had not been seen since going out for a walk at about 10 p.m. An investigation was continuing.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. Call 410-280-2583o to anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Annapolis Walk Dr., 5:30 a.m. Sept. 13. An attempt was made to break into a house through a back window.

Newtowne Dr., 700 block, 7 a.m. Sept. 7 to 4 p.m. Sept. 8. A laptop, frozen food and cash were stolen from an apartment at which a window had been left unlocked.

Stonecreek Rd., 1400 block, 10:44 p.m. Sept. 9. A laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a back door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

West St., 1-99 block, 1 to 2:40 a.m. Sept. 11. A vehicle was stolen using a key that had been left inside. The vehicle was recovered that same day in the unit block of Dock Street.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. Call 410-313-2236 for information. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Waverly Winds, 5:38 a.m. Sept. 10. Three males attacked a pedestrian on a path and robbed him of cash and a cellphone. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broadcloth Way, 7500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 8. A digital media player and a laptop were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Cradlerock Way, 7200 block, 2:47 a.m. Sept. 11. A laptop and cash were stolen from a hair salon entered through an unlocked back door.

Rawhide Ridge, 6900 block, 11:21 a.m. Sept. 7. An attempt was made to break into a residence by tampering with an alarm system.

Trotting Ridge Way, 10900 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 10 to 10:13 p.m. Sept. 12. TVs, computers, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Two Ships Ct., 11000 block, 1 p.m. Sept. 9 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 12. A residence was entered by breaking a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Stipa Ct., 6600 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 10. A vehicle that had been reported stolen was recovered in Baltimore.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

Mount Ida Dr., 3500 block, 12:33 a.m Sept. 11. A break-in occurred.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

FULTON AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pleasant View Dr., 12300 block, 10:25 a.m. Sept. 12. After receiving no response when he rang a doorbell at a residence, a male tried to break in through the basement. The intruder fled in a vehicle when confronted.

HANOVER AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

River Birch Ct., 6000 block, 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. Sept. 11. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle in an open garage.

JESSUP AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Stayton Dr., 8300 block, 3 p.m. Sept. 5. A vehicle was stolen.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Glen Ridge Dr., 9400 block, 12:54 p.m. Sept. 9. Three people tried to rob a pedestrian of cash at knifepoint. The victim ran away and the assailants briefly gave chase. No injuries were reported.

Washington Blvd., 9900 block, 12:45 a.m. Sept. 9. Three people got out of a vehicle and attacked a male pedestrian, who refused to give them cash. The victim was able to call police from a nearby business. A Laurel man, 19, and a Burtonsville man, 20, were charged with attempted robbery and conspiracy to commit robbery. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alma Ave., unit block, 10 p.m. Sept. 7. A man tried to force his way into an acquaintance's residence through the front door. A Laurel man, 21, was charged with fourth-degree burglary, malicious destruction of property and trespassing.

Moonshine Hollow, 9000 block, 5:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 13. A residence was entered by breaking glass in a front door. Electronics and clothing were destroyed and other property was moved around, but nothing was reported missing.

Redbridge Ct., 9200 block, 11:15 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. Sept. 13. A video game and a digital-media player docking station were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Sandy Stream Rd., 8200 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 6 to 7 a.m. Sept. 7. A laptop and a cellphone were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage. A navigator was stolen from the garage.

Sylvan Still, 9500 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 11. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by kicking in the front door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Barrel House Rd., 9600 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 8 to 4:57 a.m. Sept. 9. A black-and-red 2003 Honda CBR motorcycle was stolen.

Livery Lane, 9200 block, 9:50 a.m. Sept. 9. A 2000 Yamaha R1 motorcycle was stolen.

Sperry Ct., 8300 block, 9:36 a.m. Sept. 10. A 2008 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

Stebbing Way, 9000 block, 9:58 p.m. Sept. 8. A dark-blue 2004 Chevrolet Trailblazer was stolen.

Washington Blvd., 10000 block, 10:37 a.m. Sept. 9. An 18-wheel truck and an attached trailer were stolen.

Washington Blvd., 9100 block, 9:24 a.m. Sept. 9. A trailer was stolen.

MOUNT AIRY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mullinix Mill Rd., 2400 block, 11:30 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. Sept. 13. A break-in occurred at a residence. Property was moved around, but nothing was reported missing. There was no sign of forced entry.

Old Frederick Rd., 17200 block, Aug. 18 to Aug. 20. A TV was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1382 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

DUNKIRK AREA

VANDALISM

Lancer Ct., July 23 to July 34. A vehicle window was smashed.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dasher Dr., 5:59 p.m., July 28. An iPhone was stolen from a home during a party. 

H.G. Trueman Rd., July 23 to July 24. Lawn equipment was stolen from two sheds at a church.

VANDALISM

Garner Rd., 12:51 p.m., July 29. A vehicle tire was cut.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Scaggs Rd., 6200 block, July 24 to July 25. Tools were stolen from a maintenance shed at a golf course.

Scaggs Rd., 6200 block, July 27 to July 28. Property was stolen from an office at a golf course.

PRINCE FREDERICK

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dares Beach Rd., 5:10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., July 27. A camera, jewelry and a handgun were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Main St., 6:44 p.m., July 25. During a traffic stop, a motorist was found to have an open warrant and to be in possession of stolen credit cards. A Huntingtown woman, 32, was arrested.

Sixes Rd., 5:38 p.m., July 25. A laptop computer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

SOLOMONS AREA

ASSAULTS

Holiday Dr., 100 block, 11:30 p.m., July 28. A man who was found unconscious at a motel became combative while being revived. A Union Bridge man, 36, was charged with assault on a police officer and disorderly conduct.

ROBBERIES

H.G. Trueman Rd., 10:02 p.m., July 31. A man with a handgun tried to rob three employees of a restaurant as they got into a vehicle after closing for the night. After a struggle, during which the assailant bit one of the employees on the arm, the assailant fled empty-handed. No serious injuries were reported.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Matthews Dr., 8000 block, 1 a.m., Aug. 2. Some cash was among property stolen from a hardware store.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

ASSAULTS

Hawthorne Rd., 4300 block, July 23. Two gunmen robbed a 29-year-old man who had accompanied a woman to an apartment to buy drugs. An Indian Head woman, 21, and an Indian Head man, 19, were arrested. Charges included robbery, first-degree assault, second-degree assault, use of a firearm during the commission of a crime and theft. A warrant was issued for the other man involved in the incident.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

Mall Cir., 6:10 p.m., July 28. Teenagers threatened two 16-year-old males and fled with their cellphones.

Prince Edward Dr., 8:37 p.m., July 29. Two men wearing masks robbed four teenagers of cash, cellphones, jewelry and shoes at gunpoint.

ASSAULTS

Hamlin Rd., 1100 block, 11:44 p.m., Aug. 2. Responding to a report of an assault at a residence, police shot a man armed with two large knives. A 50-year-old man was charged with first-degree assault, reckless endangerment, possession of a deadly weapon, and failure to obey a lawful order. He was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries that were not life-threatening.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf, 12:15 a.m., Aug. 1. A gas station employee was sexually assaulted by a customer after she agreed to give him a ride. Once inside her vehicle, the man forced her at gunpoint to drive to a wooded area off of St. Charles Parkway, where the attack took place. A Waldorf man, 23, was charged with first-degree sex offense, first-degree assault and use of a deadly weapon in the commission of a crime. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 12:59 a.m., July 28. An attempt was made to break into a doughnut shop. Two males were seen fleeing empty-handed.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

BUSHWOOD AREA

VANDALISM

Owens Dr., 1:37 a.m., July 26. A window was shattered at a residence. A Colton Point man, 32, was charged with malicious destruction of property.

CALIFORNIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

California, Aug. 1. In June, property was stolen from several residences in the Challenger Estates neighborhood, as well as from a facility at a community pool, which had significant damage. Two California men, ages 18 and 19, and two male teenagers were arrested. Charges included burglary, theft, and malicious destruction of property worth more than $500. In the course of the ongoing investigation, the 19-year-old was additionally charged with fourth-degree sex offenses in connection with incidents involving two 14-year-olds in March.

GREAT MILLS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Nancy Lane, July 31. Jewelry was stolen from a residence. A Hollywood woman, 26, was charged with two counts of theft valued at less than $1,000. Property was recovered at a jewelry store.

HOLLYWOOD AREA

ASSAULTS

Allston Lane, July 25. During a fight, a man stabbed an acquaintance in the abdomen with a pocketknife and punched another acquaintance in the face. A Ridge man, 25, was charged with first- and second-degree assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Forrest Landing Rd., July 27. A man forced his way into a residence where he once lived and attacked two acquaintances. A Leonardtown man, 31, was charged with two counts of second-degree assault and with burglary.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hollywood, May to June. A Lusby man, 23, and a Mechanicsville woman, 26, were arrested in connection with several residential burglaries in the Hollywood, Bushwood and Chaptico area. Charges included three counts of first-degree burglary and three counts of theft valued at $1,000-$10,000.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS.

Fairground Rd., July 28. A man threatened an acquaintance with a knife and held her against her will. A Leonardtown man, 43, was charged with first-and second-degree assault and unlawful imprisonment.

Lawrence Ave., July 27. During an argument, a man struck an acquaintance in the face. A Leonardtown man, 19, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Great Mills Rd., July 29. Shots were fired during a fight in a parking lot that involved a lot of people. The only reported victim of the gunfire, a 26-year-old man, was taken to a hospital for treatment of a shoulder injury.

Great Mills Rd., Aug. 1. During an argument, a woman struck an acquaintance in the face. A Lexington Park woman, 21, was charged with second-degree assault.

Rue Purchase Rd., July 25. During an argument, a man struck an acquaintance and threw a second acquaintance to the ground. A Lexington Park man, 42, was charged with two counts of second-degree assault, failure to obey a lawful order of a police officer and with resisting arrest.

Valley Ct., July 26. During an argument, a man choked an acquaintance. A Lexington Park man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., 22300 block, June and July. Property was stolen from several units at a self-storage business. On July 27, California man and a Lexington Park man, both 21, were arrested on burglary charges, which included theft valued at $1,000 to $10,000 and malicious destruction of property.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Mechanicsville, Aug. 2. A Mechanicsville man, 34, and a woman, 32, of no fixed addresses were arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a child on several occasions in 2010. Among the sexual abuse charges was engaging in a continuing course of conduct over 90 days or more with someone younger than 14.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. 11


LENGTH: 984 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or Crime Solvers, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Chesapeake Beach Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

15TH ST., 7:50 p.m. Feb. 4. A motorcycle was stolen from a garage. 

Dunkirk Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WEST WARD RD., 8:55 a.m. Feb. 6. Cash in registers at a restaurant was replaced with counterfeit bills. A 17-year-old male was charged with theft and fraud.

Huntingtown Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOLOMONS ISLAND RD., 10:30 a.m. Feb. 11. A vehicle and a pressure washer were stolen from the garage and driveway of a residence.

Lusby Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOOFBEAT TRAIL, Feb. 5 to 6. About 100 gallons of oil were stolen from a tank at a residence.

PLAINS RD., Feb. 5 to 7. A generator was stolen from a residence.

Owings Area

VANDALISM

HALEY'S WAY, 9 a.m. Feb. 7. A residence was damaged by paintballs.

Prince Frederick Area

VANDALISM

CLAY HAMMON RD., 8:37 a.m. Feb. 8. A vehicle and a mailbox were damaged at a residence.

Solomons Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOLOMONS, Feb. 7 to 8. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a locked vehicle at a hotel.

St. Leonard Area

ASSAULTS

BROOMES ISLAND RD., 8:30 a.m. Feb. 11. A 60-year-old man was hit in the head several times with a golf club. A man, 75, was charged with assault.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. At the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics and information about community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Faulkner Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FAULKNER RD., 10000 block, 5:30 to 8 p.m. Feb. 7. A 2006 Chevrolet Silverado was stolen from a business. The vehicle was found in a field in Newburg. It had been set on fire.

Indian Head Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

CHICAMUXEN RD., 3000 block, 2 p.m. Feb. 4. A man forced a student into an empty classroom at a school, where he sexually assaulted her. A man, 18, was charged with second-degree rape and second-degree assault.

La Plata Area

HOMICIDES

FENNELL PL., 6300 block, 4:26 a.m. Feb. 10. Three masked males forced their way into an apartment, ordered the six occupants to the floor at gunpoint, and demanded cash. An unidentified adult was shot and killed. The intruders fled in a vehicle.

Nanjemoy Area

VANDALISM

IRONSIDES RD., Feb. 10. Racist graffiti and swastikas were spray-painted on classroom trailers at a school.

PORT TOBACCO RD., 4900 block, 3:47 p.m. Feb. 10. Graffiti including a racial slur were spray-painted on a building.

Pisgah Area

VANDALISM

ANNAPOLIS WOODS AND POORHOUSE ROADS, Feb. 10. Racist graffiti and swastikas were spray-painted on a stop sign.

POORHOUSE RD., 7700 block, 6:30 a.m. Feb. 10. Racial slurs were spray-painted on a church building.

RIPLEY RD., 6500 block, Feb. 10. Racist graffiti and swastikas were spray-painted on a sign at a recycling center.

Waldorf Area

ASSAULTS

O'DONNELL PL., 10000 block, 11:24 p.m. Feb. 8. During an argument, a man, 33, was hit in the forehead with a high-heeled shoe. A woman, 23, was charged with first-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

FALCON PL., 4100 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 4. A male pressed an object against a pizza deliveryman's back, stole cash and a wedding ring and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COMMUNITY DR., 2200 block, 6:44 p.m. Feb. 11. A woman heard something in her basement as she entered her residence. Police responding to her call found that the home had been entered by breaking a window. Nothing was reported missing.

ROCK CT., 8300 block, 2:59 p.m. Feb. 11. Electronics and cash were stolen from a residence.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or Crime Solvers, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Hollywood Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, Feb. 5. A man took a vehicle from a female acquaintance. A man, 20, was charged with theft and unauthorized use of a motor vehicle.

Lexington Park Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

PATUXENT NAVAL AIR TEST CENTER AREA, 2:20 p.m. Feb. 5. A 3-year-old girl was sexually assaulted at a residence. A 15-year-old male was charged with second-degree rape.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, Feb. 6. A woman was bitten during an argument. A man, 20, was charged with second-degree assault.

Mechanicsville Area

ASSAULTS

ARMY-NAVY DR., Feb. 5. A man with a knife attacked a man during an argument. A man, 22, was charged with second-degree assault, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of controlled dangerous substance paraphernalia.

Valley Lee Area

ASSAULTS

PREFERENCE WAY, 12:42 a.m. Feb. 10. A man approached police in a threatening manner as they were responding to a domestic dispute. A woman in the residence interfered with the man's arrest. A man, 32, was charged with second-degree assault and was served with two warrants from Charles County. A woman, 27, was charged with hindering a police officer and resisting arrest.

Wildewood Area

VANDALISM

WILDEWOOD, 12:12 a.m. Feb. 7. Eggs were thrown at a police vehicle. Four boys, ages 16 and 17, were charged with destruction of property.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 968 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRENTSVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Shallow Creek Loop, 4:05 p.m. Sept. 2. A man had sex with a female juvenile who had run away from her North Carolina home. The girl was reunited with her family.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Victory Lakes Loop, 12600 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 10 to 5 p.m. Sept. 11. Cash and a video game system were stolen from a clubhouse.

DALE CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Birchdale Ave., 14600 block, 10:30 a.m. Sept. 5 to 10:40 a.m. Sept. 7. Copper piping was stolen from a residence. 

Bismark Ave., 14200 block, 6 p.m. June 10 to 11:15 a.m. Sept. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Fairmont Ct., 14300 block, 8 a.m. Sept. 10 to 12:30 p.m. Sept. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a water heater at a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Hawk Ct., 4500 block, midnight Aug. 10 to 3:20 p.m. Sept. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence.

Telfair Ct., 4600 block, 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sept. 9. A TV was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

HAYMARKET AREA

WEAPONS

Stepping Stone Dr., 15100 block, 3:14 p.m. Sept. 9. Illegal fireworks and other material that could be used to build pipe bombs were found in a bedroom of a residence. A 19-year-old Haymarket woman was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Nodi Ct., 7900 block, 6:31 a.m. Sept. 6. A woman bound a male acquaintance while he was sleeping. When he awoke, she allegedly hit him with a hammer and stabbed him several times. The woman was found unconscious after apparently taking sleeping medication. The man was treated for injuries. A 47-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

Prince Charles Ct., 7400 block, 9:23 p.m. Sept. 6. During an argument, a man stabbed a male acquaintance. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 33-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Lee Ave., 9300 block, 1:53 p.m. Sept. 6. A man called a courthouse and reported a bomb inside the building. The courthouse was evacuated and searched. No bombs were found. A 47-year-old Landover man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd. and Branch Lane, 1:13 a.m. Sept. 11. A man with a knife demanded money from a male pedestrian, who fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8100 block, 12:10 a.m. Aug. 28. A man attempted to enter a business by kicking a glass door.

Spriggs Rd., 13200 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 4 to 7:30 p.m. Sept. 7. Electronics were stolen from a church entered by breaking a rear window.

MONTCLAIR AREA

ROBBERIES

Waterway Dr., 5100 block, 6:14 p.m. Sept. 9. A male asked a man for money. When the man refused, the male punched him and robbed him of cash.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Fuller Heights Rd., 18700 block, 6:37 p.m. Sept. 7. During an argument, a man stabbed a female acquaintance. A 45-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, 1:49 p.m. Sept. 6. A man in a parking lot assaulted a police officer. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 9:12 p.m. Sept. 9. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance with a beer bottle. A 38-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

St. Charles Dr., 5600 block, 5:46 p.m. Aug. 14. A female juvenile stole a relative's handgun and threatened to kill the relative and other family members. No injuries were reported. A 16-year-old female and a 17-year-old male, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

ROBBERIES

Smoketown Rd., 14400 block, 11:12 p.m. Sept. 9. After an argument in a restaurant involving three men, one of the men left the restaurant and drove toward an intersection. The two other men confronted him and took a bag of food. They fought, and one of the two men pulled out a knife, then fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

St. Charles Dr., 5500 block, 11:57 a.m. Sept. 6. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a glass door. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Whitmer Dr., 4400 block, 3:30 to 6 p.m. Sept. 10. Cash, a laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

 Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Main St., 9400 block, 1:45 a.m. Sept. 11. A man stabbed another person. A 25-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8700 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 13. A male took cash from a bank.

Dumfries Rd., 10000 block, 3 to 4:20 p.m. Sept. 9. A laptop was stolen from a residence.

Princeton Park Dr., 8900 block, 9:45 p.m. Sept. 8. A handgun was stolen from a residence. A 21-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

Stonewall Rd., 9300 block, 11:55 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a church. A 52-year-old man was arrested.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alpine St., 100 block, 11:24 p.m. Sept. 2. Five bikes were stolen from a residence. Five male juveniles, ages 12 to 16, were arrested.

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 2:57 a.m. Sept. 13. Two males stole four cases of beer from a convenience store and broke a front glass door.

Elm Ct., 9400 block, 7 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Sept. 4. Two bikes and a skateboard were stolen from a residence.

Kent Dr., 200 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 2 to 7 a.m. Sept. 3. Two air conditioners were stolen from the back yard of a residence.

Kirby St., 200 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 3 to 8 a.m. Sept. 4. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

West Carondelet Dr. and Primrose Lane, 9:27 p.m. Sept. 10. Two males stole a video game system from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Jessica Dr., 9200 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 1 to 4:53 p.m. Sept. 2. A tire of a vehicle was slashed.

White Pine Dr., 8200 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 3. A window of a vehicle was broken.
