Washingtonpost.com


September 22, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report Anne Arundel and Howard counties crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T19


LENGTH: 1775 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

CROFTON AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ridgely Ct. and Aberdeen Dr., 3:20 p.m. Sept. 13. Two men sexually assaulted a teenager who was walking a dog, then drove away in a red, older-model four-door sedan. The victim was treated at a hospital. Anyone with information is asked to contact J. Widup, a detective with the Sex Offense Unit, 410-222-3468. 

CROWNSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Walnut Trail, 300 block, 1:28 a.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from the back yard of a residence. A Ford F-350 pickup that had been identified by a neighbor was stopped a short time later and found to contain tools and wire taken from a vehicle parked at a residence on Walnut Trail and property that had been reported stolen from a truck on First Street in Annapolis. A Harwood man, 53, a Bowie man, 24, and a Davidsonville man, 25, were charged with several counts of burglary, theft, destruction of property and with being rogue and vagabond.

EDGEWATER AREA ROBBERIES

Highland Dr., 300 block, 10:43 a.m. Sept. 9. Three males forced their way into a residence and robbed an acquaintance of property. An Edgewater male, 17, an Edgewater man, 21, and a Harwood man, 19, were arrested. Charges included armed robbery, assault, felony theft and burglary.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES

Lamplighter Ridge, 6400 block, 3:52 p.m. Sept. 14. A male teenager punched a younger boy and robbed him of a bicycle. No serious injuries were reported.

Ritchie Hwy., 7200 block, 3:47 a.m. Sept. 11. During an attempted robbery, a man stabbed a gas-station clerk, then fled on foot to a cemetery. A Glen Burnie man, 22, was charged with attempted second-degree murder, two counts of robbery, first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment. The victim was treated for non-life-threatening injuries at a hospital.

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block,1:21 a.m. Sept. 14. A man who implied that he had a weapon robbed a motel of cash, then fled on foot.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Laurel Fort Meade Rd., 3400 block, 9:53 p.m. Sept. 11. Two males wearing ski masks tried to rob a fast-food restaurant of cash at gunpoint. When employees proved unable to open the cash registers, the males robbed them of cash from their purses.

RIVA AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Riva and Centre roads, 3:20 p.m. Sept. 13. A man driving a white minivan offered a ride to a girl who had just gotten off a bus. The girl refused and ran away.

SEVERN AREA SUSPICIOUS DEATHS

Gambrills Rd., 100 block, 7:45 a.m. Sept. 10. The body of Peter Anthony Dembrowicz, 30, was found in Severn Run stream, not far from his home. He had not been seen since going out for a walk at about 10 p.m. An investigation was continuing.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. Call 410-280-2583o to anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Annapolis Walk Dr., 5:30 a.m. Sept. 13. An attempt was made to break into a house through a back window.

Newtowne Dr., 700 block, 7 a.m. Sept. 7 to 4 p.m. Sept. 8. A laptop, frozen food and cash were stolen from an apartment at which a window had been left unlocked.

Stonecreek Rd., 1400 block, 10:44 p.m. Sept. 9. A laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a back door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

West St., 1-99 block, 1 to 2:40 a.m. Sept. 11. A vehicle was stolen using a key that had been left inside. The vehicle was recovered that same day in the unit block of Dock Street.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. Call 410-313-2236 for information. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Waverly Winds, 5:38 a.m. Sept. 10. Three males attacked a pedestrian on a path and robbed him of cash and a cellphone. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broadcloth Way, 7500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 8. A digital media player and a laptop were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Cradlerock Way, 7200 block, 2:47 a.m. Sept. 11. A laptop and cash were stolen from a hair salon entered through an unlocked back door.

Rawhide Ridge, 6900 block, 11:21 a.m. Sept. 7. An attempt was made to break into a residence by tampering with an alarm system.

Trotting Ridge Way, 10900 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 10 to 10:13 p.m. Sept. 12. TVs, computers, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Two Ships Ct., 11000 block, 1 p.m. Sept. 9 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 12. A residence was entered by breaking a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 7:43 a.m. Sept. 8. A Honda CBR motorcycle was stolen.

Tamar Dr., 8800 block, 1:09 p.m. Sept. 8. A green 2000 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

Vantage Point Rd., 5400 block, 10:27 a.m. Sept. 12. An attempt was made to steal a vehicle.

ELKRIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Waterloo Rd., 6800 block, 8:15 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 8. Two TVs, a laptop and watches were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Orchard Club Dr., 6300 block, 12:35 a.m. Sept. 9. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by removing a screen. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Stipa Ct., 6600 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 10. A vehicle that had been reported stolen was recovered in Baltimore.

Washington Blvd., 6600 block, 11:53 a.m. Sept. 11. A 2003 Ford truck was stolen from a dealership.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Old Annapolis Rd., 9800 block, 5:30 p.m. Sept. 11. A man was seen walking around naked in a park. A Mount Airy man, 31, was charged with indecent exposure.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mount Ida Dr., 3500 block, 12:33 a.m Sept. 11. A break-in occurred.

West Springs Dr., 3100 block, 11:47 p.m. Sept. 10. An occupied residence was entered by breaking a window. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Kaiser Dr., 3200 block, 8:50 a.m. Sept. 11. A white 2004 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 was stolen.

FULTON AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pleasant View Dr., 12300 block, 10:25 a.m. Sept. 12. After receiving no response when he rang a doorbell at a residence, a male tried to break in through the basement. The intruder fled in a vehicle when confronted.

HANOVER AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

River Birch Ct., 6000 block, 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. Sept. 11. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle in an open garage.

JESSUP AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Riggs Hill Rd., 10600 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 9 to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 11. An attempt was made to break into a business by cutting a hole in a garage door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Stayton Dr., 8300 block, 3 p.m. Sept. 5. A vehicle was stolen.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Glen Ridge Dr., 9400 block, 12:54 p.m. Sept. 9. Three people tried to rob a pedestrian of cash at knifepoint. The victim ran away and the assailants briefly gave chase. No injuries were reported.

Washington Blvd., 9900 block, 12:45 a.m. Sept. 9. Three people got out of a vehicle and attacked a male pedestrian, who refused to give them cash. The victim was able to call police from a nearby business. A Laurel man, 19, and a Burtonsville man, 20, were charged with attempted robbery and conspiracy to commit robbery. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alma Ave., unit block, 10 p.m. Sept. 7. A man tried to force his way into an acquaintance's residence through the front door. A Laurel man, 21, was charged with fourth-degree burglary, malicious destruction of property and trespassing.

Moonshine Hollow, 9000 block, 5:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 13. A residence was entered by breaking glass in a front door. Electronics and clothing were destroyed and other property was moved around, but nothing was reported missing.

Redbridge Ct., 9200 block, 11:15 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. Sept. 13. A video game and a digital-media player docking station were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Sandy Stream Rd., 8200 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 6 to 7 a.m. Sept. 7. A laptop and a cellphone were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage. A navigator was stolen from the garage.

Sylvan Still, 9500 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 11. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by kicking in the front door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Barrel House Rd., 9600 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 8 to 4:57 a.m. Sept. 9. A black-and-red 2003 Honda CBR motorcycle was stolen.

Livery Lane, 9200 block, 9:50 a.m. Sept. 9. A 2000 Yamaha R1 motorcycle was stolen.

Sperry Ct., 8300 block, 9:36 a.m. Sept. 10. A 2008 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

Stebbing Way, 9000 block, 9:58 p.m. Sept. 8. A dark-blue 2004 Chevrolet Trailblazer was stolen.

Washington Blvd., 10000 block, 10:37 a.m. Sept. 9. An 18-wheel truck and an attached trailer were stolen.

Washington Blvd., 9100 block, 9:24 a.m. Sept. 9. A trailer was stolen.

MOUNT AIRY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mullinix Mill Rd., 2400 block, 11:30 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. Sept. 13. A break-in occurred at a residence. Property was moved around, but nothing was reported missing. There was no sign of forced entry.

Old Frederick Rd., 17200 block, Aug. 18 to Aug. 20. A TV was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

King Farm Blvd., 1 to 1:15 a.m. July 2. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance. 

ROBBERIES

Stonebridge View Dr., 14300 block, 12:15 a.m. July 5. An attempted strong-arm robbery occurred at an elementary school. The victim knows the persons involved.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Washingtonpost.com


August 9, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1512 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

DUNKIRK AREA VANDALISM

Lancer Ct., July 23 to July 34. A vehicle window was smashed.  

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dasher Dr., 5:59 p.m., July 28. An iPhone was stolen from a home during a party.

H.G. Trueman Rd., July 23 to July 24. Lawn equipment was stolen from two sheds at a church.

VANDALISM

Garner Rd., 12:51 p.m., July 29. A vehicle tire was cut.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Scaggs Rd., 6200 block, July 24 to July 25. Tools were stolen from a maintenance shed at a golf course.

Scaggs Rd.,6200 block, July 27 to July 28. Property was stolen from an office at a golf course.

PRINCE FREDERICK THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dares Beach Rd., 5:10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., July 27. A camera, jewelry and a handgun were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Main St., 6:44 p.m., July 25. During a traffic stop, a motorist was found to have an open warrant and to be in possession of stolen credit cards. A Huntingtown woman, 32, was arrested.

Sixes Rd., 5:38 p.m., July 25. A laptop computer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

SOLOMONS AREA ASSAULTS

Holiday Dr., 100 block, 11:30 p.m., July 28. A man who was found unconscious at a motel became combative while being revived. A Union Bridge man, 36, was charged with assault on a police officer and disorderly conduct.

ROBBERIES

H.G. Trueman Rd., 10:02 p.m., July 31. A man with a handgun tried to rob three employees of a restaurant as they got into a vehicle after closing for the night. After a struggle, during which the assailant bit one of the employees on the arm, the assailant fled empty-handed. No serious injuries were reported.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities. BRYANS ROAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Matthews Dr., 8000 block, 1 a.m., Aug. 2. Some cash was among property stolen from a hardware store.

INDIAN HEAD AREA ASSAULTS

Hawthorne Rd., 4300 block, July 23. Two gunmen robbed a 29-year-old man who had accompanied a woman to an apartment to buy drugs. An Indian Head woman, 21, and an Indian Head man, 19, were arrested. Charges included robbery, first-degree assault, second-degree assault, use of a firearm during the commission of a crime and theft. A warrant was issued for the other man involved in the incident.

WALDORF AREA ROBBERIES

Mall Cir., 6:10 p.m., July 28. Teenagers threatened two 16-year-old males and fled with their cellphones.

Prince Edward Dr., 8:37 p.m., July 29. Two men wearing masks robbed four teenagers of cash, cellphones, jewelry and shoes at gunpoint.

ASSAULTS

Hamlin Rd., 1100 block, 11:44 p.m., Aug. 2. Responding to a report of an assault at a residence, police shot a man armed with two large knives. A 50-year-old man was charged with first-degree assault, reckless endangerment, possession of a deadly weapon, and failure to obey a lawful order. He was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries that were not life-threatening.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf, 12:15 a.m., Aug. 1. A gas station employee was sexually assaulted by a customer after she agreed to give him a ride. Once inside her vehicle, the man forced her at gunpoint to drive to a wooded area off of St. Charles Parkway, where the attack took place. A Waldorf man, 23, was charged with first-degree sex offense, first-degree assault and use of a deadly weapon in the commission of a crime. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 12:59 a.m., July 28. An attempt was made to break into a doughnut shop. Two males were seen fleeing empty-handed.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

BUSHWOOD AREA VANDALISM

Owens Dr., 1:37 a.m., July 26. A window was shattered at a residence. A Colton Point man, 32, was charged with malicious destruction of property.

CALIFORNIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

California, Aug. 1. In June, property was stolen from several residences in the Challenger Estates neighborhood, as well as from a facility at a community pool, which had significant damage. Two California men, ages 18 and 19, and two male teenagers were arrested. Charges included burglary, theft, and malicious destruction of property worth more than $500. In the course of the ongoing investigation, the 19-year-old was additionally charged with fourth-degree sex offenses in connection with incidents involving two 14-year-olds in March.

GREAT MILLS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Nancy Lane, July 31. Jewelry was stolen from a residence. A Hollywood woman, 26, was charged with two counts of theft valued at less than $1,000. Property was recovered at a jewelry store.

HOLLYWOOD AREA ASSAULTS

Allston Lane, July 25. During a fight, a man stabbed an acquaintance in the abdomen with a pocketknife and punched another acquaintance in the face. A Ridge man, 25, was charged with first- and second-degree assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Forrest Landing Rd., July 27. A man forced his way into a residence where he once lived and attacked two acquaintances. A Leonardtown man, 31, was charged with two counts of second-degree assault and with burglary.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hollywood, May to June. A Lusby man, 23, and a Mechanicsville woman, 26, were arrested in connection with several residential burglaries in the Hollywood, Bushwood and Chaptico area. Charges included three counts of first-degree burglary and three counts of theft valued at $1,000-$10,000.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS.

Fairground Rd., July 28. A man threatened an acquaintance with a knife and held her against her will. A Leonardtown man, 43, was charged with first-and second-degree assault and unlawful imprisonment.

Lawrence Ave., July 27. During an argument, a man struck an acquaintance in the face. A Leonardtown man, 19, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Great Mills Rd., July 29. Shots were fired during a fight in a parking lot that involved a lot of people. The only reported victim of the gunfire, a 26-year-old man, was taken to a hospital for treatment of a shoulder injury.

Great Mills Rd., Aug. 1. During an argument, a woman struck an acquaintance in the face. A Lexington Park woman, 21, was charged with second-degree assault.

Rue Purchase Rd., July 25. During an argument, a man struck an acquaintance and threw a second acquaintance to the ground. A Lexington Park man, 42, was charged with two counts of second-degree assault, failure to obey a lawful order of a police officer and with resisting arrest.

Valley Ct., July 26. During an argument, a man choked an acquaintance. A Lexington Park man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., 22300 block, June and July. Property was stolen from several units at a self-storage business. On July 27, California man and a Lexington Park man, both 21, were arrested on burglary charges, which included theft valued at $1,000 to $10,000 and malicious destruction of property.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Mechanicsville, Aug. 2. A Mechanicsville man, 34, and a woman, 32, of no fixed addresses were arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a child on several occasions in 2010. Among the sexual abuse charges was engaging in a continuing course of conduct over 90 days or more with someone younger than 14.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 616 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA

WEAPONS

Roundtree Dr., 5600 block, 12:30 to 2 a.m. April 24. Someone fired a weapon at a residence. Several bullets holes were found in the side of the residence.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Denali Pl., 17400 block, 2:25 a.m. April 21. During an argument a woman allegedly stabbed a male acquaintance several times with a screwdriver. The man was treated for injuries. A 31-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested. 

Dumfries and Van Buren roads, 7:07 p.m. April 25. During an undercover operation involving Alcohol Tobacco and Firearms federal agents, a man allegedly attempted to flee in a vehicle. Agents fired weapons, allegedly injuring him. He was taken to a hospital. A 38-year-old Landover, Md. man was arrested and charged with possession with intent to distribute cocaine and felony eluding of police.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Portsmouth Rd., 10000 block, 4:05 p.m. April 19. A man allegedly sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 53-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Sudley Rd., 1:31 p.m. April 18. A male physician allegedly kissed a female patient. A 64-year-old Catharpin area man was arrested and charged with assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Covington Pl., 9500 block, 4:30 to 10:39 p.m. April 19. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an open window.

TRIANGLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fuller Heights Rd., 12:36 a.m. April 20. A man allegedly sexually assaulted two female juvenile acquaintances. A 37-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Anchorstone Dr., 5000 block, 7:45 p.m. April 20. A person got out of a vehicle and assaulted a male pedestrian, knocking him to the ground. Several others got out of the vehicle and assaulted the man, who was treated for injuries. The group fled in the vehicle.

WEAPONS

Silversmith Ct., 2100 block, 2 to 2:30 a.m. and 2:40 a.m. Someone fired a weapon. Bullet holes were found in a front window and the side of a residence. A weapon was also fired at another residence, breaking a kitchen window.

Traverser Ct., 15500 block, midnight to noon April 23. Someone fired a weapon, damaging a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 10:05 p.m. April 24. A man entered a residence through an open door and hit a female resident with a gun, then grabbed an empty purse and fled. The woman was treated for injuries.

Hunterbrook Dr., 12700 block, 7 to 8:30 p.m. April 24. A laptop computer was stolen.

Merrywood Ct., 2500 block, 2:30 to 2:40 p.m. April 19. A purse containing cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Sequoia Ct., 2000 block, 11:08 p.m. April 20. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a bedroom window.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Beach Pl., 9700 block, 10:30 a.m. April 26. Three men got out of a vehicle, assaulted a man outside a residence and robbed him of cash.

Weems Rd., 8700 block, 6 p.m. April 26. A male picked up a bike and rode it around a basketball court with another male. When the owner of the bike confronted the male, one of the two males shot the owner several times in the face and torso with a BB gun. The other male punched the owner in the face, and the two fled on the bike. The owner was treated for injuries.

Manasssas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Cabbel Dr., 200 block, 1:24 p.m. April 21. Someone wrote gang-related graffiti on a wet concrete sidewalk.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1070 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRENTSVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Shallow Creek Loop, 4:05 p.m. Sept. 2. A man had sex with a female juvenile who had run away from her North Carolina home. The girl was reunited with her family.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Victory Lakes Loop, 12600 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 10 to 5 p.m. Sept. 11. Cash and a video game system were stolen from a clubhouse. 

DALE CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Birchdale Ave., 14600 block, 10:30 a.m. Sept. 5 to 10:40 a.m. Sept. 7. Copper piping was stolen from a residence.

Bismark Ave., 14200 block, 6 p.m. June 10 to 11:15 a.m. Sept. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Fairmont Ct., 14300 block, 8 a.m. Sept. 10 to 12:30 p.m. Sept. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a water heater at a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Hawk Ct., 4500 block, midnight Aug. 10 to 3:20 p.m. Sept. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence.

Telfair Ct., 4600 block, 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sept. 9. A TV was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

HAYMARKET AREA WEAPONS

Stepping Stone Dr., 15100 block, 3:14 p.m. Sept. 9. Illegal fireworks and other material that could be used to build pipe bombs were found in a bedroom of a residence. A 19-year-old Haymarket woman was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Nodi Ct., 7900 block, 6:31 a.m. Sept. 6. A woman bound a male acquaintance while he was sleeping. When he awoke, she allegedly hit him with a hammer and stabbed him several times. The woman was found unconscious after apparently taking sleeping medication. The man was treated for injuries. A 47-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

Prince Charles Ct., 7400 block, 9:23 p.m. Sept. 6. During an argument, a man stabbed a male acquaintance. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 33-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Lee Ave., 9300 block, 1:53 p.m. Sept. 6. A man called a courthouse and reported a bomb inside the building. The courthouse was evacuated and searched. No bombs were found. A 47-year-old Landover man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd. and Branch Lane, 1:13 a.m. Sept. 11. A man with a knife demanded money from a male pedestrian, who fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8100 block, 12:10 a.m. Aug. 28. A man attempted to enter a business by kicking a glass door.

Spriggs Rd., 13200 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 4 to 7:30 p.m. Sept. 7. Electronics were stolen from a church entered by breaking a rear window.

MONTCLAIR AREA ROBBERIES

Waterway Dr., 5100 block, 6:14 p.m. Sept. 9. A male asked a man for money. When the man refused, the male punched him and robbed him of cash.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULTS

Fuller Heights Rd., 18700 block, 6:37 p.m. Sept. 7. During an argument, a man stabbed a female acquaintance. A 45-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, 1:49 p.m. Sept. 6. A man in a parking lot assaulted a police officer. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 9:12 p.m. Sept. 9. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance with a beer bottle. A 38-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

St. Charles Dr., 5600 block, 5:46 p.m. Aug. 14. A female juvenile stole a relative's handgun and threatened to kill the relative and other family members. No injuries were reported. A 16-year-old female and a 17-year-old male, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

ROBBERIES

Smoketown Rd., 14400 block, 11:12 p.m. Sept. 9. After an argument in a restaurant involving three men, one of the men left the restaurant and drove toward an intersection. The two other men confronted him and took a bag of food. They fought, and one of the two men pulled out a knife, then fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

St. Charles Dr., 5500 block, 11:57 a.m. Sept. 6. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a glass door. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Whitmer Dr., 4400 block, 3:30 to 6 p.m. Sept. 10. Cash, a laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Main St., 9400 block, 1:45 a.m. Sept. 11. A man stabbed another person. A 25-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8700 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 13. A male took cash from a bank.

Dumfries Rd., 10000 block, 3 to 4:20 p.m. Sept. 9. A laptop was stolen from a residence.

Princeton Park Dr., 8900 block, 9:45 p.m. Sept. 8. A handgun was stolen from a residence. A 21-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

Stonewall Rd., 9300 block, 11:55 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a church. A 52-year-old man was arrested.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alpine St., 100 block, 11:24 p.m. Sept. 2. Five bikes were stolen from a residence. Five male juveniles, ages 12 to 16, were arrested.

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 2:57 a.m. Sept. 13. Two males stole four cases of beer from a convenience store and broke a front glass door.

Elm Ct., 9400 block, 7 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Sept. 4. Two bikes and a skateboard were stolen from a residence.

Kent Dr., 200 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 2 to 7 a.m. Sept. 3. Two air conditioners were stolen from the back yard of a residence.

Kirby St., 200 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 3 to 8 a.m. Sept. 4. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

West Carondelet Dr. and Primrose Lane, 9:27 p.m. Sept. 10. Two males stole a video game system from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Jessica Dr., 9200 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 1 to 4:53 p.m. Sept. 2. A tire of a vehicle was slashed.

White Pine Dr., 8200 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 3. A window of a vehicle was broken.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ25


LENGTH: 1271 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

VEIRS MILL RD., 12500 block, 9:24 p.m. May 11. A man got out of a late-model black vehicle and pointed a shotgun at a group of youths standing on a corner. The man got back into the vehicle and left without firing the gun. No injuries were reported.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

INDECENT EXPOSURE

ASPEN ST., 4100 block, 2:45 p.m. May 21. Two male motorists in an SUV drove past a woman as she was getting a vehicle, and one of them exposed himself. 

UNIVERSITY BLVD. W., 3700 block, 3:25 p.m. May 22. A 75- to 80-year-old man shouted indistinguishable words at a woman as she stood in front of a doughnut shop. He exposed himself to her, then boarded a bus heading toward Wheaton.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

SILVER SPRING AREA, May 25. A 48-year-old Laurel man reported that he accompanied a woman to her apartment, where they had dinner and drinks. After he lost consciousness, the woman assaulted him sexually. An investigation was continuing.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

DOMER AVE., 500 block, 8 p.m., May 21. A man exposed himself to two females. A 36-year-old man was arrested and charged with indecent exposure and disorderly conduct.

ROBBERIES

QUEBEC TERR., 4:38 p.m. May 25. A man in an apartment building stairwell robbed a 50-year-old man of cash and property at knifepoint.

UNIVERSITY BOULEVARD AND MERRIMAC DRIVE AREA, 10:55 p.m. May 28. Six male youths forced a 34-year-old man to the ground, struck him and robbed him of cash.

SECOND AVENUE AND FENWICK LANE, 1:20 a.m. May 26. Two males demanded cash from a 24-year-old pedestrian. They fled with his money and property.

District 4 Wheaton Station Telephone: 240-773-5500

ROBBERIES

GRAND PRE RD., 14100 block, 9:58 p.m. May 9. A male who got into a cab at the Glenmont Metro station robbed the driver of cash at gunpoint.

RANDOLPH ROAD AND DALEWOOD DRIVE AREA, 10 p.m. May 22. Two men got out of a vehicle, struck a 24-year-old man and robbed him of his property.

VEIRS MILL RD., 11100 block, 3:49 p.m. May 19. One of three males struck a pedestrian, robbed him of his property and fled through a shopping center parking lot.

VEIRS MILL RD., 11200 block, 7:30 p.m. May 21. Two women punched and kicked a 23-year-old female pedestrian until she fell on the ground. They robbed her of her property. A short time later, two women were seen at Grandview Avenue and University Boulevard. An 18-year-old Potomac woman and an 18-year-old Silver Spring woman were arrested and charged with second-degree assault and conspiracy to commit robbery.

VEIRS MILL ROAD AND CONNECTICUT AVENUE AREA, 11 p.m. May 21. Two men robbed a 37-year-old Herndon man of his property after he got off a bus.

WEEPING WILLOW DR., 14200 block, 12:02 p.m. May 21. Three males asked a male youth about his shoes. They struck him and robbed him of his property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARCOLA AVE., 2100 block, 9 p.m. May 13 to 8:45 a.m. May 14. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ARCOLA AVE., 2100 block, 9 p.m. May 18 to 2:46 p.m. May 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ASPEN HILL RD., 5000 block, 6:40 to 7 m May 18. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

BUCKNELL DR., 11500 block, 2 to 5:15 p.m. May 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ELM GROVE CIR., 1300 block, 7:15 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. May 16. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GEORGIA AVE., 14200 block, 3:25 to 3:35 p.m. May 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GEORGIA AVE., 14200 block, 9:10 to 9:15 a.m. May 22. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

HEWITT AVE., 3200 block, 1:30 to 1:41 p.m. May 16. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

IDEAL DR., 13100 block, block, 9 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. May 16. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

IRIS PL., 4600 block, 9 p.m. May 16 to 8 a.m. May 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

JANET RD., 3400 block, 9:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. May 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

KIMBERLY ST., 2400 block, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. May 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MAPLEVIEW DR., 11500 block, 2 to 2:30 a.m. May 20. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

MERCURY DR., 4800 block, 2 to 7 p.m. May 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ROBINDALE DR., 12700 block, 2 to 9:47 p.m. May 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SUPERIOR ST., 13100 block, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. May 16. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

District 5 Germantown Station Telephone: 301-840-2650

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WALNUTWOOD DR., 13500 block, 9:30 a.m. to 3:35 p.m. May 18. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

HOMICIDES

EDWIN ST., 3500 block, 6:30 p.m. June 4. Jose Abelardo Tejada, 47, of the above address, was found with gunshot wounds. He was dead at the scene.

ROBBERIES

MUDDY BRANCH RD., 400 block, 5:10 p.m. May 6. A man robbed a 23-year-old woman of her purse.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

CARTER RD., 800 block, 11:11 p.m. June 1. A 31-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested and charged with domestic aggravated assault.

CHURCH ST., 1 to 100 block, 4:30 p.m. May 29 to 10:45 a.m. May 30. A business was entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

MARTINS LANE, 300 block, 3:30 to 5 p.m. May 30. Cash, a cellphone, clothing and a key were stolen from an unlocked locker at a swimming facility.

REDGATE FARMS CT., 1700 block, 1 p.m. June 2 to 4:45 a.m. June 3. A wallet, cosmetics and a checkbook were stolen from a residence.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1700 block, 5 to 5:15 p.m. May 30. A cellphone was stolen from a retail store.

WOOD LANE, 1 to 100 block, block, 7 p.m. May 23 to 8:30 a.m. May 24. A laptop computer was stolen from an office.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6300 block, 11:19 p.m. June 2. A man was arrested and charged with assault on a police officer.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 2070 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

No report was available from the Rockville Station for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 240-773-5030 or 240-773-6070.

Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

ROBBERIES

Martins Lane, 300 block, 8:30 to 9 p.m. Sept. 9. Two males were talking to two females at a park when a man approached and began a conversation with the two males. Several others joined the man, and they assaulted and robbed the pair of cash, a hunting knife, a cellphone and an iPod. On Sept. 12, a 22-year-old man was arrested in connection with the incident and charged with robbery, first- and second-degree assault and possession of a handgun. On Sept. 16, two men, ages 19 and 21, were arrested and charged with robbery and first- and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hungerford Dr., 400 block, 11:10 a.m. to 4:44 p.m. Sept. 10. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle.

Hungerford Dr., 500 block, 7:40 p.m. Sept. 11 to 7:57 a.m. Sept. 12. A suitcase, a calculator and a stethoscope were stolen from a vehicle.

Martins Lane, 300 block, 4:10 to 5:50 p.m. Sept. 15. Cash and a car key were stolen from an unlocked locker at a recreation center.

Monroe St., 600 block, 4:30 to 7 p.m. Sept. 10. Two laptop computers were stolen from an apartment entered through an unlocked window.

Rockland Ave., 2000 block, 10:15 p.m. Sept. 12 to 6:50 a.m. Sept. 13. Clothing and a pair of earphones were stolen from a vehicle.

Rockville Pike, 1400 block, 1 to 2 a.m. Sept. 15. A cellphone was stolen from a restaurant.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 4 to 11:10 p.m. Sept. 11. A suitcase and two cutlery knives were stolen from a vehicle.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 1:10 to 1:15 p.m. Sept. 13. A woman entered a business and took a purse that had been left unattended.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 7:10 to 9:23 p.m. Sept. 13. A backpack containing schoolbooks was stolen from a vehicle.

Rockville Pike, 1700 block, 9:48 a.m. to 8:38 p.m. Sept. 11. A pair of sunglasses, a laptop computer, an iPad, a suitcase, a book, a messenger bag and a GPS device were stolen from two vehicles.

Seven Locks Rd., 1200 block, 7 a.m. Sept. 12. PVC pipes, poles and other property were stolen from a fenced lot entered by cutting a hole in the fence.

Vandegrift Ave., 5900 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 12 to 3 p.m. Sept. 13. A GPS device and cash were stolen from a vehicle.

Veirs Mill Rd., 2200 block, 12:50 to 12:56 p.m. Sept. 14. A male entered a business and fled with several skin-care products and bars of soap. The thief was described as carrying a red backpack and wearing white tennis shoes, black pants and a white shirt with Mickey Mouse on it.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents recently reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

Flower Ave., 8300 block, 1:57 p.m. Sept. 13. A man in a vehicle pulled out a pocketknife when he was asked to move his vehicle from a person's parking space.

Roanoke Ave., 8300 block, 7:37 a.m. Sept. 18. A male assaulted a female acquaintance during an altercation.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore Ave., 7300 block, 7:30 p.m. Sept. 16. Property was stolen from an unlocked residence.

Boston Ave., 700 block, 8 a.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Carroll Ave., 7000 block, 10 a.m. Sept. 15. Two bikes chained to a fence post were stolen.

Fenton St., 7600 block, 1:55 p.m. Sept. 17. Property left unattended in a library was stolen.

Houston Ave., 600 block, 8:25 p.m. Sept. 17. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Maple Ave., 7500 block, 11:20 a.m. Sept. 18. A 20-year-old man was arrested in connection with an open warrant for theft.

New Hampshire Ave., 7400 block, 3:32 p.m. Sept. 18. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

New Hampshire Ave., 7600 block, 5:03 p.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from a business.

Roanoke Ave., 8100 block, 4:57 p.m. Sept. 18. A person entered a residence through an unlocked front door, then fled empty-handed when an occupant called out.

Takoma Ave., 7600 block, 2:40 p.m. Sept. 13. Property was stolen from a classroom at a college.

Woodland Ave., 7000 block, 6:30 a.m. Sept. 13. Property was stolen from a residence entered by removing a window screen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

New Hampshire Ave., 7300 block, 12:30 a.m. Sept. 17. A black and red 2011 Yamaha R6 motorcycle was stolen from a parking lot.

University Blvd., 1100 block, 2:10 p.m. Sept. 13. A 1998 blue Toyota Corolla was stolen from a parking lot. The vehicle was later recovered unoccupied.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1626 words


Anne Arundel

The following incidents were reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit group, will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Tips can be submitted anonymously by telephone, Internet or text message. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-756-2587, visit http://www.metrocrimestoppers.net or text to 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

Annapolis area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

RIVA RD., 2700 block, 12:30 p.m. Oct. 1. Police went to a high school where a female student said that she had been sexually assaulted by another student in a nearby wooded area on the morning of Sept. 28. On Oct. 6, an Annapolis male, 17, was arrested and charged as an adult with attempted second-degree rape, first- and second-degree sexual offense, sodomy, second-degree assault, reckless endangerment, false imprisonment and possession of a dangerous weapon with intent to injure.

ASSAULTS
 

RIVA RD., 2700 block, 10:30 a.m. Oct. 8. The female student who reported a sexual assault in the previous incident listed above was allegedly attacked in a high school stairwell by a female acquaintance of the boy who was charged in the sexual assault case. School personnel intervened, and the student was reportedly not injured. An Annapolis girl, 15, was charged as a juvenile with second-degree assault and released to a parent.

Brooklyn area

ROBBERIES

RITCHIE HWY., 5800 block, 9:40 p.m. Oct. 8. Three males robbed a male pedestrian at gunpoint behind a business. They fled on foot with cash and a cellphone.

Glen Burnie area

ROBBERIES

HILLTOP AND OVERHILL ROADS, 9 p.m. Oct. 12. Three male teenagers demanded property from a male pedestrian, then punched and kicked him. The pedestrian shouted for help, and the attackers fled. Nothing was reported taken. The pedestrian received injuries.

Odenton area

ROBBERIES

ANNAPOLIS RD., 1600 block, 11:30 a.m. Oct. 8. A male wearing a ski mask implied he had a gun and announced a robbery at a bank. He took cash and fled on foot.

Pasadena area

ASSAULTS

LIBERTY CIR., 7900 block, 10:48 p.m. Oct. 8. A male entered a home and assaulted a female resident, who woke up while he was in her bedroom. The female broke free and said she was calling police. The intruder fled. No serious injuries were reported. There was no sign of forced entry to the home. Anyone with information about the case is asked to call Detective Dave Wood at 410-222-3466.

Severn area

ASSAULTS

CITADEL CT., 7800 block, 1:16 a.m. Oct. 10. After an argument at or near a party, a male allegedly shot a man in the upper body, causing injuries. Witnesses said they heard several shots and saw the injured man stumbling in the street. A black Ford Expedition and a black Cadillac were driven away. Anyone with information about the case is asked to call 410-222-6155.

Annapolis

The following incidents were reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Annapolis, a nonprofit organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 410-267-8888. Callers may remain anonymous.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRIGHTWATER DR., 100 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 10 to 9 a.m. Oct. 11. An unlocked Honda was opened in a driveway. Items were moved; nothing was reported missing.

BURNSIDE ST., 500 block, noon Oct. 9 to 10 a.m. Oct. 10. A silver-and-black Sedona mountain bike was stolen from a back yard.

HILLSMERE DR., 100 block, 11:57 a.m. Sept. 28. A man entered a bank, presented false identification and withdrew cash from someone else's account. The incident was reported Oct. 12. Anyone with information is asked to contact Detective Chuck Bealefeld at 410-268-9000.

HILLTOP LANE, 200 block, 10:45 a.m. Oct. 7. Two people were seen cutting locks off bikes at a rack. Two arrests were made, and a stolen bike was recovered.

MERRYMAN CT., 100 block, Oct. 1 to Oct. 8. An envelope containing a check was stolen from a mailbox and cashed.

WEST ST., 200 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 8 to 10 a.m. Oct. 12. A cinder block was removed from a wall at a business. The business was not entered.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

EASTERN AVE., 100 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 9 to 9 a.m. Oct. 10. An inoperable black Vmoto scooter was stolen. The scooter also had been stolen in August.

Howard County 

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other felonies, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867 (STOP).

Columbia area

ROBBERIES

FREETOWN RD., 6500 block, 8:56 p.m. Oct. 8. A male was robbed of a cellphone by two acquaintances. The assailants fled on foot.

MURRAY HILL RD., 7600 block, 4:49 p.m. Oct. 9. A male was attacked by four acquaintances and robbed of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CEDARWOOD DR., 6000 block, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Oct. 11. A video game system and games were stolen from a home entered by breaking a basement window.

GRATEFUL HEART GATE, 6300 block, 6:40 p.m. to 8:51 p.m. Oct. 8. A residence was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

HIGH HAY DR., 11300 block, 10:03 p.m. Oct. 8. A home was entered by breaking glass in a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

MELLENBROOK RD., 9300 block, 12:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 9. A video game system and a game were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

POLISHED STONE, 9700 block, 7 a.m. Oct. 8 to 1:30 p.m. Oct. 10. A residence was entered through a pet entrance. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BASKET RING RD., 9700 block, 5:10 p.m. Oct. 7. A motorcycle was stolen.

COLUMBIA RD., 5600 block, Oct. 9 to 10 a.m. Oct. 10. The steering column of a 2004 Dodge Stratus was damaged during an attempt to steal the vehicle.

Dayton area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SAPLING RIDGE DR., 15100 block, 9:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 11. An unlocked vehicle was entered in an open garage. Nothing was reported missing.

Elkridge area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

REILLE WAY, 6500 block, 9:30 p.m. to 9:45 p.m. Oct. 8. Jewelry, a purse and a cellphone were stolen from a residence. A TV, a laptop computer, a safe and keys taken from the home were recovered nearby. There was no sign of forced entry.

Ellicott City area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CORPORATE CT., 3200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 8 to 9:45 a.m. Oct. 10. A business was entered through an unlocked ground-floor window. Nothing was reported missing.

CORPORATE CT., 3200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 8 to 9:45 a.m. Oct. 10. Two laptop computers were stolen from a business entered by forcing a front door.

OLD FREDERICK RD., 9900 block, 7:15 p.m. Oct. 8 to 8:10 a.m. Oct. 9. Cash was stolen from a shed at a business entered through an unlocked door. Attempts were made to break into three other sheds. A lock and two door were damaged, but nothing was reported missing in the other incidents.

MOUNT IDA DR., 3500 block, 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 13. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

OLD FREDERICK RD. AND BETHANY LANE, 7 p.m. Oct. 11 to 9 a.m. Oct. 12. Coins and a TV were stolen from three storage sheds entered by cutting locks.

RUPPERT CT., 8700 block, 5:30 a.m. Oct. 12. A 2003 Mitsubishi Eclipse was stolen using keys taken from a residence. During the break-in, a cellphone and a wallet also were stolen. A police chase began on Toll House Road, and the Eclipse crashed into a vehicle on Main Street near Tiber Alley. Two 15-year-old Ellicott City males were arrested.

WATERLOO RD., 5600 block, 4:16 p.m. Oct. 8. A TV, a computer and electronics were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

OLD FREDERICK RD. AND ROUTE 29, 10:42 a.m. Oct. 13. A white 2006 trailer was stolen.

Highland area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SCAGGSVILLE RD., 12700 block, June 10 to 11:20 a.m. Oct. 10. Golf clubs and tools were stolen from an open garage.

Jessup area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SANDY CT., 8200 block, Oct. 7 to 9:45 a.m. Oct. 13. A vacant residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 8100 block, 8:01 a.m. Oct. 7. A vehicle was among property stolen from a scrap yard.

Laurel area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FRAGRANT LILIES WAY, 9900 block, 11:33 p.m. Oct. 9. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

HARMONY LANE, 9900 block, 5:38 a.m. Oct. 14. A 2006 Ford was stolen.

Savage area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LINCOLN ST., 8800 block, 1:23 p.m. Oct. 13. An attempt was made to break into a residence by cutting a window screen. An acquaintance of an occupant fled when confronted.

WASHINGTON ST., 8800 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 11. Electronics were damaged in a residence entered through a kitchen window. An acquaintance of a resident is suspected.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

LARKIN RD., 8700 block, 12:18 p.m. Oct. 8. Two trailers were stolen.

West Friendship area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MITCHELL'S WAY, 13500 block, 8:23 a.m. Oct. 13. Tiles were stolen from a house under construction.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

LOU ANNE CT., 2500 block, 12:27 p.m. Oct. 9. A trailer was stolen.

Woodbine area

ROBBERIES

FREDERICK RD., 15800 block, 10:10 p.m. Oct. 13. Three people in a parking lot attacked an employee of a nearby business and robbed him of a bank bag, a wallet and keys. The robbers then fled in a vehicle. The victim, who was not seriously injured, said that he is acquainted with two of the assailants.

-- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Washingtonpost.com


December 15, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1771 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA WEAPONS OFFENSES

Ritchie Hwy., 6000 block, 2:13 a.m. Dec. 7. Two women having a loud discussion in a liquor-store parking lot heard a gunshot coming from the direction of a nearby residence. A Brooklyn Park man, 50, was charged with reckless endangerment and discharging a firearm within 100 yards of a structure.  

ROBBERIES

Ritchie Hwy., 5600 block, 12:18 p.m. Dec. 4. Two males attacked and robbed a pizza-carryout employee of cash as she was walking out of the restaurant. The victim refused medical attention.

GAMBRILLS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Annapolis Rd., 1000 block, 3:34 p.m. Nov. 28. A student was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance. On Dec. 5, a 14-year-old Odenton male, also a student, was charged with attempted second-degree rape, second-degree sex assault and second-degree sex offense.

GLEN BURNIE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Baltimore Annapolis Rd., 7500 block, Dec. 8. A Glen Burnie man, 29, was arrested in connection with an investigation of a teacher accused of sexually assaulting three students on and off school grounds from November 2009 to last month. Charges include several counts of sexual abuse of a minor, third- and fourth-degree sex offense, perverted practice, sexual solicitation of a minor, and first- and second-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

Furnace Ave. and Gatewater Ct., 1:30 a.m. Dec. 4. Four people attacked two pedestrians, a man with whom one of the assailants was acquainted and a woman who was robbed of a purse. The victims were taken to a hospital with non-life threatening injuries. A Pasadena woman, 23, two Glen Burnie men, ages 19 and 23, and a Baltimore woman, 19, were charged with robbery and assault. The purse was recovered.

Greenleaf Terr., 7 p.m. Nov. 30. Two people attacked a man in front of a store and robbed him of a cellphone. A 15-year-old Waldorf male was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

HANOVER AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hill Born Dr., 1300 block, 2:35 a.m. Dec. 3. A vehicle break-in occurred. A man arrested at the scene was found to be in possession of property taken from another vehicle in the area. A Baltimore man, 31, was charged with theft and with rogue and vagabond.

ODENTON AREA ROBBERIES

Annapolis Rd., 1100 block, 11:08 p.m. Dec. 2. A man wearing a ski mask got out of a maroon minivan in a store parking lot and robbed two employees of cash and a cellphone at gunpoint. He fled in the minivan.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

ASSAULTS

Dock St., 100 block, 2 a.m. Dec. 3. During a fight outside a bar, a male stabbed two men. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Bens Dr., unit block, Dec. 7. A 22-year-old Annapolis man was arrested in connection with a robbery at this location on Oct. 28. Charges included armed robbery, use of a firearm in a crime of violence, and first- and second-degree assault. Two other men were involved in the incident. An Annapolis man, 18, was arrested Nov. 3.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Ave., 800 block, 5:30 to 5:40 p.m. Dec. 3. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle while the motorist had stepped away.

Childs Point Rd., 700 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 17 to 2 p.m. Nov. 27. A laptop was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Copeland St., 1900 block, 9 p.m. Dec. 2 to 9 a.m. Dec. 3. A bomber jacket was stolen from a vehicle entered by smashing a window.

Francis St., unit block, 5 p.m. Dec. 3 to 8:40 p.m. Dec. 4. A residence was entered by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Halsey Rd., 400 block, 7:15 a.m. to 7 p.m. Dec. 7. A laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Hawkins Lane, 1300 block, 4 a.m. to 3 p.m. Dec. 4. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Hearthstone Ct., unit block, 3 p.m. Dec. 2 to 5 p.m. Dec. 5. Three packages were stolen from the front of a residence.

Paddington Pl., 1000 block, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Dec. 6. A laptop was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a bathroom window.

Primrose Rd., 900 block, 11 to 11:30 p.m. Dec. 3. A vacant apartment was vandalized, with damage sustained by walls, light fixtures and a mirror. There was no sign of forced entry.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

New Car Dr., 12500 block, 10 a.m. Dec. 3 to 5:30 a.m. Dec. 5. Cash was stolen from an office at a car dealership. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Triadelphia Rd., 12700 block, 7:56 a.m. Dec. 7. A cream 1992 Cadillac Eldorado was stolen.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Eliots Oak Rd., 5400 block, 1:29 p.m. Dec. 2. A male teenager forced his way into an apartment and robbed a female occupant of cash at knifepoint. The victim was treated for cuts at the scene.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Angel Rose Ct., 6300 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 4 to 9 a.m. Dec. 5. An attempt was made to enter a garage at a residence by forcing a door.

Avalanche Way, 11200 block, 1 to 11 p.m. Dec. 7. A jar of coins was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Brook Way, 5200 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 1. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by breaking glass in a sliding door.

Circling Hunter Dr., 4800 block, 9:09 a.m. Dec. 5. Two female teenagers entered a vacant apartment through a bedroom window, then fled empty-handed when confronted. A 16-year-old from Baltimore was arrested.

Fruitgift Pl., 6500 block, 10:26 p.m. Dec. 4. A door was kicked in and windows were broken at a townhouse. Three males were seen fleeing the area.

Majors Lane, 6100 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 27 to 6 p.m. Dec. 1. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a window screen.

Stevens Forest Rd., 5800 block, 2:57 p.m. Dec. 7. A video game system was stolen from a residence.

Twin Knolls Rd., 5500 block, 10 p.m. Dec. 3 to 4:30 a.m. Dec. 4. An attempt was made to break into a pharmacy by smashing a drive-through window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cedar Lane, 5400 block, 11:25 to 11:35 p.m. Dec. 5. A gray-and-red scooter was stolen.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 10:30 p.m. Dec. 1. A blue 1999 Chevrolet Tracker was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Washington Blvd., 6200 block, 5:03 a.m. Dec. 4. A male sitting in a red Honda exposed himself to a gas station employee.

ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd., 6600 block, 10:01 a.m. Dec. 5. A male asked a female for cash, then hit her in the face when she refused. An Elkridge man, 19, was charged with robbery and assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Abel St., 6400 block, 7:15 a.m. to 2:40 p.m. Dec. 5. Video game consoles, games and a camera were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA ROBBERIES

Hollow Ct., 3300 block, 7:34 p.m. Dec. 5. Two men wearing masks threatened a male walking from his vehicle to a residence, then fled with his wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Briarstone Ct., 7700 block, 1 to 11:30 p.m. Dec. 3. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a sliding-glass door.

Emerald Valley Rd., 3100 block, 6 p.m. Dec. 4. An attempt was made to enter a garage at a residence by forcing a door.

Ilchester Rd., 5000 block, 12:30 to 10 a.m. Dec. 4. A bicycle was stolen from an open garage.

Tall Maple Ct., 4600 block, 1:27 p.m. Dec. 7. A residence was entered by breaking a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Town and Country Blvd., 9000 block, 3:20 a.m. Dec. 5. An occupied apartment was entered through an unlocked sliding-glass door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Vinter Way, 4500 block, 12:45 p.m. Dec. 7. A residence was entered through a garage. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted by an occupant returning home.

Woodville Lane, 3800 block, 3 to 8 p.m. Dec. 3. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Springs Dr. W., 3100 block, 2:50 p.m. Dec. 7. A 2008 Carr trailer was stolen.

FULTON AREA ROBBERIES

Maple Lawn Blvd., 7400 block, 3:21 p.m. Dec. 1. A male threatened a bank teller and a customer and took cash from both of them, then fled on foot with a male accomplice who had been waiting outside.

GLENELG AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Triadelphia Rd., 13600 block, 2:17 p.m. Dec. 3. A 16-foot flatbed trailer was stolen.

HIGHLAND AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lime Kiln, 12900 block, 4 p.m. Nov. 23 to noon Nov. 25. Oak railings were stolen from the site of a house under construction.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Bridle Path Lane and N. Laurel Rd., 7:17 p.m. Dec. 7. A male approached a female from behind and tried to force her into a vehicle. When she pushed him aside and screamed, he fled on foot. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Freestate Dr., 8800 block, 7:38 a.m. Dec. 7. An attempt was made to break into a car dealership.

Washington Blvd., 8400 block, 5:30 p.m. Dec. 4 to 1:30 p.m. Dec. 6. Fuel was stolen from a fuel tank in a yard at a business entered by cutting a lock.

MOUNT AIRY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Frederick Rd., 16700 block, 3 to 7 a.m. Dec. 4. Three windows were broken at a church.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

The Washington Post


December 5, 2013 Thursday

Crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 1729 words


Montgomery County crime report Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Rd., 15800 block, 3:45 p.m. Nov. 18. A person forcefully took property from another person at a fast-food restaurant.

Infield Ct., unit block, 7:15 to 8:50 p.m. Nov. 11. A cellphone was stolen from an unlocked vehicle. 

Mount Vernon Pl., 400 block, 1:55 to 7:55 a.m. Nov. 4. An iPod was stolen from a vehicle.

Thorden St., 1100 block, Nov. 11 to 12. Cash, a laptop, an iPad, a checkbook and a ring were stolen from three vehicles. Two of them were unlocked.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

Democracy Blvd., 7100 block, 2 p.m. Nov. 14. An aggravated assault occurred. A 24-year-old Potomac man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore Ave., 5300 block, Nov. 15 to 16. Property was stolen from outside a residence.

Colson Dr., 2400 block, Nov. 17 to 18. Parts were stolen from a vehicle.

Greenvale Rd., 3000 block, 1:30 a.m. Nov. 16. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry. A 24-year-old Chevy Chase man was arrested.

Pyle Rd., 6500 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 12. A man took property from outside a residence and fled.

Shady Oak Lane, 6100 block, Nov. 11 to 12. Property was taken from outside a residence.

Spruell Ct., 3900 block, 9:20 p.m. Nov. 15. A male attempted to enter a residence.

Symphony Park Dr., 10800 block, Nov. 15 to 18. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Willard Ave., 4500 block, 8:30 p.m. Nov. 18. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

February Cir., 11500 block, Nov. 13. A sexual assault occurred.

ROBBERIES

Fenton St., 8300 block, 2:44 p.m. Nov. 14. Three males, one with a weapon, threatened and robbed a person of property.

Greencastle Ridge Dr., 3900 block, 6:45 p.m. Nov. 18. Two masked males, one with a weapon, robbed a person of property.

June 28, 2012 Thursday

Anne Arundel and Howard crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 986 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with these and other felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

Brooklyn Park area

ROBBERIES

Park Rd., 11:47 a.m. June 15. A man forced his way into a residence at gunpoint and restrained an occupant, then fled with jewelry and cash in a white vehicle. The victim was treated for injuries at the scene.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ASSAULTS

Warfield Dr. and Flamingo Rd., 1:21 a.m. June 21. A man and a woman offered a ride to a teenage acquaintance, picking him up in the 5600 block of Ritchie Highway. During the ride to the above location, the two males argued, and the man stabbed the teenager several times. The man and woman fled in the vehicle. The teenager was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries that were not considered life-threatening. 

ROBBERIES

Carroll Rd., 100 block, 2:28 p.m. June 19. Three men knocked two males from their bicycles, then stole the bikes.

Crain Hwy., 1200 block, 5:35 a.m. June 18. A man robbed a restaurant of cash at gunpoint.

Parke West Dr., 7800 block, 3:47 a.m. June 21. Three males got out of a vehicle near an apartment building, then attacked a man smoking a cigarette, chasing him to the back of the building, where he fell to the ground. The men robbed him of a wallet and fled in a 1990s-model light-colored Cadillac with a red roof. No serious injuries were reported.

HANOVER AREA

ROBBERIES

Annapolis Rd., 2600 block, 7:54 a.m. June 15. A man wearing what was described as a police uniform robbed a grocery store of cash at gunpoint, then fled in a light-colored Honda sedan.

ODENTON AREA

ROBBERIES

Annapolis Rd., 1200 block, 12:09 a.m. June 16. A man robbed a pizza delivery driver loading a vehicle of cash at gunpoint, then fled on foot.

Quiet Spring Dr. near Town Center Blvd., 7:50 p.m. June 14. Two male teenagers asked a teenager a question, then punched and kicked him and robbed him of cash and property from his pockets. No serious injuries were reported.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or other suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Spa Creek area, June 16. An Annapolis man, 34, was arrested in connection with the attack of an acquaintance's child. Charges included rape, second- and third-degree sexual assault and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., 300 block, 2:30 p.m. June 16 to 1:45 a.m. June 17. A flat-screen TV was stolen from a home. There was no sign of forced entry.

Bay Forest Ct., 900 block, 3:34 a.m. June 19. Three unlocked vehicles were entered. Nothing was reported missing.

Bay Ridge Ave., 1800 block, 11 p.m. June 17 to 12:25 p.m. June 18. A cellphone was stolen from a vehicle.

Conley Dr., 100 block, 7 a.m. June 18 to 6:45 a.m. June 19. A credit card was stolen from a purse in an unlocked vehicle.

Fleet St., unit block, 9:30 p.m. June 14 to 5:30 a.m. June 15. A purse was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Hudson St., unit block, 10:30 p.m. June 21. An attempt was made to break into a garage by removing a pane from a door. Nothing was reported missing.

President St., 1000 block, 10 to 11:05 a.m. June 19. A purse was stolen from an office. It was recovered in a restroom. Cash was missing.

Prince George St., 100 block, 8 p.m. June 14 to 7:45 a.m. June 15. A bicycle was stolen.

Robert Small Rd., 1800 block, April 1 to June 16. Property was stolen from a storage room.

West St., 2000 block, 9:12 p.m. June 15. A tire was stolen from a bicycle.

Second St., 500 block, 6 p.m. June 20. A bicycle was stolen, and a witness saw a male riding it toward Severn Avenue. At 7:40 p.m., the bike was recovered in the 1100 block of Madison Street. An Annapolis man, 18, was charged with theft.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Croll Dr., 200 block, 6 to 9:45 p.m. June 20. A yellow-and-white scooter was stolen from a parking lot.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other crimes, call the Stop Crime tip line, 410-313-7867.

COLUMBIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

April Brook Cir., 6200 block, 7 p.m. June 16 to 7:45 a.m. June 17. Cash, credit cards and a cellphone were stolen from a garage. A Columbia man, 34, was arrested. Charges included burglary, credit-card fraud, drug possession, possession of a skimming device and theft.

Hyla Brook Dr., 10000 block, 7 p.m. June 15 to 8 a.m. June 16. Copper wire was stolen from a construction site.

Mallard Ct., 8900 block, 4:03 p.m. June 15. An attempt was made to enter a vacant house by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Woodpark Lane, 7600 block, 2 p.m. June 16 to 1:40 a.m. June 17. Jewelry was stolen from an apartment entered by prying open the front door.

ELKRIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Santa Barbara Rd., 6600 block, 11 p.m. June 15 to 12:44 a.m. June 16. A cash drawer was stolen from a business.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore National Pike, 8000 block, 9:45 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. June 15. DVD players and DVDs were stolen from a motel room entered by forcing a door.

Font Hill Dr., 3400 block, 12:30 to 11 a.m. June 16. Bicycles were stolen from a carport entered by forcing a screen door.

Rome Red Way, 5000 block, 9:11 a.m. June 16. A man entered an open garage at a residence, then fled in a vehicle when confronted. A Halethorpe man, 51, was charged with burglary.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 2330 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Maryland Ave., 500 block, 7 to 8 p.m. Sept. 5. A person was assaulted by an acquaintance at a park.  

ROBBERIES

California Cir., 6000 block, 8:21 a.m. Sept. 9. A man with a weapon threatened and robbed a person.

Westmore Ave. and N. Horners Lane, 2:20 to 4 p.m. Sept. 5. Two females and a male forcibly robbed a person of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hungerford Dr.,Lynch St., Redland Rd., Grandin Ave. and Derwood Cir., Sept. 2 to 10. Cash and electronics were stolen from six vehicles. Two were entered by force, two were unlocked, and the method of entry for the last two was unknown.

Shining Willow Dr., 10200 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 9. A break-in occurred at a residence. There was no sign of forced entry, and nothing was reported missing.

Veirs Mill Rd., 2000 block, Sept. 6. A credit card was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Gude Dr. E., 500 block, 7:30 p.m. Sept. 3 to 7 a.m. Sept. 4. A vehicle was stolen.

Gude Dr. W., 100 block, Sept. 6 to 9. A vehicle was stolen.

DISTRICT 5GERMANTOWN STATION240-773-6200 THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Rd., 19500 block, Sept. 6 to 8. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Frederick Rd., 19700 block, 3:30 p.m. Sept. 8 to 7:40 a.m. Sept. 9. Property was stolen from a market under construction. There was no sign of forced entry.

DISTRICT 6GAITHERSBURG STATION240-773-5700 ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

ROBBERIES

Martins Lane, 300 block, 8:30 to 9 p.m. Sept. 9. Two males were talking to two females at a park when a man approached and began a conversation with the two males. Several others joined the man, and they assaulted and robbed the pair of cash, a hunting knife, a cellphone and an iPod. On Sept. 12, a 22-year-old man was arrested in connection with the incident and charged with robbery, first- and second-degree assault and possession of a handgun. On Sept. 16, two men, ages 19 and 21, were arrested and charged with robbery and first- and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hungerford Dr., 400 block, 11:10 a.m. to 4:44 p.m. Sept. 10. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle.

Hungerford Dr., 500 block, 7:40 p.m. Sept. 11 to 7:57 a.m. Sept. 12. A suitcase, a calculator and a stethoscope were stolen from a vehicle.

Martins Lane, 300 block, 4:10 to 5:50 p.m. Sept. 15. Cash and a car key were stolen from an unlocked locker at a recreation center.

Monroe St., 600 block, 4:30 to 7 p.m. Sept. 10. Two laptop computers were stolen from an apartment entered through an unlocked window.

Rockland Ave., 2000 block, 10:15 p.m. Sept. 12 to 6:50 a.m. Sept. 13. Clothing and a pair of earphones were stolen from a vehicle.

Rockville Pike, 1400 block, 1 to 2 a.m. Sept. 15. A cellphone was stolen from a restaurant.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 4 to 11:10 p.m. Sept. 11. A suitcase and two cutlery knives were stolen from a vehicle.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 1:10 to 1:15 p.m. Sept. 13. A woman entered a business and took a purse that had been left unattended.

Rockville Pike, 1600 block, 7:10 to 9:23 p.m. Sept. 13. A backpack containing schoolbooks was stolen from a vehicle.

Rockville Pike, 1700 block, 9:48 a.m. to 8:38 p.m. Sept. 11. A pair of sunglasses, a laptop computer, an iPad, a suitcase, a book, a messenger bag and a GPS device were stolen from two vehicles.

Seven Locks Rd., 1200 block, 7 a.m. Sept. 12. PVC pipes, poles and other property were stolen from a fenced lot entered by cutting a hole in the fence.

Vandegrift Ave., 5900 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 12 to 3 p.m. Sept. 13. A GPS device and cash were stolen from a vehicle.

Veirs Mill Rd., 2200 block, 12:50 to 12:56 p.m. Sept. 14. A male entered a business and fled with several skin-care products and bars of soap. The thief was described as carrying a red backpack and wearing white tennis shoes, black pants and a white shirt with Mickey Mouse on it.

These were among incidents recently reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

Crime report

Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 THEFTS/BREAK-INS

The Washington Post


April 23, 2009 Thursday
