Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ20


LENGTH: 2825 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GLADSTONE DR., 12300 block, 10:30 a.m. April 4. A male in a park grabbed a woman walking a dog and tried to sexually assault her. After a struggle, the assailant fled.

ASSAULTS

HUNGERFORD DR., 400 block, 1:45 a.m. April 4. During an argument with three males in the parking lot of a billiards business, three males were stabbed. The injured males were treated at a hospital. 

ROBBERIES

CHAPMAN AVE., 1600 block, 7:18 p.m. April 3. A male at a Metro station implied that he had a gun and robbed a person of a wallet. An arrest was made at the scene.

FLEET AND MONROE STREETS, 2:45 p.m. April 1. Several males on attacked a youth on a bike path and robbed him of a jacket.

MONTGOMERY AVE. W., 1200 block, 9:15 p.m. April 1. Four men attacked a male in a parking lot and robbed him of property. The victim went to a hospital for treatment of injuries.

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, 1:45 a.m. April 3. A male inside a billiards business hit a patron with a beer bottle and robbed him of a jacket.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ANDERSON AVE., 500 block, April 4 to 5. A CD case was among items stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

CAPRI PL., 6800 block, 9:30 p.m. April 3. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CARTERET RD., 7900 block, April 6 to 7. A backpack containing a laptop computer and a digital music player was stolen from a vehicle.

ENGLISH WAY, 7800 block, April 6 to April 7. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

FALLS CHAPEL WAY, 9200 block, 2:18 a.m. April 5. Responding to a alarm, police arrested several people at an elementary school.

FREDERICK RD., 15600 block, March 31 to April 1. Four wheels and tires were stolen from a 2008 Nissan Quest.

HOWARD AVE., 300 block, 10:29 a.m. April 7. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MANNAKEE ST., 1 to 100 block, 10:30 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. April 2. A digital camera, a digital music player and a laptop computer were stolen from the trunk of a vehicle in a college campus parking lot. The vehicle owner said that she had dropped her keys, which were in the vehicle when she returned to it.

MONUMENT ST., 100 block, April 3 to 4. A digital music player charger was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

PARKLAWN DR., 11800 block, April 1 to 2. A Bobcat skid loader was stolen from a construction site.

WALL ST., 100 block, April 4 to 5. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

WALL ST., 100 block, April 4 to 5. Coins were stolen from an ashtray in an unlocked vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ALEUTIAN AVE., 13200 block, April 3. A black-and-red scooter was stolen from a residence's front yard.

FREDERICK RD., 15500 block, April 4 to 6. A 2005 Chrysler Crossover SUV was stolen.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

ROBBERIES

MARINELLI RD., 5700 block, 11:30 p.m. April 2. Two passengers in a taxi attacked the driver, took cash at gunpoint and fled. Police arrested two males near the White Flint Metro station. The weapon was recovered.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BALTIMORE AVE., 5300 block, 8:30 p.m. April 2 to 8 a.m. April 3. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

BALTIMORE AVE., 5300 block, 10 p.m. April 2 to 6:30 a.m. April 3. A cellphone and cash were stolen from a vehicle.

GEORGETOWN BRANCH DR., 1400 block, 11 to 11:45 a.m. April 6. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

GRUBB RD., 8300 block, 1:15 to 3:45 p.m. April 3. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

MAYWOOD AVE., 8700 block, March 31 to April 1. Coins were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

RIVER RD., 5000 block, April 2 to 3. Side mirrors were stolen from a 1999 BMW.

SEVEN LOCKS RD., 8600 block, 8:15 to 9:15 p.m. April 4. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

BATTERY LANE, 4900 block, 12:40 a.m. April 3. An attempt was made to steal a vehicle. A person inside the car, who had tampered with the dashboard, fled when police arrived.

MOTOR CITY DR., 10400 block, 2 p.m. April 3. A wallet was taken from the purse of a customer at a post office. The victim said that credit cards in the wallet were used.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

INDECENT EXPOSURE

ARLISS ST., 8700 block, 5 p.m. April 1. A 58-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with indecent exposure.

ASSAULTS

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9200 block, 2:29 a.m. April 6. Two males, one armed with a bat, attacked a person who answered a knock at the door of a residence.

ROBBERIES

FEATHERWOOD ST., 1600 block, 6:40 p.m. April 3. Four males attacked a pedestrian and tried to rob him of an iPod. The victim broke free. No property was taken.

ISLINGTON AND FENTON STREETS, 8:32 a.m. March 31. A male tried to take a purse from a woman's shoulder and fled empty-handed.

LOCKWOOD DR., 11400 block, 2:52 p.m. March 31. Five males attacked a youth and robbed him of property.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9300 block, 4:50 p.m. April 6. Two masked men threatened a delivery person in a building stairwell, then robbed him of cash and food at knifepoint.

UNIVERSITY BLVD. AND COLESVILLE RD., 12:59 p.m. March 31. Two males robbed a male youth of property at knifepoint.

WILSON PL. AND 2ND AVE., 7:07 p.m. April 4. Two males knocked a pedestrian to the ground and tried to rob him. The victim broke free. A short time later, two males, ages 16 and 26, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLOUDBERRY CT., 4200 block, 6:05 a.m. to 4:21 p.m. April 6. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

COLUMBIA AND OLD COLUMBIA PIKES, HAWKSHEAD TERR., MUSGROVE RD., TWO FARM AND LOCKWOOD DRIVES, AND SERPENTINE WAY, March 30 to April 5. Seven Global Positioning System devices were among items stolen from eleven vehicles entered by force.

FLOWER AVE., 8400 block, 2:30 to 6:30 p.m. April 4. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GREENWOOD AVE., 8500 block, 10:24 p.m. April 3. Police responding to a call from a neighbor arrested four intruders at a residence.

LODESTONE DR., 1900 block, 10:35 a.m. April 2. Property was taken from a residence. A male seen breaking into a home through a back entrance fled in a white, four-door Lincoln.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 10200 block, 1:01 a.m. April 2. Property was stolen from a pharmacy and a restaurant at a strip mall. Both businesses were entered by force.

 Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ROBBERIES

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6400 block, 1:54 p.m. April 10. Two males entered a dry-cleaning business through the front door and announced a robbery at gunpoint. Joined by an accomplice who came in through the back door, they robbed the business of cash and its employees of property and fled to a waiting 1995 Mercury Grand Marquis with a male at the wheel. The vehicle, which had been reported stolen, was spotted at 9:21 p.m. by police who tried to make a stop. During a chase into the District, the Mercury crashed into a police vehicle, and the motorist and a passenger fled on foot. Two District males, ages 16, and 18, were apprehended and charged with armed robbery, conspiracy to commit armed robbery, use of a handgun in the commission of a felony, second-degree assault and theft of less than $500. Two males remain at large.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 7600 block, 9:30 p.m. April 11 to 12:30 a.m. April 12. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

A 17-year-old male was charged with attempted murder, malicious wounding and the use of a firearm in the commission of a felony. The victim, an acquaintance of the assailant, was treated for injuries.

Potomac Branch Dr., 14800 block, 11 a.m. Sept. 12. During an argument, a woman threw a glass shelf at a man. The victim was treated for injuries to an ear. A 32-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

54 of 507 DOCUMENTS


The Washington Post


January 22, 1992, Wednesday, Final Edition


School for Violent Youths, More Security Proposed in Montgomery


Erin Marcus, Washington Post Staff Writer


SECTION: METRO; PAGE D3


LENGTH: 565 words


Montgomery County Superintendent Paul L. Vance, citing an increase in school crime, proposed yesterday establishing an alternative school for violent students and taking other steps to tighten security.

"I believe these recommendations, while unfortunate in their necessity, are an appropriate response to the increasing occurrence of criminal activity by students and outsiders . . . that affect the health and welfare of the entire school community," he wrote in a letter that accompanied the proposal.

"I believe the situation will get worse if we do not invest in the improvements necessary to address the security and safety needs in all of our schools," he added. 

Calling expulsion "a necessary option," Vance said he wants to review the expulsion process for dangerous students. His proposal also recommends legislation to give school administrators access to juvenile crime records and to impose stiffer punishments for people who commit crimes on school property.

Vance proposed additional security training for all school employees and providing security staff with better equipment, such as metal detectors. His plan also urges establishment of a community-watch program around the schools.

The school board will discuss the proposals at its Feb. 11 meeting.

Alternative schools have been criticized elsewhere as dumping grounds, but Vance insisted his would help violent students by providing them with extra counseling. It also would help keep other students safe, he said. "I see it as an alternative center where we'll be successful in turning out good citizens," he said. "We cannot throw these kids into a garbage can."

Vance did not specify how much his recommendations would cost, but said he thinks residents would approve of spending on school safety.

"No, the money isn't there," he said at a briefing yesterday. "But I submit to you this issue is so critical that the money will be found . . . . I cannot imagine our citizens depriving us of the resources."

School officials said there has been a considerable increase in school crime over the last few years, although they did not supply data supporting that assertion. In the first 10 months of 1991, there were 10 incidents involving guns, school officials said.

So far this year, two sexual assaults have been reported during this school year, compared with three for all of the previous year, police said.

Yesterday, Vance said the county's schools are still considerably safer than those of other jurisdictions.

But he said he views the sexual assaults and gun incidents as a warning, adding that if security deteriorates, parents might take their children out of the school system.

Vance's plan was released in conjunction with a $ 6,500 report written by consultants with the National Alliance for Safe Schools. That report concluded that trespassers are the biggest single cause of concern among teachers, students, parents and administrators.

The president of a coalition of county parent-teacher associations, Sharon Friedman, said she agrees with trying to improve school security, but wonders how the county would pay for Vance's suggestions.

"The bottom line for most parents is: Are their children going to school in a safe environment?" she said, but added, "we're looking at a rather bleak fiscal climate . . . . Will the money be there to fund these sorts of things?"


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


SERIES: Occasional


GRAPHIC: ILLUSTRATION, HIGHLIGHTS: SCHOOL SECURITY


TYPE: MARYLAND NEWS


Copyright 1992 The Washington Post


55 of 507 DOCUMENTS

May 5, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST

Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREAWEAPONS

Roundtree Dr., 5600 block, 12:30 to 2 a.m. April 24. Someone fired a weapon at a residence. Several bullets holes were found in the side of the residence.

DUMFRIES AREAASSAULTS 

Denali Pl., 17400 block, 2:25 a.m. April 21. During an argument a woman allegedly stabbed a male acquaintance several times with a screwdriver. The man was treated for injuries. A 31-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested.

Dumfries and Van Buren roads, 7:07 p.m. April 25. During an undercover operation involving Alcohol Tobacco and Firearms federal agents, a man allegedly attempted to flee in a vehicle. Agents fired weapons, allegedly injuring him. He was taken to a hospital. A 38-year-old Landover, Md. man was arrested and charged with possession with intent to distribute cocaine and felony eluding of police.

MANASSAS AREASEXUAL ASSAULTS

Portsmouth Rd., 10000 block, 4:05 p.m. April 19. A man allegedly sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 53-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Covington Pl., 9500 block, 4:30 to 10:39 p.m. April 19. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an open window.

TRIANGLE AREASEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fuller Heights Rd., 12:36 a.m. April 20. A man allegedly sexually assaulted two female juvenile acquaintances. A 37-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREAASSAULTS

Anchorstone Dr., 5000 block, 7:45 p.m. April 20. A person got out of a vehicle and assaulted a male pedestrian, knocking him to the ground. Several others got out of the vehicle and assaulted the man, who was treated for injuries. The group fled in the vehicle.

WEAPONS

Silversmith Ct., 2100 block, 2 to 2:30 a.m. and 2:40 a.m. Someone fired a weapon. Bullet holes were found in a front window and the side of a residence. A weapon was also fired at another residence, breaking a kitchen window.

Traverser Ct., 15500 block, midnight to noon April 23. Someone fired a weapon, damaging a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 10:05 p.m. April 24. A man entered a residence through an open door and hit a female resident with a gun, then grabbed an empty purse and fled. The woman was treated for injuries.

Hunterbrook Dr., 12700 block, 7 to 8:30 p.m. April 24. A laptop computer was stolen.

Merrywood Ct., 2500 block, 2:30 to 2:40 p.m. April 19. A purse containing cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Sequoia Ct., 2000 block, 11:08 p.m. April 20. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a bedroom window.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Beach Pl., 9700 block, 10:30 a.m. April 26. Three men got out of a vehicle, assaulted a man outside a residence and robbed him of cash.

Weems Rd., 8700 block, 6 p.m. April 26. A male picked up a bike and rode it around a basketball court with another male. When the owner of the bike confronted the male, one of the two males shot the owner several times in the face and torso with a BB gun. The other male punched the owner in the face, and the two fled on the bike. The owner was treated for injuries.

VANDALISM

July 4, 2002 Thursday  
Final Edition


Howard County Crime Watch


SECTION: HOWARD EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 960 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Howard County Police Department. For more information call 410-313-2236.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit organization, will pay up to $ 2,000 for information leading to an indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 410-276-8888. Callers may remain anonymous.  

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COLUMBIA RD., 5400-5600 block, 4:30 a.m. June 25. A man, who had become acquainted with a 17-year-old girl the day before, followed the girl to her car and began beating her. He then pulled out a knife and stabbed her in the chest. The man dragged the girl into a grassy area and continued to beat her and sexually assault her while she was screaming. The girl sustained facial injuries and stab wounds to her chest and was transported to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma unit. The attacker sustained a dog bite from a police K-9 dog and was transported to Howard County General Hospital, treated and released. A man, age 27, was arrested and charged with first- and second-degree attempted murder, rape and assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

AVALANCHE WAY, 11200 block, 9:30 p.m. June 17 to 2 p.m. June 18. A men's mountain bike was stolen from a residence.

AVALANCHE WAY, 11200 block, 1:08-2 a.m. June 23. Several pairs of tennis shoes were stolen from a residence.

FROSTWORK ROW, 6300 block, 9-10:02 p.m. June 25. Two bikes were stolen from a garage.

GOLD RIBBON WAY, 12100 block, 9:30 p.m. June 19. A bicycle was stolen from an open garage.

HALCYON CT., 3200 block, 8-9 a.m. June 19. An electronic game and accessories were stolen from a residence.

POWDER RUN, 11200 block, 5:09 a.m. June 25. A 15-year-old juvenile attempted to enter a residence.

QUIET HOURS, 6700 block, June 18. Electronic equipment was stolen from a residence.

RIVENDELL LANE, 5200 block, 9:30 p.m. June 19. Three juveniles attempted to enter a vacant apartment.

SNOWDEN RIVER PKWY., 9000 block, 2:20 a.m. June 19. A business storage shed was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

TAMAR DR., 8200 block, 10 p.m. June 17 to 1:30 p.m. June 18. A neighborhood pool area was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

TAMAR DR., 8200 block, 9:30 p.m. June 19 to 9:30 a.m. June 20. A neighborhood pool area was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

TAMAR DR., 8400 block, 10 p.m. June 24 to 8 a.m. June 25. An attempt was made to enter a neighborhood pool area.

WEATHER WORN WAY, 7500 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. June 19. Cash was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

SHAKER DR., 10400 block, June 17 to 20. A 1991 Mazda Protege was stolen.

SHARP ANTLER, 9300 block, 12:01 a.m. June 24. A 1995 Dodge van was stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 749 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Canton Ct., 3300 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. March 14. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Taconic Cir., 16200 block, 3:14 p.m. March 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by kicking in a back door. Two males were seen fleeing empty-handed. 

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Sowder Village Sq., 9900 block, 11:06 p.m. March 16. During an argument in a parking lot, a man broke a window of an acquaintance's vehicle and forced her into his vehicle. After a brief struggle, she took his keys and fled on foot. He then tried to chase her down using her vehicle. A 19-year-old Bealeton man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Superior Ct., 13200 block, 8:04 p.m. March 16. A man robbed a deliveryman of cash and a delivery at gunpoint.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Norfolk St., 9600 block, 5 p.m. March 17 to 9 a.m. March 19. A 2003 black BMW X5 was stolen using a key taken from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kerill Rd., 18400 block, 8:20 a.m. March 15 to 12:25 p.m. March 17. A painting was stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

South Woodbridge area, March 13. A man attacked an acquaintance at a residence. A 33-year-old Woodbridge man was charged with sexual assault.

ASSAULTS

Harbor Dr., 12600 block, 3:18 p.m. March 17. During an argument, a man attacked a male acquaintance. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Langtree Lane, 13600 block, 10:40 a.m. March 13. A man attacked an acquaintance after kicking in the front door of her residence.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Big Crest Lane, 14000 block, March 13. A 24-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested in connection with the sale of firearms to a convicted felon.

ROBBERIES

Featherstone Rd., 1500 block, 12:11 a.m. March 17. Two men wearing masks threatened an employee and robbed a store of several cartons of cigarettes.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 15900 block, 12:10 a.m. March 13. A woman knocked on the front door of a residence and asked an occupant to give her a ride. As they were driving, the woman implied that she had a gun and started to go through the purse of the motorist, who then drove to a police station. After a brief foot chase, a 28-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Balsam St., 14600 block, 2 to 3:30 p.m. March 17. An MP3 player was among property stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Cotton Mill Dr., 12300 block, 5 p.m. March 11 to 11:42 a.m. March 12. A business was entered by forcing a door. Nothing was reported missing.

Darby Brooke Ct., 12700 block, 8:30 p.m. March 15 to 11 a.m. March 16. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by forcing a back door.

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 4 p.m. March 20. Three male juveniles tried to break into a residence, then fled empty-handed when confronted by a neighbor.

Old Bridge Rd., 1500 block, 12:01 to 9:15 a.m. March 11. Six computers were stolen from a business.

Pheasant Lane, 2900 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. March 13. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Royal Ct., 16500 block, 9:20 a.m. March 12. A man knocked on the front door of a residence. When he received no answer, he went around back and broke a window, then fled empty-handed when confronted.

Shetland Ct., 14300 block, 6:20 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. March 14. Two video game systems, a computer monitor and several pairs of sneakers were among property stolen from a residence.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Wharton Ct. and Confederate Trail, 4:45 p.m. March 14. A window of a moving bus was broken by a rock thrown from nearby.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bucyrus Ct., 8500 block, 6 p.m. March 14 to 10 a.m. March 15. Eleven aluminum concrete forms were stolen from a business. The owner reported that seven other forms had been stolen from the premises earlier in the month.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Central Park Dr., 10300 block, 7 a.m. to 1:25 p.m. March 14. A 1987 camouflage-painted Dodge Ram truck was stolen.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., 10 a.m. March 3 to 8 a.m. March 11. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Kent Dr., 7:30 p.m. March 15 to 9 a.m. March 16. A vehicle's paint-finish was scratched.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Shops at County Center area, 11:03 p.m. Sept. 18. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A 26-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

ROBBERIES  

Smoketown Rd. and Garza Way, 10:52 p.m. Sept. 17. A group of men attacked a pedestrian and robbed him of a cellphone. The victim was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ensbrook Lane, 4400 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 13 to 12:55 a.m. Sept. 14. Cash, a laptop computer, a video game system and video games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Whitmer Dr., 4400 block, 9:45 a.m. to 8:35 p.m. Sept. 15. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

GAINESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Daves Store Lane, 14100 block, 1:37 a.m. Sept. 17. During an argument, a man hit man in the back of the head with a glass mug. Both men were treated for injuries caused by broken glass. A 36-year-old Fauquier County man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Ashland Dr., 8000 block, 3:24 a.m. Sept. 18. Two men with a baseball bat attacked a male pedestrian, then fled on foot. The victim was treated for head injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Occoquan Forest Dr., 6100 block, noon Sept. 13 to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 17. A vehicle broken into inside a garage. Nothing was reported missing.

Omega Lane, 6000 block, 7:15 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. Sept. 19. Cash and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Beau Ridge Dr., 15700 block, 7:09 p.m. Sept. 17. A male was shot in the back of the head while he was asleep. A 17-year-old male was charged with attempted murder, malicious wounding and the use of a firearm in the commission of a felony. The victim, an acquaintance of the assailant, was treated for injuries.

La Harve Pl., 3700 block, 9:10 a.m. Sept. 13. During an argument, a woman attacked a man at knifepoint. The victim was treated for a cut to a finger. A 42-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Potomac Branch Dr., 14800 block, 11 a.m. Sept. 12. During an argument, a woman threw a glass shelf at a man. The victim was treated for injuries to an ear. A 32-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 15000 block, 2 a.m. Sept. 18. After an argument, a man threatened a towing-business employee at gunpoint. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Indiana Ave., 1500 block, 9:25 p.m. Sept. 19. A gunman robbed a deliveryman of cash.

Wildlife Way and Indiana Ave., 10:02 p.m. Sept. 19. Three males threatened a pedestrian and tried to rob him of cash. After a brief struggle, the assailants fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Artery Lane, 14400 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 12 to 2:30 a.m. Sept. 13. A handgun, ammunition and electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Barnabas Trail, 15200 block, 8:30 a.m. to noon Sept. 16. Shoes and games were stolen from a residence entered through a front door.

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, Sept. 11 to 9:30 a.m. Sept. 18. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Duran Dr., 14400 block, 10 a.m. Sept. 13 to 4 p.m. Sept. 15. Copper piping was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Evansdale Rd., 4300 block, midnight Sept. 4 to 9 a.m. Sept. 10. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence.

Findley Rd., 3900 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 2 to 9:30 p.m. Sept. 15. Copper piping and tools were stolen from a residence.

Gableridge Turn, 1900 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 16 to 5 p.m. Sept. 17. A video game system, a cellphone and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Kidwell Dr., 12900 block, 12:20 to 5 a.m. Sept. 12. Two guitars were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Quaint Dr., 5400 block, noon to 6:45 p.m. Sept. 13. A video game system, video games and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Qualey Pl., 5300 block, 4:34 a.m. Sept. 17. A residence was entered by kicking in a back door. Nothing was reported missing. Two 20-year-old Woodbridge men were arrested.

Starling Ct., 4400 block, 8 a.m. to 5:20 p.m. Sept. 16. A residence was entered by forcing a basement door. Nothing was reported missing.

Starling Ct., 4400 block, noon to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 16. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Westminster Lane, 14300 block, 6:30 to 9 p.m. Sept. 14. Cash and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Center St., 8900 block, 2:25 a.m. Sept. 16. A weapon was fired several times. A 57-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 11:20 a.m. Sept. 16. Clothes were stolen from a store. A man was seen fleeing with the property in a vehicle.

Walden St., 100 block, Sept. 19. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence, resulting in a gas leak.

December 1, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 702 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULTS

Barnacle Pl., 5000 block, 4:05 p.m. Nov. 18. During an argument, a woman cut a male acquaintance with a knife. A 25-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

American Elm, 17200 block, 4:36 a.m. Nov. 16. Four unlocked vehicles were entered. Nothing was reported missing.

Yorktown Dr., 15400 and 15500 blocks, 11 p.m. Nov. 15 to 2 a.m. Nov. 16. Two cameras and cash were stolen from an unlocked vehicle. Nothing was reported missing from six other unlocked vehicles entered.

GAINESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Old Linton Hall Rd., 7500 block, 12:31 a.m. Nov. 20. A man attacked a woman who had gotten into his vehicle, then tried to prevent her from leaving. A 44-year-old Gainesville man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Winfield Loop, 10500 block, 3:25 a.m. Nov. 20. A man wearing a uniform and displaying a badge sexually assaulted a woman, then fled to a nearby home. A 52-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Sudley Rd., 7400 block, 2:38 p.m. Nov. 19. Three women attacked a woman outside a restaurant. The victim said that they had argued with her earlier, inside the restaurant. No serious injuries were reported.

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 5:22 p.m. Nov. 17. A man argued with an acquaintance inside a store, then struck him with a baseball bat in the parking lot. The victim was taken to a hospital. A 19-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Balls Ford Rd., 10800 block, 9:18 p.m. Nov. 18. A bank was robbed by a woman who implied that she had a handgun.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 2:53 a.m. Nov. 20. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance as she approached her vehicle in a parking lot. A 38-year-old Stafford man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Aldrin St., 13200 block, 11:30 p.m. Nov. 19. During an argument, a man punched a male acquaintance in the face several times. A 29-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested.

Kirkdale Dr., 4700 block, 2:38 p.m. Nov. 16. During an argument, a group of males attacked an 18-year-old man. A 17-year-old Woodbridge male was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Cressida Pl., 4100 block, 3:58 p.m. Nov. 17. At a meeting to conduct an Internet sales transaction, a man robbed a man of a cellphone at gunpoint.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 5:59 p.m. Nov. 15. A male snatched a cellphone from a woman, then fled on foot.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 11:39 a.m. Nov. 18. Three males threatened a man getting off a bus and tried to rob him of a cellphone, then fled with its battery when the device broke after being dropped.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Langstone Dr., 13800 block, 7 a.m. to noon Nov. 16. A TV, a laptop, jewelry and other electronics were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chervil Ct., 10200 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 15. Responding to a report of an attempted break-in, police confronted a man in the back yard of a residence. The man threw a pair of pliers at police and struggled with officers during his arrest. A 47-year-old Culpeper man was charged with two counts of assault on a law enforcement officer, resisting arrest by force, breaking and entering and possession of tools used in a burglary.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Scott Dr., 12:30 to 9 a.m. Nov. 13. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

The Washington Post


February 16, 1984, Thursday, Final Edition


CRIME WATCH


SECTION: Virginia Weekly; Neighborhood Report; Va. 5


LENGTH: 537 words



Arlington

Arlington County police received the following crime reports from Feb. 2 to 8. For further information, call 558-2267.
Homicide

STAFFORD ST. N., 1900 block, 7:30 to 9:09 p.m. Feb. 7. A 24-year-old Arlington man was shot to death in his apartment after he and another resident of the apartment had been drinking. Moises A. Flories was pronounced dead on arrival at Arlington Hospital. The second resident, a 36-year-old man, was arrested and charged with first-degree murder. 
Sexual Assault

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 8:30 p.m. Feb. 5. A woman was taking groceries from her car in a parking garage when a man drove up and made sexual comments to her. He then got of his car, exposed himself and grabbed her. The woman kicked him and he fled.
Robberies

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5000 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 3. A man entered a store office and asked for a job. When told he was in the wrong place, he put his hand in his coat pocket, implying he had a gun and announced a holdup. He took money from the cash register and fled.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2900 block, 11:28 a.m. Feb. 7. A man jumped over a teller counter at a bank. He found a key to unlock the cash drawer, took money from the drawer and fled.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 1700 block, 5:26 p.m. Feb. 6. A man entered a game arcade and asked an attendant for change for a $20 bill. The attendant went to change the bill and the man followed him into the office, pulled out a gun and demanded money. The attendant pushed him outside the office, locked the door and called the police. The man had fled by the time the police arrived.

WILSON BLVD., 3000 block, 7:25 p.m. Feb. 4. A man armed with a pistol entered a store, pulled up his coat and revealed the pistol to the clerk. The man took money from the counter and fled.
Thefts/Break-ins

ARLINGTON BLVD., 2200 block, 3 p.m. Feb. 5 to 11:05 a.m. Feb. 6. Four color RCA televison sets were taken from four hotel rooms.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 1500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Feb. 6. A man's silver 12-speed bicycle, a Sanyo AM-FM stereo radio cassette player and headphones were taken from a residence.

MOORE ST. N., 1700 block, Feb. 6. Jewelry valued at $500 was taken from a business. Entry was by breaking a glass panel.

QUINCY ST. S., 1900 block, 10:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Feb. 4. A video recorder, recording tapes and jewelry were taken from a residence. Entry was through the basement.

THOMAS ST. N., 200 block, Feb. 3. A Sears electric air compressor was taken from a shed. Entry was by breaking off the padlock on the shed door.

FIRST ST. S., 5800 block, 9 a.m. to 6:10 p.m. Feb. 2. A Sony black and white eight-inch television set, a General Electric AM-FM clock radio, a Tiffany lamp, a wall phone and some bottles of wine were taken from a residence. Entry was by removing plywood that covered a doorway.

17TH ST. N., 4500 block, 9:30 to 11 p.m. Feb. 6. An IBM Selectric II typewriter, a camera and jewelry were taken from a residence.

17TH ST. N., 1300 block, 2 p.m. Feb. 3 to 3 p.m. Feb. 6. An Apple II computer was taken from a business.

31ST RD. S., 600 block, 7 a.m. to 6:25 p.m. Feb. 3. Audio equipment and coins were taken from a residence. Entry was through a basement window.

Calvert County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T15


LENGTH: 317 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Calvert County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigations Section, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solver's Line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the State Police at 410-535-1400.  

ASSAULTS

CHESAPEAKE BEACH, July 27. A male youth, 13, punched and kicked another youth. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

KENWOOD BEACH, 9 p.m. Aug. 5 to 11 a.m. Aug. 6. Three Crime Watch signs were stolen from the neighborhood.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LAZY RIVER RD., 9 p.m. July 30 to 7:15 a.m. July 31. Three vehicles were spray-painted.

ROUSBY HALL RD., 12:01 to 6:45 a.m. July 29. Tires were slashed on three vehicles.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HONEYSUCKLE LANE, 1:30 to 7 p.m. July 31. A whirlpool Jacuzzi was stolen from a home under construction.

SKINNERS TURN RD., 3:30 p.m. July 28 to 5:30 p.m. July 29. A 1997 Bobcat 763 loader was stolen from a work site.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HALLOWING POINT PARK, 12:30 to 7:30 a.m. July 29. A Harley-Davidson Sportster was stolen when the owner went to get help after the motorcycle became disabled.

PRINCE FREDERICK, 1 to 5 a.m. July 27. A window was broken and liquor was stolen from the Bridge Diner & Carry Out.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

ST. LEONARD, 1:45 p.m. Aug. 3. A man, 41, held a woman captive and sexually assaulted her at a motel. He was charged with first-degree sexual assault, second-degree assault and false imprisonment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALVERT BEACH RD., 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. July 29. A DVD player, a stereo system and a color TV were stolen from a residence.

CHESAPEAKE AVE., July 22. A minibike was stolen from the front yard of a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CAPE LEONARD DR., 12:15 to 12:45 a.m. Aug. 3. A vehicle was damaged with a pool stick.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1139 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Endsbrook Lane, 4400 block, 2:15 a.m. Aug. 16. Two males hit a male juvenile several times in the face, then robbed him of a phone. The juvenile was treated for injuries.

Redwing Dr. and Whittier Loop, 4:45 p.m. Aug. 9. A group of males assaulted a male juvenile pedestrian and robbed him of a bottle of soda. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cherry Hill Rd., 1500 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 14 to 10 a.m. Aug. 15. Cash was stolen from a business entered through an unlocked side door. 

Old Stage Coach Rd., 17400 block, 7:57 a.m. Aug. 12. A man jumped over a fence and took 50 aluminum rims from a business.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berkley Dr., 15900 block, 8 p.m. Aug. 15 to 2:26 a.m. Aug. 16. A country club was entered by breaking a window of a pool house. Nothing was reported stolen.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Mission Ridge Dr., 10900 block, 11:31 p.m. Aug. 14. A man held a female acquaintance inside a residence against her will. He allegedly had raped her several days earlier. A 42-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blue Gray Cir., 7800 block, 9:30 a.m. Aug. 7 to 2 p.m. Aug. 11. Tools and other property were stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear window.

Pointer Lane, 8100 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 8 to 1:20 p.m. Aug. 9. A laptop computer, a TV and a camera were stolen from a residence entered through a window.

Santa Rose Ct., 13600 block, 8:30 p.m. Aug. 9 to 8:30 p.m. Aug. 10. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Saranac Pl., 12000 block, 1:36 a.m. Aug. 11. A male intruder in a residential garage was opening the door of a vehicle as a resident was closing the garage door. When he saw the resident, the man fled empty-handed.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Earl Ct., 3500 block, 5:42 a.m. Aug. 11. During an argument, a man hit a female acquaintance several times in the face. The woman was treated for injuries. A 29-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Red Oak Lane, 18900 block, 3:51 p.m. Aug. 12. A man was attempting to take a TV from a residence when a resident saw him. The intruder fled to a nearby house. A 30-year-old Stafford man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Sugar Hill Dr., 1800 block, 2:47 p.m. Aug. 13. A man at community pool grabbed a woman and pulled her to him. The woman escaped and called police. A 45-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Cavalier Dr., 12400 block, 1:04 a.m. Aug. 13. Four males in a residential garage were looking at a handgun, when one picked up the gun and pulled the trigger, accidentally shooting another male in the arm. The man was treated for injuries. A 24-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with reckless handling of a firearm.

Mohican Dr.,11800 block, 2:25 a.m. Aug. 15. Someone fired BBs from a vehicle, hitting two parked vehicles and a residence. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Financial Loop, 1700 block, 6:13 a.m. Aug. 13. A gunman robbed a male motorist of cash at a drive-through area for an ATM.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brussels Way, 3900 block, 6:30 p.m. Aug. 12 to 2 p.m. Aug. 15. A handgun and other property were stolen from a vehicle.

Church Hill Dr., 13800 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 5 to noon Aug. 10. An air conditioner was stolen from a senior center.

Fortuna Ct., 3800 block, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Aug. 11. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 1 to 3 p.m. Aug. 14. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a window.

John Coffee Ct., 2800 block, 4:30 p.m. July 31 to 3 p.m. Aug. 8. Tools were stolen from a garage.

Nanticoke Way, 16500 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 13 to 8 p.m. Aug. 15. A pressure washer was stolen from a storage shed of a business. The shed was entered by breaking a lock.

Occoquan Rd., 12900 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 8 to 11 a.m. Aug. 10. A computer and a TV were stolen from a business entered through an unlocked rear door.

Ogilvie Ct., 3800 block, 10:51 p.m. Aug. 13. Three men, one armed with a gun, entered a residence through an unlocked rear door. They tied up a male resident with an extension cord, took his car keys and robbed two other residents of cash.

Smoketown Rd., 14000 block, noon to 5 p.m. Aug. 9. Two computers were stolen from a church.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

Minnieville Rd., 13100 block, 10:49 p.m. Aug. 14. A man climbed a ladder and looked into a residence. A neighbor notified a resident, and the man fled.

VANDALISM

Antietam Rd., 12000 block, 8:12 a.m. Aug. 15. A male threw a rock at a school, breaking a front door.

Cordell Ave., 3800 block, 1 a.m. Aug. 12 to 12:10 a.m. Aug. 13. Someone spray-painted a school wall, two classroom trailers, a storage container and four telephone boxes.

Marquis Pl., 3800 block, 8 p.m. Aug. 9 to noon Aug. 10. Someone used a flare to burn an inappropriate design into a plastic slide at a school playground. The bottom of the slide was also burned.

 Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Devonshire Ct., 8600 block, Aug. 14. A man assaulted a female relative. An Inwood, N.Y., man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Euclid Ct., 9100 block, 7 p.m. Aug. 10. Someone fired BBs, breaking a window at a business.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Bens Way, 10200 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 13. A man with a T-shirt over his face was fondling himself as a female pedestrian walked by.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cockrell Rd., 9800 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 8. A woman stole lottery tickets from a convenience store.

Corydalis Ct., 10000 block, 5:40 p.m. Aug. 10 to 7 a.m. Aug. 11. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle.

Garden St., 9600 block, 12:30 a.m. to 9:40 p.m. Aug. 8. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Taney Rd., 9400 block, 4 to 9 a.m. Aug. 12. A video game system and video games were stolen from a residence.

Wakeman Ct., 10600 block. An HVAC unit for a train was stolen from a business.

Willow Glen Ct., 8400 block, 1:30 to 9 a.m. Aug. 14. A Global Positioning System device, cash and other property were stolen from two vehicles.

VANDALISM

Plantation Lane, 8600 block, 9:20 p.m. Aug. 12 to 8 a.m. Aug. 14. Stained-glass windows of a church were damaged.

Point of Woods Dr., 8600 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 11 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 12. Windows of a vehicle were broken.

Sudley Rd., 8600 block, 12:45 a.m. July 30; 5 p.m. Aug. 2 to noon Aug. 3; and 8:40 a.m. Aug. 5 to 7 a.m. Aug. 6. During three incidents, someone broke stained-glass windows of a church.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kent Village Sq., 100 block, 1:26 p.m. Aug. 11. An iPad and case were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Howard County Crime Watch


SECTION: HOWARD EXTRA; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 846 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Howard County Police Department. For more information call 410-313-2236.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit organization, will pay up to $ 2,000 for information leading to an indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 410-276-8888. Callers may remain anonymous.  

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COLUMBIA. Two males, ages 16 and 18, were charged as adults in connection with the April 22 sexual assault of a 15-year-old female. The victim had allegedly arrived home intoxicated and was taken to a hospital, where an examination determined there had been sexual activity, which she could not recall. An investigation revealed that she had been drinking at a friend's house with the two males, who were charged with second-degree rape, second-degree assault and other offenses.

ROBBERIES

MORNINGBIRD LANE, 5800 block, 6:53 p.m. June 17. Four or five male juveniles tried to take a bicycle from a 9-year-old. When the child's mother intervened, the juveniles fled.

MURRAY HILL RD., 7600 block, 9:26 p.m. June 18. A male wearing a mask robbed a convenience store at gunpoint.

STEVENS FOREST RD., 11:45 p.m. June 14. Three males, one armed with a knife, tried to rob a male.

TAMAR DRIVE, near Kendall Ridge Pool, June 13. A male juvenile was assaulted and robbed of cash by a group of juveniles.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BERGER RD., 9200 block, 4:38 a.m. June 16. Several people were seen running away from a business that had been entered. Two males, ages 20 and 24, and a juvenile were arrested. A warrant was issued for a 21-year-old male.

DASHER CT., 6600 block, 12:30 a.m. June 15. An occupant of a resident heard a noise and saw a male near the front door. After the male fled on a bicycle, the resident discovered that a purse was missing.

MURRAY HILL RD., 7600 block, 3:22 a.m. June 15. Several cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a convenience store.

RUSHLIGHT PATH, 5000 block, 12:23 p.m. June 17. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

STANFORD BLVD., 8800 block, 7:45 p.m. June 11-8 a.m. June 12. Electronic equipment was stolen from a business.

WELCOME HOME DR., 6200 block, 10 p.m. June 13-8 a.m. June 14. A purse containing cash was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA RD., 5600 block, 9 p.m. June 14-10 a.m. June 15. A green 1998 Dodge Neon was stolen.

CONNELL CT., 900 block, June 11-12. A 2000 Yamaha motorcycle was stolen.

KILIMANJARO RD., 9400 block, 9:30 a.m. June 8-7 p.m. June 15. A blue 2001 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

RED BRANCH RD., 9000 block, 10:27 a.m. June 12. A trailer was stolen.

STEVENS FOREST RD., 6200 block, 8:38 a.m. June 12. A rental van was stolen.

ROBBERIES

WASHINGTON BLVD., 6300 block, 2:25 a.m. June 17. A male who implied that he had a weapon robbed a gas station of cash and cigarettes.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROWANBERRY DR., 6300 block, 3 p.m. June 13-10 a.m. June 15. A cordless phone was stolen from a business.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

RACE RD., 5800 block, 8:30 p.m. June 15-1 p.m. June 16. A blue 2001 Yamaha motorcycle was stolen.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 7200 block, 8 a.m. June 11-noon June 13. A burgundy 1995 Cadillac Fleetwood was stolen.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

OLD FREDERICK RD., 8400 block, June 7. A 15-year-old girl visiting a relative was talked into getting into a vehicle with a male who sexually assaulted her at this address. On June 8, when the abduction and assault were reported, a 25-year-old Baltimore County man was arrested in New York. He was brought back to Maryland on June 9 and charged with several sex offenses, second-degree assault and other charges.

ROBBERIES

OLD ANNAPOLIS RD., 9100 block, 10:41 p.m. June 12. A gunman robbed a pizza restaurant of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LASALLE CT., 8700 block, 4:29 a.m. June 17. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

LASALLE CT., 8700 block, 4:29-5:37 a.m. June 17. A purse was stolen from a residence. It was later recovered, overturned, in the basement of the residence.

PURPLE TWILIGHT CT., 4200 block, 11:30 p.m. June 10-noon June 12. Stereo equipment was stolen from a residence.

ROAN STALLION LANE, 6300 block, 10 a.m. June 13. A camera was stolen from a vehicle parked inside a residential garage.

ROAN STALLION LANE, 6300 block, 8 a.m. June 13. Roller skates were stolen from a vehicle parked inside a residential garage.

SONIA TRAIL, 3300 block, 8 p.m. June 13-12:30 p.m. June 14. A purse was stolen from a residence.

SPRING SHOWERS WAY, 8400 block, 4:30 p.m. June 12-5:30 p.m. June 13. Electronic equipment was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

DRY STONE GATE, 6300 block, June 13. A green 1999 Ford Contour was stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WINTERBROOK LANE, 10100 block, 11:15 a.m. June 12. An attempt was made to enter a business.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

HOMESTEAD CT., 8600 block, 9 p.m. June 13-9 a.m. June 14. A black 1999 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FREDERICK RD., 13700 block, 6 p.m. June 15-8 a.m. June 16. Plants were stolen from a nursery.

-- Compiled by Linda James

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW26


LENGTH: 346 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

ROBBERIES

SMOKETOWN RD., 13800 block, 12:29 p.m. Feb. 16. Two masked men, one implying he had a gun, robbed a store of cash. 

Gainesville area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MCGRAWS CORNER DR., 5900 block, 6:48 p.m. Feb. 15. A woman allegedly stole prescription medicine from a pharmacy. A 21-year-old Gainesville woman was arrested and charged with theft with intent to distribute or sell.

Lake Ridge area

ASSAULTS

LEGERE CT., 3500 block, 10:15 p.m. Feb. 17. During an argument, a man allegedly assaulted a male acquaintance. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 55-year-old Lake Ridge man was arrested.

Manassas area

WEAPONS

CUB RUN CT., 10200 block, 11:15 a.m. Feb. 13. A woman allegedly pointed a weapon at a person clearing snow from a street. A 70-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

Triangle area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

TANGARIRO SQ. AND YELLOW STONE LOOP AREA, Feb. 16. A man allegedly raped a female juvenile relative during the past four months. A 32-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

IVY CT., 1700 block, 7:09 p.m. Feb. 18. A man allegedly entered a relative's residence through a rear glass door. He was found sitting naked on a couch when a female resident and her four juvenile relatives returned home. They shouted at the man, who dressed and left. A 19-year-old man was arrested.

Woodbridge area

ROBBERIES

CARDINAL DR., 4 a.m. Feb. 17. Three males demanded a wallet from a male pedestrian walking his dog. When the pedestrian said he didn't have a wallet, one of the males punched him in the face, and the three fled empty-handed.

Manassas

The following incident was reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

TUDOR LANE, 9000 block, Feb. 18. A male teacher allegedly sexually assaulted a male juvenile. A 49-year-old man was arrested.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for today's Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 1956 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

No report was available from the Rockville Station for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 240-773-5030 or 240-773-6070.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATION301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

West Virginia and Wisconsin avenues, 11 p.m. Nov. 26. An aggravated assault occurred. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cedar Lane, 9800 block, Colchester Dr., 4200 block, and Glenrose St., 4200 block, Nov. 21 to 29. A car seat, a bike rack and change were among property stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

Democracy Blvd., 7100 block, Nov. 21 to 29. Laptop computers were among property from three vehicles entered by force at a shopping mall.

Ellingston Dr., 8000 block, Nov. 28 to 29. Auto parts were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Maple Ave., 7300 block, Nov. 22 to 26. A residence was entered by force.

Massachusetts Ave., Nov. 22 to 23. Credit cards, a bike rack and cash were among property stolen from six unlocked vehicles.

Michaels Dr., 6600 block, Nov. 22 to 24. Property and cash were stolen from a residence.

Pooks Hill Rd., 5200 block, 8 p.m. Nov. 26. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Rockville Pike, 11300 block, 9 to 10 p.m. Nov. 23. An iPod was stolen from the pocket of a person at a restaurant.

45th St., 7100 block, 4 p.m. Nov. 26. Property was stolen from a vehicle. A 45-year-old District man was arrested.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Highland Ave.,4500 block, Nov. 24 to 26. A 2008 Honda Civic was stolen from a residence that had been burglarized.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATION301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Robey Park area, 2:07 p.m. Nov. 25. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

Robey Park area, 10 p.m. Nov. 26. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

ASSAULTS

Hampshire West Ct., 1400 block, 3:30 a.m. Nov. 25. A female attacked a person.

Mount Pisgah Rd., 1700 block, 11:45 p.m. Nov. 21. A man attacked a male pedestrian, then threatened him with a weapon.

Pennydog Ct., 1:44 a.m. Nov. 27. Four males attacked a person.

Robey Rd., 3400 block, 11:33 p.m. Nov. 23. A man forced his way into a residence and attacked an acquaintance. A 22-year-old Hyattsville man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Columbia Pike, 13800 block, 6:15 a.m. Nov. 24. Two men armed with a weapon robbed a convenience store of property.

University Blvd., 600 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 21. Three men attacked a man and robbed him of property. Three men, ages 18, 21 and 23, were arrested.

White Oak Lane, 1600 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 22 and 12:15 p.m. Nov. 23. In two separate incidents, food-delivery employees were robbed of property. Both incidents involved five male assailants, one of whom was armed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brunett Ave., 10000 block, 6:40 a.m. to 9:40 p.m. Nov. 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Burlington Dr., 800 block, 6:30 p.m. Nov. 22 to 7:30 a.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

Countryside Dr., 2500 block, 9:41 a.m. Nov. 28. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Dale Dr., 700 block, 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Dennis Ave., 1100 block, 10:30 a.m. Nov. 22 to 11:59 p.m. Nov. 29. Property was stolen from a residence.

East West Hwy., 1200 block, 4 a.m. Nov. 26. A break-in occurred at an office complex. A 58-year-old District man was arrested.

February Cir., 11500 block, 9 a.m. to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 25. Property was stolen from a residence.

Grayson Ave., 9900 block, 8:15 a.m. to 6:57 p.m. Nov. 22. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Greenhill Way, 300 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a residence.

Houston Ave., 1000 block, 3:43 p.m. Nov. 26. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Islington St., 800 block, 7 a.m. to 3:28 p.m. Nov. 28. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Marlowe Farm Dr., 13000 block, 6 a.m. Nov. 24 to 2:37 p.m. Nov. 25. A residence was entered by force.

Ripley St., 1100 block, Nov. 22. Property was stolen from a construction site entered by force. Three District men, ages 22, 23 and 37, were arrested.

Thayer Ave., 500 block, 7:52 to 8:26 p.m. Nov. 21. A residence was entered by force.

DISTRICT 4WHEATON STATION240-773-5500

CAR JACKING

Veirs Mill Rd., 12600 block, 12:50 a.m. Nov. 29. Two men armed with a weapon forced a motorist from a vehicle parked in front of a fast-food restaurant, then drove away in the vehicle.

ASSAULTS

Dalewood Dr., 11900 block, Nov. 21 to 29. A man attacked an acquaintance.

Pear Tree Ct., 3600 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 29. A domestic aggravated assault occurred. An 18-year-old Aspen Hill man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ara Dr., 2700 block, Nov. 23 to 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Belgrade Rd. S., 700 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. Nov. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Dumfries Cir., 17900 block, Old Baltimore Rd., 18000 block, Rose Theatre Cir., 2000 block, St. Albert Terr., 2400 block, and Shotley Pl., 17800 block, Nov. 22 to 23. Property was stolen from unlocked vehicles.

Flint Rock Rd., 14100 block, 12:30 to 1 p.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a residence.

Landgreen St., 4100 block, Nov. 25 to 26. A residence was entered by force.

Orange Dr., 900 block, 1 to 6 p.m. Nov. 28. Property was stolen from a residence.

Redgate Dr., 15200 block, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Nov. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

St. George Way, 2400 block, Nov. 22 to 23. Property was stolen from a residence.

DISTRICT 5GERMANTOWN STATION240-773-6200

ROBBERIES

Gunners Branch and Frederick roads, 11:30 a.m. Nov. 27. A man armed with a weapon threatened a woman and robbed her of property.

Mateny Rd. and Eagles Roost Dr., 9 p.m. Nov. 22. Two males threatend a person, then fled with property in a small, white vehicle.

Mateny Rd. and Great Seneca Hwy., 3:30 p.m. Nov. 28. A strong-arm robbery occurred. The victim, a male, was robbed of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Rd., 19700 block, 1:41 to 2 a.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a hair and nail salon entered by force.

Frederick Rd., 19700 block, Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a barbershop entered by force.

Grand Elm St., 12800 block, 1:45 p.m. Nov. 28. A man wearing a ski mask tried to break into a residence, then fled empty-handed.

Howard Chapel Dr., 26800 block, 1:45 p.m. Nov. 21 to 12:10 a.m. Nov. 22. Property was stolen from a residence.

Ridge Rd., 26100 block, 2:14 a.m. Nov. 25. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

Stoney Bottom Rd., 12200 block, 12:01 to 2:43 a.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Summer Oak Dr., 11800 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 23 to 8:10 p.m. Nov. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Winterspoon Lane, 13500 block, 9:50 a.m. Nov. 23. A break-in occurred at a residence. A 19-year-old Poolesville man was arrested.

DISTRICT 6GAITHERSBURG STATION240-773-5700

ROBBERIES

Frederick Ave. N., 300 block, 3:30 a.m. Nov. 24. Two males armed with a weapon robbed a person of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brookes Ave., 200 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 21. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Calabar Dr., 17700 block, Nov. 21 to 22. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Contour Rd., 18200 block, 7:25 to 7:31 p.m. Nov. 23. An elementary school was entered by force.

Crabbs Branch Way, 16700 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 24 to 11 a.m. Nov. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Frederick Ave. S., 600 block, 3 a.m. Nov. 25. Property was stolen from a gas station entered by force.

Granite Pl. and Booth St., Nov. 24 to 25. A wallet and change were among property stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

Laytonia Dr., 7700 block, 5 a.m. to 8 p.m. Nov. 23. An unlocked vehicle was entered.

Muddy Branch Rd., 400 block, 1 to 8 a.m. Nov. 27. Property was stolen from several vehicles entered by force.

Russell Ave., 700 block, 11:37 p.m. Nov. 22 to 1:16 a.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a store at a mall.

Russell Ave., 700 block, Nov. 27 to 28. Property was stolen from a store at a mall.

Shady Spring Dr., 8200 block, 9:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 28. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Spiceberry Cir., 7900 block, 12:30 to 8:30 a.m. Nov. 25. A stereo was stolen from a vehicle.

Watkins Mill Rd., 500 block, 6:30 p.m. Nov. 22 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from a residence.

Willow Creek Dr., 9300 block, just before 5 p.m., Nov. 24. A residence was entered by force.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

Montgomery Ave. W., 200 block, Dec. 2. A 51-year-old Montgomery Village woman was arrested in connection with a Nov. 24 assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Choke Cherry Rd., unit block, 5:30 to 8:30 p.m. Nov. 28. An external hard drive was stolen from an unlocked office.

Crabb Ave., 600 block, 2 p.m. Nov. 27 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 28. A residence was entered by forcing a side window.

Hungerford Dr., 600 block, 11:57 a.m. to 12:12 p.m. Nov. 29. A laptop computer, a wallet, textbooks, eyeglasses and a raincoat were among property stolen from two backpacks in a break room at a grocery store.

Lofstrand Lane, 600 block, 4:30 p.m. Nov. 23 to 8 a.m. Nov. 25. A parking lot at a business was entered by cutting a hole in a chain-link fence.

Martha Terr., 1600 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 29 to 1 p.m. Nov. 30. A Global Positioning System device and clothes were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Maryland Ave., unit block, 10 to 10:15 a.m. Dec. 1. A cellphone was stolen from a screening area at a courthouse.

Maryland Ave., unit block, 1:50 to 2:07 p.m. Dec. 2. A cellphone was stolen from a table at a library.

Preserve Pkwy., unit block, 6 p.m. Nov. 28 to 3:30 a.m. Nov. 29. A wallet was stolen from a book bag at a restaurant.

Silver King Lane, 400 block, 12:31 to 1:30 p.m. Nov. 30. A washing machine was stolen from a residence.

Veirs Mill Rd., 600 block, 3:30 to 5:30 p.m. Nov. 28. A purse was stolen from a table in a classroom.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

ROBBERIES

Carroll Ave., 7600 block, 1:23 p.m. Dec. 5. A male followed an acquaintance off of a bus, then robbed her of a purse and fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Carroll Ave., 7100 block, 2:30 a.m. Dec. 3. A passenger in a taxicab refused to pay after arriving at the agreed-upon destination.

Flower Ave., 8600 block, 3:59 p.m. Dec. 3. An attempt was made to break into a residence.

New Hampshire Ave., 6300 block, 12:16 a.m. Dec. 4. A passenger got out of a vehicle in a gas station and took a purse from a vehicle as a motorist was pumping gas.

New Hampshire Ave., 6300 block, 11:41 p.m. Dec. 4. Two males took two boxed TVs that were on the floor at a business, then fled in a vehicle.

New Hampshire Ave., 6800 block, 8:03 p.m. Dec. 5. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Pine Ave., unit block, 9:09 p.m. Dec. 5. A package was stolen from a porch at a residence.

Prince George's Ave., 6800 block, 11:28 p.m. Dec. 6. A sunroof was stolen from a vehicle.

Roanoke Ave., 8200 block, 7:51 p.m. Dec. 5. Property was stolen from an apartment entered through an unlocked living-room window.

Sligo Creek Pkwy., 900 block, 1:48 p.m. Dec. 5. A vehicle-registration sticker was stolen from a license plate.

University Blvd., 1300 block, 8:12 p.m. Dec. 2. A male stole merchandise from a store.

- Compiled by Lisa M. Bolton

Washingtonpost.com


June 20, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 2715 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Abbey Lane, June 6 to June 7. Two MP3 players were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.  

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

Walnut Creek, June 7 to June 8. Mailboxes and posts were broken at nine homes in a subdivision.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mary Ann Dr., May 4 to June 7. A residence and a shed were burglarized. Nothing was reported missing.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chapline Place, May 26 to June 2. Tools were stolen from a fast-food restaurant construction site.

Tranquil Ct., 8:50 a.m. June 8. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Main St., 9:25 p.m. June 5. A man lent his vehicle to another male and a female, and it was never returned. The vehicle was found in Anne Arundel County.

SOLOMONS AREA ASSAULTS

Solomons Island Rd., 9:20 p.m. June 8. A man assaulted a female in a bar at a hotel. An Alaska man, 39, was charged with assault and disorderly conduct.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd., June 5 to June 6. Welding tanks and a six-pack of soda were stolen from the bed of a truck parked at a hotel. Then tanks were found under a tree.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Forest Rd., June 8 to June 9. A tool set was stolen from an unlocked garage and cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Oriole Way, 2:08 a.m. June 5. An unlocked garage and an unlocked vehicle were entered at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

SUNDERLAND AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dalrymple Rd., May 26 to June 2. Two riding lawn mowers were stolen from a barn.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA ASSAULTS

Bolingbrook Ct., 2500 block, 11:40 p.m. June 10. A man, 31, was shot in the upper body while getting out of his vehicle in front of his home. The shooter fled. The man was treated for injuries that were not life-threatening.

LA PLATA AREA ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 6200 block, 11:35 p.m. June 10. A man entered a convenience store, implied that he had a gun, robbed a clerk of cash and fled. A North Carolina man, 48, was charged with robbery.

DRUG/TRAFFIC OFFENSES

Charles St., 12100 block, 4:40 p.m. June 10. A driver backed into a porch post at a day-care center where children were waiting to be picked up, and fled. A Hughesville woman, 22, was charged with 16 traffic offenses, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of drug paraphernalia.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bel Alton Rd., April 20 to June 9. Copper was stolen from a vacant residence.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 3100 block, 4 a.m. June 5. A security guard saw a man in the parking lot of a car dealership hiding between two vehicles. The man fled into the woods when he was seen. Investigation revealed the man had stolen rims and tires from a Cadillac Escalade. A D.C. man, 27, was charged with burglary.

Festival Way, 4 p.m. May 30. Three men grabbed cellphones from a display case at a wireless telephone store, and fled. The men also went to a wireless phone store at Market Place and stole more cellphones from a display case. Two Waldorf men, both 18, and a 27-year-old Waldorf man were charged with theft.

Lamprey Ct., 5200 block, June 8. A camera and a lens were stolen from a vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Crain Hwy., 3000 block, 2 a.m. June 5. During a patrol of a parking lot, police saw a suspicious vehicle in the parking lot of a fast-food restaurant. Investigation revealed the vehicle was stolen from Montgomery County. A man and a woman were arrested and charged with possession of a stolen vehicle. A 4-year-old boy found in the vehicle was taken to a relative.

St.. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA ASSAULTS

Abell Dr., June 7. During an argument, a man pulled an acquaintance out of a bed, causing her to fall and hurt her knee. A California man, 47, was charged with second-degree assault.

Fire Department Lane, April 24. During an argument in a parking lot, a woman punched and kicked an acquaintance and slapped and bit another person. A woman was charged with two counts of second-degree assault .

CALLAWAY AREA ASSAULTS

Piney Point Rd., June 6. During an argument, a man injured an acquaintance's neck and knee. A California man, 22, was charged with second-degree assault.

CHAPTICO AREA ASSAULTS

Hurry Rd., June 7. During an argument, a woman grabbed an acquaintance's arm and pushed the acquaintance. A Chaptico woman, 26, was charged with second-degree assault.

GREAT MILLS AREA ASSAULTS

Point Lookout Rd., June 5. After an earlier disagreement with an acquaintance, a man attempted to run the acquaintance's vehicle off the road. A Leonardtown man, 39, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

HERMANVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Compass Cir.,June 9. Officers responded to a call for a disturbance and saw a woman being thrown against a third-floor window. Investigation revealed that during an argument, a man chased the woman upstairs, punched through a bedroom door and threw the woman onto a bed causing injury to her knee. He placed his hands around her throat and threw her against the window. A Hermanville man, 32, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Leonardtown, June 10. A woman placed a report for domestic and sexual assault at the sheriff's office. During an argument, the woman said, she had been struck in the face and body and sexually assaulted but had broken free and fled the home. When officers arrived at the home, a Leonardtown man, 27, stabbed himself with a knife before officers could take him into custody. The man and woman were treated for their injuries, and the man was charged with first- and second-degree assault, first-degree sex offense and false imprisonment.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Foxchase Dr., June 9. A man at a residence punched a screen door and slammed the door on an acquaintance's hand. A Lexington Park man, 52, was charged with destruction of property, disorderly conduct, second-degree assault, being intoxicated and endangering safety.

Saint Lo Pl., June 5. During an argument, a woman bit and hit an acquaintance in the head, knocking off the acquaintance's glasses. A Lexington Park woman, 19, was charged with second-degree assault and destruction of property.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack.

Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

A Hughesville woman, 22, was charged with 16 traffic offenses, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of drug paraphernalia.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bel Alton Rd., April 20 to June 9. Copper was stolen from a vacant residence.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Investigation revealed the man had stolen rims and tires from a Cadillac Escalade. A D.C. man, 27, was charged with burglary.

Festival Way, 4 p.m. May 30. Three men grabbed cellphones from a display case at a wireless telephone store, and fled. The men also went to a wireless phone store at Market Place and stole more cellphones from a display case. Two Waldorf men, both 18, and a 27-year-old Waldorf man were charged with theft.

Lamprey Ct., 5200 block, June 8. A camera and a lens were stolen from a vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Crain Hwy., 3000 block, 2 a.m. June 5. During a patrol of a parking lot, police saw a suspicious vehicle in the parking lot of a fast-food restaurant. Investigation revealed the vehicle was stolen from Montgomery County. A man and a woman were arrested and charged with possession of a stolen vehicle. A 4-year-old boy found in the vehicle was taken to a relative.

St.. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA ASSAULTS

Abell Dr., June 7. During an argument, a man pulled an acquaintance out of a bed, causing her to fall and hurt her knee. A California man, 47, was charged with second-degree assault.

Fire Department Lane, April 24. During an argument in a parking lot, a woman punched and kicked an acquaintance and slapped and bit another person. A woman was charged with two counts of second-degree assault .

Investigation revealed that during an argument, a man chased the woman upstairs, punched through a bedroom door and threw the woman onto a bed causing injury to her knee. He placed his hands around her throat and threw her against the window. A Hermanville man, 32, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Leonardtown, June 10. A woman placed a report for domestic and sexual assault at the sheriff's office. When officers arrived at the home, a Leonardtown man, 27, stabbed himself with a knife before officers could take him into custody. The man and woman were treated for their injuries, and the man was charged with first- and second-degree assault, first-degree sex offense and false imprisonment.

Saint Lo Pl., June 5. During an argument, a woman bit and hit an acquaintance in the head, knocking off the acquaintance's glasses. A Lexington Park woman, 19, was charged with second-degree assault and destruction of property.

The Washington Post


April 26, 2009 Sunday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. LZ15


LENGTH: 595 words


Loudoun County 

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

Aldie Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JOHN S. MOSBY HWY., 41100 block, 5:30 p.m. April 17 to 1:30 a.m. April 18. Cash was stolen from a cash register at a business.

Ashburn Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREENWAY CORPORATE DR., 43600 block, 8 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. April 18. A Global Positioning System device and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle. 

Leesburg Area

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

FORT EVANS RD., 1 to 100 block, 6:34 p.m. April 20. A sexual assault occurred.

ASSAULTS

BRIDLE CREST SQ., 300 block, 10:47 p.m. April 18. An assault occurred.

CATOCTIN CIR., 100 block, 11:54 p.m. April 18. An assault occurred.

FORT EVANS RD., 1 to 100 block, 12:39 p.m. April 16. An assault occurred.

GATEWAY DR., 700 block, 10:11 a.m. April 17. An assault occurred.

MADISON CT., 400 block, 12:14 p.m. April 20. Threats were reported.

MARKET ST. E., 500 block, 12:13 a.m. April 19. An assault occurred.

SMARTTS LANE, 1000 block, 11:34 p.m. April 19. An assault occurred.

SOUTH ST., 100 block, 5:11 p.m. April 17. An assault occurred.

SUNSET VIEW TERR., 500 block, 5:38 a.m. April 19. An assault occurred.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CANDLEWOOD PL., 1600 block, 12:27 p.m. April 20. An incident of fraud occurred.

CATTAIL LANE, 800 block, 3:13 p.m. April 20. An incident of fraud occurred.

EDWARDS FERRY RD., 1000 block, 7:07 p.m. April 17. Shoplifting occurred.

GARRILAND DR., 16000 block, April 10 to April 20. Ceramic tiles, sconces and light fixtures were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

GATEWAY DR., 700 block, 3:57 p.m. April 19. A theft occurred.

HERITAGE WAY, 1 to 100 block, 2:25 p.m. April 17. An incident of fraud occurred.

KING ST. S., 700 block, 3:30 a.m. April 13. Two men wearing ski masks entered a grocery store and tampered with a security system. After trying unsuccessfully to break into an ATM, they fled empty-handed.

MARKET ST. E., 500 block, 4:59 p.m. April 19. A theft occurred.

PLAZA ST., 300 block, 9:07 p.m. April 17. A theft occurred.

Purcellville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BERLIN TPK., 15300 block, 7:30 p.m. April 15 to 7 a.m. April 16. Tools were stolen from a residence under renovation.

Sterling Area

ASSAULTS

SUE ANN COURT AREA, 2 p.m. April 15. Three males, one armed with a knife, attacked a female in a wooded area, knocking her to the ground. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRAMBLE CT., 21800 block, 9:45 p.m. April 15 to 9:28 a.m. April 16. A multi-media player was stolen from a vehicle entered by damaging a window.

BRANDON AVE. N., 1200 block, 12:01 to 7:30 a.m. April 18. A laptop computer, a Global Positioning System device and a stereo were among property stolen from four vehicles.

CONCORD CT. N., 700 block, 10 p.m. April 19 to 8 a.m. April 20. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by damaging a window.

JUNIPER AVE. E., 200 block, 8 p.m. April 17 to 4:30 p.m. April 18. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by damaging a window.

MAYWOOD TERR., 21800 block, 10 p.m. April 19 to 8 a.m. April 20. Headphones were stolen from a vehicle entered by damaging a door.

TRAMORE CT., 300 block, 9 p.m. April 19 to 1:45 p.m. April 20. A Global Positioning System device and a cellphone were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

COTTAGE RD. AND SIMEON LANE, 7:34 a.m. April 16. A vehicle window was damaged.

WRIGHTWOOD PL., 9:11 p.m. April 16. A fence was marked with graffiti.

-- Compiled by SANDY MAUCK


LOAD-DATE: April 26, 2009


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DISTRIBUTION: Loudoun County


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper
