69 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


June 20, 2013 Thursday  
Every Edition


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 2449 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Abbey Lane, June 6 to June 7. Two MP3 players were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

Walnut Creek, June 7 to June 8. Mailboxes and posts were broken at nine homes in a subdivision.  

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mary Ann Dr., May 4 to June 7. A residence and a shed were burglarized. Nothing was reported missing.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chapline Place, May 26 to June 2. Tools were stolen from a fast-food restaurant construction site.

Tranquil Ct., 8:50 a.m. June 8. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Main St.,9:25 p.m. June 5. A man lent his vehicle to another male and a female, and it was never returned. The vehicle was found in Anne Arundel County.

SOLOMONS AREA

ASSAULTS

Solomons Island Rd., 9:20 p.m. June 8. A man assaulted a female in a bar at a hotel. An Alaska man, 39, was charged with assault and disorderly conduct.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd., June 5 to June 6. Welding tanks and a six-pack of soda were stolen from the bed of a truck parked at a hotel. Then tanks were found under a tree.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Forest Rd., June 8 to June 9. A tool set was stolen from an unlocked garage and cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Oriole Way, 2:08 a.m. June 5. An unlocked garage and an unlocked vehicle were entered at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

SUNDERLAND AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dalrymple Rd., May 26 to June 2. Two riding lawn mowers were stolen from a barn.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA

ASSAULTS

Bolingbrook Ct., 2500 block, 11:40 p.m. June 10. A man, 31, was shot in the upper body while getting out of his vehicle in front of his home. The shooter fled. The man was treated for injuries that were not life-threatening.

LA PLATA AREA

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 6200 block, 11:35 p.m. June 10. A man entered a convenience store, implied that he had a gun, robbed a clerk of cash and fled. A North Carolina man, 48, was charged with robbery.

DRUG/TRAFFIC OFFENSES

Charles St.,12100 block, 4:40 p.m. June 10. A driver backed into a porch post at a day-care center where children were waiting to be picked up, and fled. A Hughesville woman, 22, was charged with 16 traffic offenses, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of drug paraphernalia.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bel Alton Rd., April 20 to June 9. Copper was stolen from a vacant residence.

WALDORF AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 3100 block, 4 a.m. June 5. A security guard saw a man in the parking lot of a car dealership hiding between two vehicles. The man fled into the woods when he was seen. Investigation revealed the man had stolen rims and tires from a Cadillac Escalade. A D.C. man, 27, was charged with burglary.

Festival Way, 4 p.m. May 30. Three men grabbed cellphones from a display case at a wireless telephone store, and fled. The men also went to a wireless phone store at Market Place and stole more cellphones from a display case. Two Waldorf men, both 18, and a 27-year-old Waldorf man were charged with theft.

Lamprey Ct., 5200 block, June 8. A camera and a lens were stolen from a vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Crain Hwy., 3000 block, 2 a.m. June 5. During a patrol of a parking lot, police saw a suspicious vehicle in the parking lot of a fast-food restaurant. Investigation revealed the vehicle was stolen from Montgomery County. A man and a woman were arrested and charged with possession of a stolen vehicle. A 4-year-old boy found in the vehicle was taken to a relative.

St.. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

ASSAULTS

Abell Dr., June 7. During an argument, a man pulled an acquaintance out of a bed, causing her to fall and hurt her knee. A California man, 47, was charged with second-degree assault.

Fire Department Lane,April 24. During an argument in a parking lot, a woman punched and kicked an acquaintance and slapped and bit another person. A woman was charged with two counts of second-degree assault .

CALLAWAY AREA

ASSAULTS

Piney Point Rd., June 6. During an argument, a man injured an acquaintance's neck and knee. A California man, 22, was charged with second-degree assault.

CHAPTICO AREA

ASSAULTS

Hurry Rd., June 7. During an argument, a woman grabbed an acquaintance's arm and pushed the acquaintance. A Chaptico woman, 26, was charged with second-degree assault.

GREAT MILLS AREA

ASSAULTS

Point Lookout Rd.,June 5. After an earlier disagreement with an acquaintance, a man attempted to run the acquaintance's vehicle off the road. A Leonardtown man, 39, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

HERMANVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Compass Cir., June 9. Officers responded to a call for a disturbance and saw a woman being thrown against a third-floor window. Investigation revealed that during an argument, a man chased the woman upstairs, punched through a bedroom door and threw the woman onto a bed causing injury to her knee. He placed his hands around her throat and threw her against the window. A Hermanville man, 32, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Leonardtown, June 10. A woman placed a report for domestic and sexual assault at the sheriff's office. During an argument, the woman said, she had been struck in the face and body and sexually assaulted but had broken free and fled the home. When officers arrived at the home, a Leonardtown man, 27, stabbed himself with a knife before officers could take him into custody. The man and woman were treated for their injuries, and the man was charged with first- and second-degree assault, first-degree sex offense and false imprisonment.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Foxchase Dr.,June 9. A man at a residence punched a screen door and slammed the door on an acquaintance's hand. A Lexington Park man, 52, was charged with destruction of property, disorderly conduct, second-degree assault, being intoxicated and endangering safety.

Saint Lo Pl., June 5. During an argument, a woman bit and hit an acquaintance in the head, knocking off the acquaintance's glasses. A Lexington Park woman, 19, was charged with second-degree assault and destruction of property.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

Walnut Creek, June 7 to June 8. Mailboxes and posts were broken at nine homes in a subdivision.

OWINGS AREA

Mary Ann Dr., May 4 to June 7. A residence and a shed were burglarized. Nothing was reported missing.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chapline Place, May 26 to June 2. Tools were stolen from a fast-food restaurant construction site.

Tranquil Ct., 8:50 a.m. June 8. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

ASSAULTS

Piney Point Rd., June 6. During an argument, a man injured an acquaintance's neck and knee. A California man, 22, was charged with second-degree assault.

CHAPTICO AREA

ASSAULTS

Hurry Rd., June 7. During an argument, a woman grabbed an acquaintance's arm and pushed the acquaintance. A Chaptico woman, 26, was charged with second-degree assault.

GREAT MILLS AREA

ASSAULTS

Point Lookout Rd.,June 5. After an earlier disagreement with an acquaintance, a man attempted to run the acquaintance's vehicle off the road. A Leonardtown man, 39, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

HERMANVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Compass Cir., June 9. Officers responded to a call for a disturbance and saw a woman being thrown against a third-floor window. Investigation revealed that during an argument, a man chased the woman upstairs, punched through a bedroom door and threw the woman onto a bed causing injury to her knee. He placed his hands around her throat and threw her against the window. A Hermanville man, 32, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Leonardtown, June 10. A woman placed a report for domestic and sexual assault at the sheriff's office. During an argument, the woman said, she had been struck in the face and body and sexually assaulted but had broken free and fled the home. When officers arrived at the home, a Leonardtown man, 27, stabbed himself with a knife before officers could take him into custody. The man and woman were treated for their injuries, and the man was charged with first- and second-degree assault, first-degree sex offense and false imprisonment.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Foxchase Dr.,June 9. A man at a residence punched a screen door and slammed the door on an acquaintance's hand. A Lexington Park man, 52, was charged with destruction of property, disorderly conduct, second-degree assault, being intoxicated and endangering safety.

Saint Lo Pl., June 5. During an argument, a woman bit and hit an acquaintance in the head, knocking off the acquaintance's glasses. A Lexington Park woman, 19, was charged with second-degree assault and destruction of property.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 547 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Placid Lake Ct., 8600 block, 5 p.m. Dec. 5 to 2:30 p.m. Dec. 6. Cash, a handgun and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Anchorage Cove, 3600 block, 8 to 9 a.m. Dec. 3. Tools and building supplies were stolen from a vacant residence. 

Main St., 17700 block, 9 a.m. Dec. 1 to 9 a.m. Dec. 3. A TV was stolen from a building.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Liberia Ave., 9700 block, Nov. 10. A physician at a medical facility allegedly sexually assaulted a male patient. A 35-year-old Oakton man was arrested.

ROBBERY

Shoppers Sq., 8200 block, 10:15 p.m. Dec. 4. Three men pushed a male pedestrian against a fence, and he was hit with a gun and robbed of a wallet.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Somerset Lane, 7600 block, 10:03 p.m. Dec. 3. A man knocked on a front door of a residence, then attempted to forcibly enter when a male occupant answered. The man damaged the front door and broke a window. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULT

Ridge View Ct., 3200 block, 2:40 p.m. Dec. 7. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance, hitting her repeatedly with a metal rod. The woman was taken to a hospital. A 52-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Blue Pool Dr. and Hildas Way area , Dec. 1. A male sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 16-year-old Woodbridge boy was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Divided Sky Ct., 4200 block, 8:10 p.m. Dec. 5. Two males assaulted a male juvenile and robbed him of marijuana and a cellphone.

Old Bridge Rd., 3000 block, 5:45 p.m. Dec. 5. A male juvenile robbed a female juvenile pedestrian of a cellphone.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 6:30 p.m. Dec. 8. A man attempted to take a pair of shoes from a store. When an employee attempted to stop him, he assaulted the employee.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14600 block, 2:13 p.m. Dec. 7. A man implying he had a weapon robbed a hotel of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

California St., 1400 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 5 to 3:15 p.m. Dec. 6. Cash and several watches were stolen from a residence entered by pushing an air conditioner through a bedroom window.

Emberdale Dr., 14800 block, 10:23 p.m. Dec. 6. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a rear door.

Telegraph Rd., 13300 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 2 to 8 a.m. Dec. 3. Copper and electrical wires, catalytic converters and aluminum wheels were stolen from a business entered by prying a door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERY

Ashton Ave., 8900 block, 8:15 p.m. Dec. 9. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 4:06 p.m. Nov. 23 to 8 p.m. Dec. 1. Cash was stolen from a vending machine.

Owens Ct., 2:33 p.m. Dec. 4. A leaf blower was stolen from a vehicle.

Venture Ct., 12:16 p.m. Dec. 4. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Mathis Ave., 8500 block, 1:23 p.m. Dec. 1. Graffiti was spray-painted on the rear walls of a shopping center.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report 


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1618 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Ritchie Hwy., 6000 block, 2:13 a.m. Dec. 7. Two women having a loud discussion in a liquor-store parking lot heard a gunshot coming from the direction of a nearby residence. A Brooklyn Park man, 50, was charged with reckless endangerment and discharging a firearm within 100 yards of a structure.

ROBBERIES

Ritchie Hwy., 5600 block, 12:18 p.m. Dec. 4. Two males attacked and robbed a pizza-carryout employee of cash as she was walking out of the restaurant. The victim refused medical attention.  

GAMBRILLS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Annapolis Rd., 1000 block, 3:34 p.m. Nov. 28. A student was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance. On Dec. 5, a 14-year-old Odenton male, also a student, was charged with attempted second-degree rape, second-degree sex assault and second-degree sex offense.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Baltimore Annapolis Rd., 7500 block, Dec. 8. A Glen Burnie man, 29, was arrested in connection with an investigation of a teacher accused of sexually assaulting three students on and off school grounds from November 2009 to last month. Charges include several counts of sexual abuse of a minor, third- and fourth-degree sex offense, perverted practice, sexual solicitation of a minor, and first- and second-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

Furnace Ave. and Gatewater Ct., 1:30 a.m. Dec. 4. Four people attacked two pedestrians, a man with whom one of the assailants was acquainted and a woman who was robbed of a purse. The victims were taken to a hospital with non-life threatening injuries. A Pasadena woman, 23, two Glen Burnie men, ages 19 and 23, and a Baltimore woman, 19, were charged with robbery and assault. The purse was recovered.

Greenleaf Terr., 7 p.m. Nov. 30. Two people attacked a man in front of a store and robbed him of a cellphone. A 15-year-old Waldorf male was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

HANOVER AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hill Born Dr., 1300 block, 2:35 a.m. Dec. 3. A vehicle break-in occurred. A man arrested at the scene was found to be in possession of property taken from another vehicle in the area. A Baltimore man, 31, was charged with theft and with rogue and vagabond.

ODENTON AREA

ROBBERIES

Annapolis Rd., 1100 block, 11:08 p.m. Dec. 2. A man wearing a ski mask got out of a maroon minivan in a store parking lot and robbed two employees of cash and a cellphone at gunpoint. He fled in the minivan.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

ASSAULTS

Dock St., 100 block, 2 a.m. Dec. 3. During a fight outside a bar, a male stabbed two men. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Bens Dr., unit block, Dec. 7. A 22-year-old Annapolis man was arrested in connection with a robbery at this location on Oct. 28. Charges included armed robbery, use of a firearm in a crime of violence, and first- and second-degree assault. Two other men were involved in the incident. An Annapolis man, 18, was arrested Nov. 3.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Ave., 800 block, 5:30 to 5:40 p.m. Dec. 3. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle while the motorist had stepped away.

Childs Point Rd., 700 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 17 to 2 p.m. Nov. 27. A laptop was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Copeland St., 1900 block, 9 p.m. Dec. 2 to 9 a.m. Dec. 3. A bomber jacket was stolen from a vehicle entered by smashing a window.

Francis St., unit block, 5 p.m. Dec. 3 to 8:40 p.m. Dec. 4. A residence was entered by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Halsey Rd., 400 block, 7:15 a.m. to 7 p.m. Dec. 7. A laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Hawkins Lane, 1300 block, 4 a.m. to 3 p.m. Dec. 4. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Hearthstone Ct., unit block, 3 p.m. Dec. 2 to 5 p.m. Dec. 5. Three packages were stolen from the front of a residence.

Paddington Pl., 1000 block, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Dec. 6. A laptop was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a bathroom window.

Primrose Rd., 900 block, 11 to 11:30 p.m. Dec. 3. A vacant apartment was vandalized, with damage sustained by walls, light fixtures and a mirror. There was no sign of forced entry.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

New Car Dr., 12500 block, 10 a.m. Dec. 3 to 5:30 a.m. Dec. 5. Cash was stolen from an office at a car dealership. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Triadelphia Rd., 12700 block, 7:56 a.m. Dec. 7. A cream 1992 Cadillac Eldorado was stolen.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Eliots Oak Rd., 5400 block, 1:29 p.m. Dec. 2. A male teenager forced his way into an apartment and robbed a female occupant of cash at knifepoint. The victim was treated for cuts at the scene.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Angel Rose Ct., 6300 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 4 to 9 a.m. Dec. 5. An attempt was made to enter a garage at a residence by forcing a door.

Avalanche Way, 11200 block, 1 to 11 p.m. Dec. 7. A jar of coins was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Brook Way, 5200 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 1. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by breaking glass in a sliding door.

Circling Hunter Dr., 4800 block, 9:09 a.m. Dec. 5. Two female teenagers entered a vacant apartment through a bedroom window, then fled empty-handed when confronted. A 16-year-old from Baltimore was arrested.

Fruitgift Pl., 6500 block, 10:26 p.m. Dec. 4. A door was kicked in and windows were broken at a townhouse. Three males were seen fleeing the area.

Majors Lane, 6100 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 27 to 6 p.m. Dec. 1. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a window screen.

Stevens Forest Rd., 5800 block, 2:57 p.m. Dec. 7. A video game system was stolen from a residence.

Twin Knolls Rd., 5500 block, 10 p.m. Dec. 3 to 4:30 a.m. Dec. 4. An attempt was made to break into a pharmacy by smashing a drive-through window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cedar Lane, 5400 block, 11:25 to 11:35 p.m. Dec. 5. A gray-and-red scooter was stolen.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 10:30 p.m. Dec. 1. A blue 1999 Chevrolet Tracker was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Washington Blvd., 6200 block, 5:03 a.m. Dec. 4. A male sitting in a red Honda exposed himself to a gas station employee.

ROBBERIES

Washington Blvd., 6600 block, 10:01 a.m. Dec. 5. A male asked a female for cash, then hit her in the face when she refused. An Elkridge man, 19, was charged with robbery and assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Abel St., 6400 block, 7:15 a.m. to 2:40 p.m. Dec. 5. Video game consoles, games and a camera were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Hollow Ct., 3300 block, 7:34 p.m. Dec. 5. Two men wearing masks threatened a male walking from his vehicle to a residence, then fled with his wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Briarstone Ct., 7700 block, 1 to 11:30 p.m. Dec. 3. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a sliding-glass door.

Emerald Valley Rd., 3100 block, 6 p.m. Dec. 4. An attempt was made to enter a garage at a residence by forcing a door.

Ilchester Rd., 5000 block, 12:30 to 10 a.m. Dec. 4. A bicycle was stolen from an open garage.

Tall Maple Ct., 4600 block, 1:27 p.m. Dec. 7. A residence was entered by breaking a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Town and Country Blvd., 9000 block, 3:20 a.m. Dec. 5. An occupied apartment was entered through an unlocked sliding-glass door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Vinter Way, 4500 block, 12:45 p.m. Dec. 7. A residence was entered through a garage. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted by an occupant returning home.

Woodville Lane, 3800 block, 3 to 8 p.m. Dec. 3. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Springs Dr. W., 3100 block, 2:50 p.m. Dec. 7. A 2008 Carr trailer was stolen.

FULTON AREA

ROBBERIES

Maple Lawn Blvd., 7400 block, 3:21 p.m. Dec. 1. A male threatened a bank teller and a customer and took cash from both of them, then fled on foot with a male accomplice who had been waiting outside.

GLENELG AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Triadelphia Rd., 13600 block, 2:17 p.m. Dec. 3. A 16-foot flatbed trailer was stolen.

HIGHLAND AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lime Kiln, 12900 block, 4 p.m. Nov. 23 to noon Nov. 25. Oak railings were stolen from the site of a house under construction.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Bridle Path Lane and N. Laurel Rd., 7:17 p.m. Dec. 7. A male approached a female from behind and tried to force her into a vehicle. When she pushed him aside and screamed, he fled on foot. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Freestate Dr., 8800 block, 7:38 a.m. Dec. 7. An attempt was made to break into a car dealership.

Washington Blvd., 8400 block, 5:30 p.m. Dec. 4 to 1:30 p.m. Dec. 6. Fuel was stolen from a fuel tank in a yard at a business entered by cutting a lock.

MOUNT AIRY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Frederick Rd., 16700 block, 3 to 7 a.m. Dec. 4. Three windows were broken at a church.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Montgomery County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Lisa M. Bolton


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 1711 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with these and other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

Howard Ave., 300 block, Jan. 24. A man threatened an acquaintance at knifepoint. A man, 20, was charged with aggravated assault.

ROBBERIES

Gude Dr. E., 600 block, Jan. 29. A robbery occurred at a homeless shelter.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bent Cross Dr., 9800 block, 12:30 a.m. Jan. 28 to 10 a.m. Jan. 29. A chainsaw was stolen from a garage and a GPS device was stolen from a vehicle parked there. Other vehicles in the garage and driveway were searched.

Frederick Rd., 15900 block, 10 a.m. Jan. 28 to 6:50 a.m. Jan. 29. Eight GPS units, stereo components and a cellphone were among property stolen from eight vehicles broken into at an auto dealership.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 8 p.m. Jan. 30 to 7:45 a.m. Jan. 31. Property was stolen from the trunk of a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Rockville Pike, 1700 block, Jan. 27 to 28. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle entered by force in a hotel parking garage. A man was seen fleeing with the property in a light sedan.

Montgomery Ave. W., 1200 block, 8 p.m. Jan. 27 to 4 a.m. Jan. 28. CDs and battery chargers were stolen from a vehicle in a hotel parking lot.

Stonebarn Lane, 13500 block, 9:28 a.m. Jan. 29. A break-in occurred at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATION301-652-9200

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Greenwich Park area, noon Jan. 28. A male teenager sexually assaulted a female teenager.

ROBBERIES

Plyers Mill Rd., 3700 block, 6:45 p.m. Feb. 1. A gunman tried to rob a self-storage business, then fled empty-handed when the employees couldn't access the business's cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brooklawn Terr., 3100 block, 12:50 to 5:30 p.m. Jan. 26. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Cromwell Dr., 5700 block, Jan. 27 to 28. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Democracy Blvd., 7100 block, Jan. 29 to 30. Property was stolen from three shopping mall kiosks.

Old Georgetown Rd., 10200 block, Jan. 30 to 31. Copper drainpipes were stolen from the outside of a church.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATION301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Colesville Rd., 8300-8700 block, 8 p.m. Jan. 28. Two males sexually assaulted two females.

ASSAULTS

Gateway Terr., 3800 block, 5:25 p.m. Jan. 25. During an argument, a man cut an acquaintance on the hand. No serious injuries were reported.

Old Columbia Pike, 13800 block, 2:37 p.m. Jan. 30. Three males attacked a man and robbed him of property. No injuries were reported.

University Blvd. E., 600 block, 4:46 p.m. Feb. 1. A man attacked a man outside a convenience store, knocking him to the ground and inflicting a minor stab wound. A District man, 24, was arrested at the scene.

ROBBERIES

Hayden Dr., 2400 block, 11 a.m. Jan. 27. Two males attacked a person and fled with cash. No injuries were reported.

Piney Branch Rd. and Flower Ave., 4:26 p.m. Feb. 1. A male attacked a pedestrian and tried to rob him. After a struggle, the assailant fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

Wayne Ave., 800 block, 12:40 a.m. Jan. 26. A female who said that she had a gun robbed a woman of a purse. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Branch Dr., 300 block, 6:30 to 7 p.m. Jan. 24. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Columbia Pike, 11400 block, 2:12 a.m. Jan. 26. Two males trying to pry open a panel to an ATM fled empty-handed when confronted.

Garland Ave., 8500 block, 9 a.m. to 1:26 p.m. Jan. 28. Property was stolen from a residence.

Heartfields Dr., 1100 block, 6 to 8:22 p.m. Jan. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Palmer House Way, 13900 block, 9 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Jan. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Piney Branch Rd., 8600 block, 10:28 p.m. Jan. 28. Police responding to a report of a residential break-in arrested five men, each described as homeless. Nothing was reported missing.

Red Cedar Dr., 15100 block, 12:38 p.m. Jan. 27. Three men were seen trying to break into a residence. Two Burtonsville men, ages 18 and 20, were arrested.

Second Ave., 8500 block, Jan. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Second Ave., 8700 block, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Jan. 31. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

DISTRICT 4WHEATON STATION240-773-5500

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Denley Park area, Jan. 25. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

Indian Spring Country Club area, 1600 block, Jan. 29. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance. Police said that it was a domestic incident.

Wheaton Center area,Jan. 30. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance. Police said that it was a domestic incident.

ASSAULTS

Iris Ct., 1 to 100 block, 3 a.m. Jan. 29. A man gave a person a ride, then attacked the passenger and drove away with property.

ROBBERIES

Denfeld and Woodson avenues, 10:30 p.m. Jan. 26. A male robbed a motorist standing near her vehicle of cash at gunpoint.

Paula Lynn Dr., 200 block, 8:50 p.m. Jan. 29. Two men forced their way into a residence at gunpoint, then fled with property in a white minivan.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Claridge Ct., 3300 block, Jan. 26. Two males and a female were seen breaking into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Ladd St., 1900 block, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Jan. 25. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force. A Landover man, 25, was arrested.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

New Hampshire Ave., 6400 block, 8:02 a.m. Feb. 9. A male at a gas station drove away in a 2007 BMW 325i that had been left with its engine running while the motorist went to pay for a purchase. The vehicle was recovered that day in the District.

Prince George's County crime reportPrince George's County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Jillian S. Sowah


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 993 words


Prince George's County

According to the Prince George's County Police Department, there will be no weekly crime reports available while the 911 Call Center is being upgraded. The county's report will return once the transition is complete, the department said. For information, call 301-772-4710.

Greenbelt

These were among incidents reported by the Greenbelt Police Department. For information, call 301-474-7200. 

Rewards for information

The Greenbelt Police Department will pay cash rewards of up to $500 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of persons responsible for any of the following unsolved crimes. Call Criminal Investigations at 301-507-6530. All information is confidential.

ROBBERIES

Edmonston Rd., 9300 block, 7:47 a.m. May 1. A gray 1998 Mercury Grand Marquis was stolen using a key robbed from an acquaintance.

Gardenway, unit block, 3:54 p.m. May 5. Three people attacked two pedestrians, then fled with property. A 19-year-old District man and two juveniles were arrested nearby. Charges included robbery and assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Greenbelt Rd., 6000 block, 5:13 p.m. April 28. A man armed with a weapon robbed a store of cash. No injuries were reported.

Hanover Dr., 7200 block, 5:30 a.m. April 30. A gunman robbed a person in a hotel room. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cherrywood Terr., 5900 block, 8:45 p.m. April 29. Electronics were stolen.

Edmonston Ct., 9100 block, 4:15 p.m. May 1. A break-in occurred at a business.

Edmonston Ct., 9100 block, 4:54 p.m. May 3. Electronics were stolen.

Edmonston Rd., 9100 block, May 5. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Edmonston Rd., 9300 block, 6:38 p.m. May 3. A sword was stolen.

Greenbelt Metro Dr., 5600 block, May 1. A wheel was stolen from a vehicle.

Hillside Rd., unit block, 2:47 a.m. April 30. An attempt was made to break into a residence.

Lakecrest and Lakeside drives, April 30. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Mandan Rd., 7300 block, 10:12 p.m. April 30. Electronics were stolen.

Mandan Rd., 7300 block, 7:24 p.m. May 2. Electronics and clothing were stolen.

Springhill Ct., 9100 block, 1:44 p.m. May 2. Electronics were stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Edmonston Terr. and Edmonston Ct., May 4. A white 1994 Honda Civic that had been reported stolen was recovered.

Springhill Lane, 9100 block, April 30. A black 1996 Volkswagen Jetta was stolen.

VANDALISM

Lake Park Dr., 6600 block, May 4. A vehicle's tires were slashed.

Mandan Rd., 7200 block, 9:07 p.m. April 30. A door was damaged.

Hyattsville

These were among incidents reported by Hyattsville Police. For information, call 301-985-5060.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Prince George's Plaza area, 3:30 a.m. May 5. A man entered an apartment through a bedroom window and sexually assaulted an occupant.

ROBBERIES

Kirkwood Pl., 2600 block, 6 a.m. May 1. A man entered an apartment through an unlocked window and attacked an occupant, then fled with a purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Belcrest Rd., 6500 block, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. May 3. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

Belcrest Rd., 6500 block, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. May 5. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

East West Hwy., 3300 block, 3 p.m. May 6. Property was stolen from a home-improvement store. An employee was charged with theft.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 3:45 p.m. May 1. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 7 p.m. May 2. Two people were charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 3:45 p.m. May 3. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 9:30 p.m. May 3. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 1 to 1:30 p.m. May 5. Several bottles of perfume were stolen from a store.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 2:30 p.m. May 5. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 2:45 p.m. May 5. Two people were charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 9:15 p.m. May 5. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 2:45 p.m. May 6. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 4:15 p.m. May 6. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 12:01 to 7 a.m. May 7. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 1:30 p.m. May 7. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3500 block, 3:45 p.m. May 7. A person was charged with shoplifting.

East West Hwy., 3600 block, 7 to 11:59 p.m. May 3. A vehicle was entered by breaking a window.

Gallatin St., 4100 block, 12:01 to 7 a.m. May 7. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Kirkwood Pl., 2700 block, 12:30 to 9:30 p.m. May 1. Property was stolen from an apartment.

41st Ave., 6100 block, 4 to 8 a.m. May 5. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

42nd Ave., 6100 block, 12:01 to 7 a.m. May 7. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Gallatin St.,3600 block, 3:30 to 4 a.m. May 4. A taxicab was stolen. The 1999 Ford Crown Victoria was recovered in the District that same day.

Laurel

These were among incidents reported by Laurel police. For more information, call 301-498-0092.

ROBBERIES

Baltimore Ave., 14800 block, May 2. Four males in a shopping mall parking lot robbed a 22-year-old man of a wallet at gunpoint, then fled in a brown van. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore Ave., 14100 block, May 3. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

Contee Rd., 7800 block, May 5. Five keys were stolen from a gym.

Fairlawn Ave., 1000 block, April 27. A 17-year-old female was charged with theft.

Laurel Ave., 300 block, May 3. Two air conditioning units and copper piping were stolen from a construction site.

Laurel Lakes Ct., 7900 block, May 2. A TV, a fur coat and a purse were stolen from an apartment.

Park Ave., 600 block, April 30. A GPS device and loose change were stolen from a vehicle.

Woodland Ct., unit block, May 2. A handgun and ammunition were stolen from a location entered through a window.

September 15, 2011 Thursday

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1172 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

FUGITIVE INCIDENTS

Rowe Blvd., 200 block, 9:44 a.m. Sept. 1. A 25-year-old man, formerly of Annapolis, being detained on kidnapping, sexual assault and robbery charges, overpowered a guard and fled from a courthouse. Police responding to a report of a man acting suspiciously in the Admiral Heights neighborhood recaptured him before midnight near Dewey and Sumner drives.

ROBBERIES

Broadneck Rd., 600 block, 9:30 p.m. Sept. 2. Two males attacked two male teenagers walking near a school, then fled with a digital media player. A 16-year-old from Glen Burnie was charged with robbery and second-degree assault.  

CROWNSVILLE AREA

HIT-AND-RUN INCIDENTS

Generals Hwy., 900 block, 4:51 a.m. Sept. 2. A pedestrian was struck by a vehicle while walking on the shoulder of a roadway. The victim, who said the vehicle was yellow, to crawled to the yard of a residence, then was treated for leg injuries at a hospital. Anyone with information about the incident is asked to call 410-222-6155.

EDGEWATER AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chestnut Rd., 2900 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 4. A woman investigating a noise at home was grabbed from behind. The intruder fled after a struggle through a back door. An Annapolis man, 24, was charged with first-, second-, third- and fourth-degree burglary and second-degree assault.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ROBBERIES

Central Ave., unit block, 3:30 p.m. Sept. 3. A man robbed a store of cash at knifepoint.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Laurel Fort Meade Rd., 3400 block, 9:40 a.m. Sept. 2. A man went behind the counter of a fast-food restaurant and robbed it of cash at gunpoint.

PASADENA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Magothy Beach Rd., unit block, 9:07 a.m. Aug. 18. A credit card that had been lost by a shopper was used to make unauthorized purchases in nearby stores.

SEVERN AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Annapolis Rd., Sept. 1. A Severn man, 39; a Baltimore man, 40; and a Severna Park woman, 40, were arrested after police approached them as they were standing by two vehicles - one of which the police had been following - that had stopped by the side of the road. The Severn man was charged with possession of a firearm (a .22-caliber pistol) while drug trafficking and drug- and drug-paraphernalia possession. The others were charged with drug- and drug-paraphernalia possession.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Atwater Dr., 300 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 5 to 11 a.m. Sept. 6. A cellphone was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Severn Ave., 400 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 3 to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 4. A Mercury outboard motor was stolen from a storage bin entered by forcing a lock.

Truxton Park Rd., 10:30 a.m. Sept. 1 to 11 a.m. Sept. 2. A 27-foot Load Star boat trailer was stolen from a trailer parking lot.

Wells Landing, unit block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 3 to 4 a.m. Sept. 4. A portable generator was stolen from a garage at a residence.

First St., 300 block, 11:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 2. A Yamaha boat motor was stolen from a dinghy.

Second St., 300 block, 9 to 10:15 p.m. Sept. 5. A cellphone and a digital media player were stolen from a vehicle.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Guilford Rd., 8600 block, 11:14 a.m. Sept. 4. Three female teenagers threatened a teenager in a fast-food restaurant, then fled with her watch.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frietchie Row, 6500 block, 2:38 p.m. Sept. 5. A break-in occurred at a vacant residence. Two Columbia men, ages 18 and 19, were charged with fourth-degree burglary.

Kilimanjaro Rd., 9500 block, 11 a.m. Aug. 31 to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 3. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window.

Oakland Mills Rd., 7000 block, 2:51 a.m. Sept. 3. Alcoholic beverages were stolen from a deli entered by breaking a front window.

Oakland Mills Rd., 6900 block, 9:02 a.m. Sept. 3. Bicycles were stolen from a shop entered by breaking a front window. One of the bikes was recovered that same day at Jackson Pond.

Stevens Forest Rd., 5600 block, 10 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Aug. 30. A laptop, a cellphone and a digital media player were stolen from a residence.

Stevens Forest Rd.,5600 block, 7 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Sept. 2. A TV and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Wincopin Cir., 10200 block, 9:49 p.m. Sept. 5. An attempt was made to enter an art gallery by breaking glass in a front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cordage Walk, 10700 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 2 to 4:37 a.m. Sept. 3. A black 2007 Nissan Armada was stolen.

Route 175 and Snowden River Pkwy., 6:47 p.m. Sept. 2. A 2010 Chrysler Sebring was stolen.

Wild Lilac, 5400 block, 10:20 a.m. Sept. 5. A blue Audi A8 was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Race Rd., 6500 block, 9:23 p.m. Sept. 3. A construction-site building was entered by breaking through a fence and removing wood from a rear window.

Railroad Ave., 5600 block, 5:05 a.m. Sept. 2. An attempt was made to enter a residence by tampering with a screen door.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Furrow Ave., 9300 block, 10:45 a.m. Sept. 3 to 2 p.m. Sept. 4. Jewelery, a video game system, games and cash were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

JESSUP AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sharewood Dr., 7700 block, 4 to 7 p.m. Sept. 4. Cash was stolen from a purse in a residence entered through a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Jenmar Rd., 8000 block, 3:06 p.m. Sept. 2. A red 2007 Ford Fusion was stolen.

Riggs Hill Rd., 10600 b lock, 12:47 p.m. Sept. 6. A white 2005 Ford F-250 pickup was stolen.

LAUREL AREA

ROBBERIES

Norfolk Ave., 9600 block, 5:43 a.m. Sept. 3. A male wearing a ski mask and gloves robbed a pedestrian of cash at knifepoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Canterbury Riding, 9000 block, 2:40 a.m. Sept. 4. A male entered an occupied residence, then fled empty-handed when confronted.

Canterbury Riding, 9000 block, 5:38 a.m. Sept. 5. An attempt was made to break into a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door. A male fled empty-handed when confronted.

Livery Lane, 9200 block, 1:33 a.m. Sept. 7. A break-in occurred at a storage room. Property was removed, but nothing was reported missing.

WOODSTOCK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enfield Dr., 10800 block, 3:25 p.m. Sept. 6. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

March 29, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1304 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lanier Overlook Ct., 8400 block, 12:15 to 1:48 p.m. March 19. Two handguns, a laptop, two guitars and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Linton Hall Rd., 8700 block, 10 to 11 p.m. March 15. Tools and other items were stolen from an unlocked vehicle inside an unlocked garage.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Masthead Trail, March 15. A man raped a female juvenile within August and September. A 34-year-old Largo man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Main St., 17700 block, 10:30 p.m. March 16. Two men robbed a male pedestrian of cash at gunpoint.

River Ridge Blvd. and Wayside Dr., 11:55 a.m. March 16. A group of male juveniles assaulted two male juvenile pedestrians and robbed one of a cellphone and shoes.

HAYMARKET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berkeley Dr., 16000 block, 4 p.m. Feb. 16 to 1:30 p.m. March 14. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Damascus Dr., 9500 block, 5:54 p.m. March 14. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance within June and July. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Ashton Ave., 7900 block, 3 p.m. March 19. A man in an office threw a rock at a glass partition, breaking the glass near two employees sitting on the other side of the window. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sudley Rd., 8100 block, 9:37 p.m. March 18. During an argument, a woman used a pocketknife to stab a male acquaintance in the chest. The man was treated for injuries. A 43-year-old woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8100 block, 8:20 p.m. March 14. A gunman entered a restaurant through an open rear door and demanded money. He fled on foot with cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hiram Ct., 11000 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. March 15. Two TVs, two video game systems, a cellphone and other items were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Mace Ct., 8100 block, 5:41 p.m. March 13 to 3 p.m. March 15. A tablet PC was stolen from a residence.

Sage St., 7500 block, 9:30 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. March 16. Cash, a TV, a video game system and video games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Sudley Manor Dr., 10600 block, 11:45 p.m. March 15 to 9:30 a.m. March 16. Liquor was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a side window.

Walcott Ct., 8600 block, 2:20 a.m. March 19. A man attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a rear window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 7:41 a.m. March 16. A man sexually assaulted two female acquaintances in a hotel room. A 28-year-old man was arrested.

Lost Canyon Ct., 15000 block, March 16 and 12:20 a.m. March 19. During an argument in a residence, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance, broke her cellphone and prevented her from leaving. She was able to leave the next morning and call police. The woman returned to the residence a few days later with another male acquaintance. The man met the two in a parking lot and assaulted the male acquaintance. Police arrived, and a 42-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Cara Dr., 12800 block, 10 p.m. March 17. During an argument, a man grabbed a kitchen knife and struggled with a male acquaintance. The man held the knife to the acquaintance's neck, who escaped. No injuries were reported.

WEAPONS

Tazanari Way, 13100 block, 5:16 p.m. March 14. After an argument between a woman and a male acquaintance earlier in the day, the woman fired a weapon inside a residence, then pointed the weapon at the acquaintance. The woman followed the male acquaintance into a parking lot, where he took the weapon from her. A 21-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 4100 block, 10:10 p.m. March 16. Two men assaulted an employee behind a restaurant and robbed him of cash at gunpoint.

Harbor Dr., 12600 block, 9:39 p.m. March 14. A gunman robbed a male pedestrian of cash and a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Patamon Way, 13000 block, 8:45 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. March 16. A laptop, an MP3 player and other items were stolen from a residence.

Quebec Pl., 5200 block, 9 a.m. March 10 to noon March 17. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a rear window.

Stockholm Way, 2900 block, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. March 14. Three video game systems, other electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear glass door.

Sutton Pl., 16600 block, 11:35 a.m. March 19. Someone entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Property was moved, but nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Aspen Pl., 9700 block, 4:10 p.m. March 17. Two men assaulted a male, who was treated for injuries.

Brent St., 9700 block, 1:40 a.m. March 14. Two males attempted to pet a resident's dog in front of his residence. When the resident asked the two males to leave, one threatened to kill the resident's dog, assault his family and burn his house. A 25-year-old man was arrested.

Byrd Dr. and Aspen Pl., 11:15 p.m. March 13. During an argument, a man grabbed a female acquaintance, injuring her arm. A 29-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Dumfries Rd., 10200 block, 10:30 p.m. March 17. During an argument, a man got into a vehicle occupied by a female and drove away. When the woman attempted to get out, the man assaulted her. The man also broke her cellphone. The woman eventually got out and attempted to flee near an apartment building. The man dragged her back to the vehicle. An acquaintance of the man separated the two, and the man walked away. A 25-year-old man was arrested. The woman was treated for injuries.

George St., 6 to 6:30 p.m. March 19. A man near a hospital told a police officer he had been shot. He had two gunshot wounds in his left armpit and a third in his left arm. He said a man had attempted to rob him as he was attempting to buy narcotics.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lake Jackson Dr., 8 p.m. March 17 to 9:10 a.m. March 19. Equipment was stolen from a construction site.

Park Ave., 12:10 to 2 p.m. March 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage door.

Willow Glen Ct., 8500 block, 7 p.m. March 13. A man took cash from the pocket of a female juvenile acquaintance. When she asked for it back, he pushed her to the ground and damaged her cellphone.

VANDALISM

Piney Point Ct., 8400 block, 9:25 p.m. March 16. Someone fired a BB gun at a residence, breaking a rear window.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Englewood Ct., 8000 block, 11:15 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. March 16. A computer notebook, an MP3 player, a portable hard drive, jewelry, a handbag and other items were stolen from a residence.

Signal View Dr., 9300 block, 7:59 p.m. March 16. Someone attempted to enter a vehicle by damaging a window.

Venture Ct., 9200 block, 8 p.m. March 17 to 3:02 p.m. March 18. A business was entered by prying open a rear door. Computers and walls were spray-painted. Cabinets and drawers were ransacked, and a fire extinguisher was discharged.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Fairfax County

These were among incidents reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For information, call 703-246-2253.

Sunrise Rd., 9700 block. A 1994 Ford E350 was stolen.

FRANCONIA DISTRICT

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Van Dorn St., 5700 block, 4:30 a.m. June 20. Three men, one with a gun, forced their way into a hotel room and sexually assaulted a 25-year-old woman and robbed her of cash and personal property. A 19-year-old Alexandria man was charged with rape, robbery and abduction with intent to defile. An 18-year-old Maryland man was charged with robbery and abduction with intent to defile. An 18-year-old District man was charged with robbery, use of a firearm in the commission of a felony, sexual assault and abduction with intent to defile.

ASSAULT

Hayfield and Old Telegraph Roads, 10 p.m. June 28. A man grabbed a female jogger from behind. The woman used mace and was able to get away. The man fled on foot.

Jefferson Ave., 6900 block. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

August 20, 2009 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ11


LENGTH: 3465 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MOUNT VERNON PLACE AND BLANDFORD STREET AREA, 6:55 p.m. July 31. A man groped a female pedestrian. When the victim screamed, the man fled in a dark blue van.

RESEARCH BLVD., 1600 block. A sexual assault occurred at a business. A 31-year-old man is sought in connection with the crime. 

ASSAULTS

MARYLAND AVE., 1 to 100 block, 2:55 a.m. Aug. 1. A male intervening in an argument struck a man in the head with a bottle. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

LEWIS AVE., 2300 block, 10:50 p.m. July 30. Three men asked a pedestrian for a dollar. When he reached into his pocket, they attacked him and robbed him of a backpack.

RIVER RD., 3:22 p.m. Aug. 3. Three men in a white 1999 Mercedes-Benz attacked a passenger and robbed him of cash and a cellphone. The victim said that he had intended to make a drug purchase.

WICOMICO ST., 8:45 p.m. Aug. 1. Four people wearing masks robbed a man near a Metro station of cash and a personal music device. The assailants fled in a black four-door vehicle with tinted windows.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BLUEGRASS DR., 9900 block, 3:12 a.m. Aug. 2. Someone attempted to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

BROOKSTONE CT., 7200 block, 6 to 10:30 p.m. Aug. 2. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

REDLAND RD., 17600 block, 9 p.m. July 28 to 8 a.m. July 29. Property was stolen from a deli entered by force.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 700 block, 6 p.m. July 29 to 6:45 a.m. July 30. Four wheels were stolen from a 2008 Dodge Ram at an automotive dealership.

SHADY GROVE RD., 16100 block, 5:55 a.m. July 29. Property was stolen from a beverage store entered by force. A male was seen on the premises.

STONE TRAIL DR., 8200 block, LILLY STONE DR., 8000 block, STILL SPRING CT., 8300 block, FENWAY RD., 8200 block, and CARDEROCK DR., 8300 block, Aug. 2 to Aug. 3. Tools, personal music devices, a radar detector and sunglasses were among property stolen from five vehicles. Three of the vehicle were entered by force.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ROCK RUN DR., 10900 block, noon to 6 p.m. July 30. A vehicle was stolen from a garage. It was recovered Aug. 4.

VANDALISM

JOSEPH MILL RD., 11700 block, Aug. 1 to Aug. 3. Elementary-school property was spray-painted with graffiti.

WYACONDA RD., 4900 block, July 31 to Aug. 3. Four businesses were spray-painted with graffiti.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVENUE AND PAULA DRIVE AREA, 10 p.m. July 31. A male youth sexually assaulted a female youth at his residence.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

OLD COLUMBIA PIKE, 13800 block, 9 a.m., Aug. 1. A man exposed himself to a female motorist in a parking lot.

ASSAULTS

WESTLAKE DR., 10200 block, 11:43 a.m. Aug. 1. A man backed his vehicle into another person's vehicle. After the two motorists drove to a nearby gas station, the man threatened the motorist and two employees of the business. A 31-year-old Bethesda man was charged with aggravated assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ANGLETON CT., 3700 block, July 28. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

TOPEKA ST., 9200 block, 11 p.m. July 30 to 8 a.m. July 31. A cellphone was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

WHITE FLINT MALL, 5:40 p.m. Aug. 1. A shopper returning to her vehicle confronted two men trying to remove its stereo. The men fled empty-handed.

WOOLSEY AVE., 3400 block, 6 p.m. July 29 to 9 a.m. July 30. Loose change was stolen from a vehicle that someone entered by breaking a window.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

ROBBERIES

DALE DR., 500 block, 3:36 p.m. July 28. A masked gunman robbed a business of cash, then robbed a nearby cleaning business. He fled in a vehicle driven by an accomplice.

MCKENNEY AVE., 10100 block, 3:05 p.m. July 31. On the pretext of taking a survey, two males forced their way into a home and robbed a woman of cash.

QUEBEC TERRACE AND RUATAN STREET, 9:15 p.m. July 31. Three men robbed a male pedestrian of cash at gunpoint.

STATESIDE DR., 1300 block, 2:30 p.m. July 30. A male youth knocked another male youth to the ground and robbed him of jewelry.

WAYNE AVE., 600 block, 10:10 p.m. Aug. 3. Two male youths knocked a woman to the ground and took her purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FOREST GLENN RD., 1400 block, 4:30 p.m. July 27 to 7:30 a.m. July 28. Property was stolen from a medical office. There was no sign of forced entry.

NOYES LANE, 1700 block, 7:30 p.m. July 27 to 6:45 a.m. July 30. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

District 4 Wheaton Station Telephone: 240-773-5500

HOMICIDES

BEL PRE RD., 3600 block, 9:29 p.m. Aug. 12. Lamour A. Harrison, 37, was found in her apartment with stab wounds. She was taken to a hospital, where she was pronounced dead. A 48-year-old man of the same address was charged with first-degree homicide.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 700 block, 7:02 p.m. Aug. 2. A 31-year-old man was charged with indecent exposure.

ROBBERIES

JUDITH ST., 4400 block, 10:09 p.m. July 27. A man put his hand over a woman's mouth as she leaned into a car. When her screams attracted a passerby, the assailant fled to a dark-colored sports car and drove away.

PRINCE PHILIP AND LINDENWOOD DRIVES, 8:45 p.m. July 30. A man threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of property.

VEIRS MILL RD., 11100 block, 4:02 p.m. Aug. 3. Three males robbed a man of property. A 19-year-old D.C. man, a 16-year-old Takoma Park male and a 16-year-old D.C. male were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASTRID CT., 2400 block, 2 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 2. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

CASHELL RD., 17200 block, July 27 to July 28. Property was stolen from Norbeck Country Club. There was no sign of forced entry. Vandalism also occurred.

FALLING GREEN RD., 3500 block, 12:30 a.m. Aug. 3. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing. Five males were seen fleeing the area in a large vehicle.

GRAND PRE RD., 14200 block, PEAR TREE LANE, 14100 block, POSTGATE TERR., 4100 block, MACBETH DR., 14500 block, WEEPING WILLOW CT., 3200 and 3300 blocks, and WHISPERING PINES DR., 3200 block, July 27 to Aug. 4. GPS devices and tools were among property stolen from 15 vehicles entered by force.

LOREE LANE, 13800 block, 9 a.m. to 5:42 p.m. July 31. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

PARKLAND DR., 13400 block, July 29 to July 30. Property was stolen from a landscape-business trailer.

District 5 Germantown Station Telephone: 240-773-6200

ASSAULTS

FREDERICK RD., 20000 block, 12:11 a.m. July 31. A woman threw a candlestick and a lamp at a person. A 31-year-old woman of no fixed address was charged with aggravated assault.

ROBBERIES

WATERS LANDING DR., 13100 block, 11:35 p.m. July 30. A man punched a cab driver in the face in an elementary school parking lot. Four other men joined in the attack, then searched the cab for cash. The assailants fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

APPLEDOWRE CIR., 20000 block, 8:06 a.m. Aug. 2. A break-in occurred at a residence. There was no sign of forced entry. Nothing was reported missing.

BENT WILLOW CIR., 18800 block, 7:10 a.m. to 8:45 p.m. July 30. A residence was ransacked. There was no sign of forced entry. Nothing was reported missing.

CRYSTAL ROCK TERR., 12500 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 3. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry. Four teenagers were seen fleeing the premises.

DRAGONFIRE WAY, 11500 block, 12:18 a.m. Aug. 1. Someone attempted to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

ISLAND VIEW CIR., 12100 block, 2 to 3:33 a.m. July 30. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MILESTONE NEIGHBORHOOD AREA, 12:01 to 6 a.m., Aug. 1. GPS devices, cameras, DVD players and personal music devices were among property stolen from eight vehicles. Two Germantown men were arrested. The property was recovered.

MILL POND TERR., 20400 block, 9:45 p.m. July 27. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

PICKERING DR., 12900 block, 6:10 to 6:16 a.m. Aug. 2. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BAILIWICK PL., 18300 block, 3 a.m. Aug. 2. A vehicle was set on fire. The vehicle had been stolen from the 19300 block of Circle Gate Drive.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

ASSAULTS

FREDERICK ROAD AND PERRY PARKWAY, 12:30 a.m. July 31. A passenger in a vehicle struck a male in the head with a bottle. The victim got out of the vehicle and took a taxi to a clinic for treatment. Four men are sought in connection with the attack.

GIRARD ST., 400 block, 9:30 p.m. July 30. A 26-year-old Germantown woman was charged with aggravated assault.

WEST SIDE DR., 800 block, July 31. A dispute between a landlord and a tenant resulted in an arrest for aggravated assault.

ROBBERIES

GIRARD STREET AND NORTH SUMMIT AVENUE, 10:15 p.m. July 31. Five males attacked a male and robbed him of property. A male teenager was arrested.

LOST KNIFE CIR., 18200 block, 10:10 p.m. July 27. Three men threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of property.

LOST KNIFE CIR., 18200 block, 9:45 p.m. July 28. Three people threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of property.

LOST KNIFE CIR., 18200 block, 9:45 p.m. July 29. Five males surrounded a pedestrian and searched the victim for property. The assailants fled empty-handed when confronted by passersby.

LOST KNIFE CIR., 18200 block, 10 p.m. July 29. Five males surrounded a pedestrian and robbed him of property.

PROFESSIONAL DR., 200 block, 6:45 p.m. Aug. 1. Three males robbed two people in a hotel room of property at knifepoint.

TRAVIS AVENUE AND OLD GAME PRESERVE ROAD, 11:15 p.m. July 30. A gunman demanded a pedestrian's property, struck the victim with the weapon and fled with property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ENGLEFIELD DR., 100 block, 2:20 p.m. July 30. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

GENTLE CIR., 9400 block, noon to 7 p.m. Aug. 4. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 2460 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

King Farm Blvd., 1 to 1:15 a.m. July 2. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Stonebridge View Dr., 14300 block, 12:15 a.m. July 5. An attempted strong-arm robbery occurred at an elementary school. The victim knows the persons involved.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fellowship Lane, 12500 block, July 25 to 30. Property was stolen from a construction site. There was no sign of forced entry.

Rollins Ave., 200 block, 1:52 p.m. July 9. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Rutledge Dr., 11100 block, 3 to 5:30 p.m. July 2. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Travilah Rd., 14200 block, 8:36 a.m. July 7. Property was stolen from a business entered by force. A 48-year-old Redland man was arrested.

Village Square Terr., 12500 block, 7 p.m. July 8 to 8 a.m. July 9. Equipment and other items were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 2615 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Boat House Way, 14600 block, 11:33 p.m. Nov. 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence. 

Frederick Rd., 15900 block, 3 p.m. Nov. 21 to 7 a.m. Nov. 22. Property was stolen from a construction site entered by force.

Highland Ave., 200 block, 11:30 a.m. to 10:45 p.m. Nov. 20. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Randolph Rd., 5400 block, 7:21 p.m. Nov. 22. A vehicle was reported stolen.

DISTRICT 2BETHESDA STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-652-9200 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rosemary St., 4200 block, 8 to 11 a.m. Nov. 24. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ames Rd., 100 block, Nov. 20 to 22. A break-in occurred at a residence. There was no sign of forced entry, and nothing was reported missing.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 759 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

GAINESVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Heythorpe Ct., 13600 block, 2 p.m. March 20. A man being served with a warrant attacked three police officers, breaking a pair of eyeglasses and causing a laceration to an officer's forehead. A 29-year-old Gainesville man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bosna Ct., 10300 block, 7 p.m. March 19 to 6:45 p.m. March 21. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window. 

Bristow Rd., 14700 block, 3 a.m. March 22. Beer was stolen from a business entered by breaking a side window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Touchstone Circle area, 11:25 p.m. March 25. A man attacked a juvenile acquaintance. A 26-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Kellogg Dr., 4800 block, 4:31 p.m. March 25. Three male juveniles attacked a juvenile acquaintance on a basketball court and knocked him to the ground, then fled when a witness intervened. The victim was treated at the scene for serious but non-life-threatening injuries.

ROBBERIES

Bisbee Ct. and Bixby Rd., 11:36 p.m. March 23. Two males tried to take a purse from a pedestrian, then fled empty-handed when she resisted.

Build America Dr., 14800 block, 2:21 p.m. March 21. Two men robbed a business of cash at gunpoint.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 1:59 a.m. March 22. During a fight at a restaurant, a group of men knocked a man to the ground, then fled with his cellphone. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blackburn Rd., 15500 block, 4 p.m. March 16 to 9 a.m. March 21. A historically significant building was entered through an unlocked window. Nothing was reported missing.

Bobolink Dr., 15800 block, 3 p.m. March 19 to 8:30 p.m. March 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Cottonwood Ct., 1400 block, 9:30 p.m. March 25 to 5 p.m. March 26. A video game system and a video game were stolen from a residence.

Creekview Cir., 12200 block, 9 p.m. March 15 to 9 a.m. March 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing the front door.

Darlington Loop, 1900 block, 11:56 a.m. March 21. Two males trying to break into a residence through a rear window fled when confronted. Two Woodbridge males, ages 15 and 18, were arrested.

Featherstone Rd., 1400 block, 1:27 p.m. March 25. Two men entered a business by forcing a side door, then fled empty-handed.

Marina Way, 13200 block, 6:11 a.m. March 24. A man broke into a work trailer, took keys to a company truck, then crashed the vehicle into a locked gate. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Mendoza Lane, 15600 block, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 20. A video game system, a camera and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Royal Ct., 16500 block, 12:30 to 6:30 p.m. March 23. A computer was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Wigglesworth Way, 1800 block, 10:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. March 19. Two laptops, a desktop computer, two video game systems, a TV and games were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Wink Way, 2700 block, 4:15 p.m. March 23 to 7:15 a.m. March 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence under construction by forcing the front door.

Wyndale Ct., 3300 block, 4:15 to 8 p.m. March 21. Four computers were stolen from a residence.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Signal Hill Rd., 8700 block, 1:45 a.m. March 22. During an argument, a man struck a male in the face with a bottle. A 21-year-old Manassas man was charged with aggravated assault. During the ride to the police station, he was also charged with spitting in public.

ROBBERIES

Dumfries Rd., 14000 block, 3:25 a.m. March 23. A man armed with a pellet gun robbed a convenience store of cash and cartons of cigarettes.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Phoenix Dr., 8600 block, 6 to 6:20 p.m. March 20. Cash was stolen from an occupied motel room.

VANDALISM

Byrd Dr., 9200 block, 10:30 p.m. March 20. Two vehicles were damaged.

Wharton Ct., 9100 block, 1 a.m. March 22. A male was confronted while pouring sugar into a vehicle. He fled to a waiting vehicle.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Industry Dr., 9100 block, 7:35 a.m. March 24. More than 250 gallons of water were pumped into a vehicle from a municipal fire hydrant. Two Dale City men, ages 37 and 45, were arrested.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 776 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Naughton Ct., 10000 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Oct. 12. A residence was entered by breaking a basement window. A Nokesville man, 19, and a Bristow man, 19, were arrested.

DALE CITY AREA

ASSAULTS

Cloverdale Rd., 15100 block, 2:21 a.m. Oct. 8. During an argument, a man attacked a male acquaintance. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested. The victim was treated for non-life-threatening injuries. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Westminster Lane, 14300 block, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 14. A laptop, a TV and other electronics were stolen from a residence entered through the front door.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Mountain Laurel Loop, 3300 block, 12:20 p.m. Oct. 8. A juvenile destroyed property at a residence and attacked a female acquaintance and a police officer responding to the report of a disturbance. A 16-year-old Woodbridge male was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Macon Way, 3500 block, 9:22 p.m. Oct. 12. Several gunshots were heard.

LAKE RIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Smoketown Rd., 12900 block, 6:15 a.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a front window.

MANASSAS AREA

ROBBERIES

Urbanna Rd., 8000 block, 7:45 p.m. Oct. 8. Two men knocked a male from a bicycle and robbed him of a cellphone. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Flagler Cir., 7900 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 17. Two TVs and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Graham Ct., 18200 block, 9:01 p.m. Oct. 16. A man tried to force his way into an acquaintance's residence by kicking at a door, then attacked a neighbor who intervened. A 32-year-old Dumfries man was arrested. No injuries were reported.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Minnieville Rd., 13500 block, Oct. 13. A 52-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested in connection with groping incidents at an auto-repair business Jan. 19 and July 8.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Cardinal Dr. and I-95, 5:57 p.m. Oct. 13. During an argument inside a moving vehicle, a passenger made threats and fired a handgun through an open window. The motorist and a juvenile passenger got out of the vehicle at a parking lot. A 55-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. No injuries were reported.

Opal Lane, 13100 block, 6:08 p.m. Oct. 15. During an argument, a man threatened a female acquaintance at gunpoint. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Coachman Terr., 15200 block, 1:45 a.m. Oct. 16. A man hailed a cab, then robbed the driver of cash at gunpoint.

Grist Mill Terr., 15300 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 13. A man robbed a deliveryman of cash and a pizza at gunpoint.

Tilletson Pl., 1700 block, 3:27 a.m. Oct. 9. Two men robbed a pedestrian of cash at gunpoint. The victim was treated for injuries sustained when he was struck with the weapon.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayfield Dr., 3200 block, 9:45 to 11:45 a.m. Oct. 15. A residence was entered through a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Carter Lane, 1500 block, 12:40 p.m. Oct. 14. A TV was stolen from a building entered by forcing a rear window.

Edgewater Dr., 14800 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 14 to 1:20 p.m. Oct. 15. A residence was entered by forcing a front window. Nothing was reported missing.

Gregg St., 4200 block, 2 to 8 a.m. Oct. 12. A laptop, a cellphone and a wallet were stolen from a residence entered by removing an air-conditioner from a window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13700 block, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 14. Property was stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Lynwood Dr., 5000 block, 5 to 10 p.m. Oct. 14. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Mapledale Ave., 14200 block, 7 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Oct. 13. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement window.

Tag Ct., 6100 block, 12:20 to 12:45 p.m. Oct. 12. A residence was entered through a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

 Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

HOMICIDES

Braxted Lane, 8600 block, 9:45 p.m. Oct. 14. During an argument at a residence, a 28-year-old man was stabbed. He was pronounced dead at the scene. An 18-year-old Manassas man was charged with first-degree murder.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sassafras Ct., 9700 block, Oct. 14 to 15. Two laptops and two watches were stolen from a residence.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Meeker Ct., 7 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 16. Prescription medicine was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Fairfax County

These were among incidents reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For information, call 703-246-2253.

FRANCONIA DISTRICT SEXUAL ASSAULT

Van Dorn St., 5700 block, 4:30 a.m. June 20. Three men, one with a gun, forced their way into a hotel room and sexually assaulted a 25-year-old woman and robbed her of cash and personal property. A 19-year-old Alexandria man was charged with rape, robbery and abduction with intent to defile. An 18-year-old Maryland man was charged with robbery and abduction with intent to defile. An 18-year-old District man was charged with robbery, use of a firearm in the commission of a felony, sexual assault and abduction with intent to defile.

Hayfield and Old Telegraph Roads, 10 p.m. June 28. A man grabbed a female jogger from behind. The woman used mace and was able to get away. The man fled on foot.
