Howard County Crime


SECTION: HOWARD EXTRA; Pg. T07


LENGTH: 1337 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Howard County Police Department. For more information call 410-313-2236.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit organization, will pay up to $ 2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 410-276-8888. Callers may remain anonymous.  

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

AUTO DR., 12400 block, 10:55 a.m. July 22. A black Toyota Highlander was stolen.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LONG REACH AREA, 2 p.m. July 28. A man approached a boy and a girl riding bikes near a pond. He distracted the boy by inviting him to fish, then took the girl to a nearby area, where he assaulted her. She said she had knocked the man's cell phone off his belt and into the pond, and police used the device to track him. A 34-year-old Columbia man was charged with second-, third- and fourth-degree sex offenses and second-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

CLOUPLEAP CT., 8700 block, 6:45 p.m. July 26. One of three men walking near a dumpster at the rear of a village center struck a pedestrian in the head, took cash and fled. The victim was treated at Shock Trauma.

FORELAND GARTH, 6200 block, 11:29 p.m. July 27. A man another man about a debt. The victim gave him cash. A 40-year-old man was arrested.

HICKORY RIDGE RD., 10700 block, 12:01 a.m. July 27. A man in a parking lot who implied that he was armed with a weapon asked a convenience-store customer for cash and started to frisk him. The victim surrendered cash from his wallet.

LITTLE PATUXENT PKWY., 10300 block, 6:31 p.m. July 28. One of four men grabbed a woman's purse on the second level of the Columbia Mall.

SUNNY SPRING, 6100 block, 8:51 p.m. July 24. One of two men at a neighborhood center talking to a man about his bike punched him in the face. Nothing was reported missing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BROKEN STAFF, 7400 block, 12:01 to 12:59 a.m. July 30. A video-game system and game cartridges were stolen from a home entered through a patio door.

BROTHERS PARTNERSHIP CT, 5700 block, 11 a.m. to 1:04 p.m. July 25. A man trying to speak to a friend climbed through an upstairs window at a residence. During an argument after he got inside, a front-hall wall was damaged.

CEDAR LANE, 5600 block, 3:15 p.m. July 28 to 6:40 a.m. July 29. A generator and tools were stolen from a construction trailer entered by cutting a lock.

COBBLEFIELD DR., 8600 block, 7 a.m. July 28 to 12:20 a.m. July 29. A residence was vandalized after being entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

GARLAND LANE, 6800 block, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. July 25. Two guitars and an amplifier were stolen from a house entered through an unlocked basement sliding-glass door.

GREYSTONE LANE, 8400 block, 12:21 p.m. July 29. A vacant apartment was entered through an unlocked window. Blue paint was dumped on the carpet. Nothing was reported missing.

SMOOTH MEADOW WAY, 5400 block, 2:14 p.m. July 29. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

TAMAR DR., 8900 block, 6:30 a.m. July 27. A person entered an occupied apartment by kicking the front door, then punched a hole in a bedroom door. Nothing was reported missing.

WHITEACRE RD., 9600 block, 7:49 p.m. July 23. A first-floor apartment was entered by smashing a window. Two people were seen entering the residence. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA RD., 5300 block, 7:37 a.m. July 29. A 2001 Suzuki was stolen.

LAMBETH CT., 9600 block, 7:22 a.m. July 24. A blue-and-silver 1997 Chevrolet Tahoe was stolen.

OAK HALL LANE, 6700 block, 7 p.m. July 26 to 4:40 p.m. July 27. A beige 1991 Nissan Sentra was stolen.

PHELPS LUCK DRIVE AND GREY WING COURT, 8:30 p.m. April 24 to 8:43 a.m. July 25. A white 1995 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

QUIET HOURS, 6500 block, 1:43 p.m. July 28. A 1988 Kawasaki motorcycle was stolen. It was recovered in Greenbelt.

TWIN RIVERS RD., 10400 block, 5:20 a.m. July 29. A moped was stolen.

WOODPARK LANE, 7600 block, 6 a.m. July 30. A 1988 Chevrolet Z24 was stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

LINTHICUM RD., 4200 block, 9 p.m. July 20 to 2 p.m. July 21. A green 2001 Kawasaki 125 was stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HANOVER RD. S., 6200 block, 1:03 a.m. July 28. An attempt was made to enter a storage trailer at a business. An alarm was activated. Nothing was reported missing.

SETTER DR., 5900 block, 8 p.m. July 23 to 6:30 p.m. July 24. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear porch sliding door. Nothing was reported missing.

ROBBERIES

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MAIN ST., 8100 block, 9:15 p.m. July 24 to 12:15 a.m. July 25. A black 2000 Ford Explorer was stolen.

OAKLAND MILLS RD., 7100 block, 5:09 a.m. July 24. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a front door.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

MIDWAY AVE., 1-100 block, 3:49 p.m. July 23. A woman and her daughter argued with a man. As they walked away, he lowered his pants.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DEEP WATER LANE, 8800 block, 5 p.m. July 25 to 7:15 a.m. July 28. Several construction tools were stolen from a construction trailer entered by cutting a lock.

GORMAN RD., 8800 block, 10 p.m. July 26 to 9 a.m. July 27. A liquor store was entered by smashing glass in a front door. The store was vandalized, but nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CANTERBURY RIDING, 9000 block, 8:12 p.m. July 21. A white Honda Accord was stolen.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 9900 block, 11:50 p.m. July 20. A burgundy Chrysler van was stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

OLD FREDERICK RD., 16400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. July 28. A TV was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUTE 32, 3000 block, 6 p.m. July 27 to 2:21 p.m. July 28. A microwave oven, a TV, a copier and a restaurant gift certificate were stolen from a sales trailer entered by breaking a rear window with a rock.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WETHERBURN RD., 10400 block, July 3 to July 4. A set of golf clubs was stolen from an open garage.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. SM17


LENGTH: 1137 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Chesapeake Beach Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

DALRYMPLE RD., Aug. 19. Two flowerpots and stands were thrown onto a driveway of a residence.

Dunkirk Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUTE 4, 8:58 a.m. Aug. 16. A vehicle stopped for a traffic violation had stolen license plates. A man, 50, was charged with theft less than $100. 

Huntingtown Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PLUM POINT RD., 6 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Aug. 7. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle parked at Plum Point Middle School.

Lusby Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LUSBY AREA, 7:45 a.m. Aug. 18. A woman, 46, was sexually assaulted by a man who forced his way into her residence. The attacker fled in her vehicle. A man, 42, was charged with first-degree rape, first-degree assault, first-degree burglary and theft of a motor vehicle.

Prince Frederick Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COSTLEY WAY, 1 p.m. Aug. 9. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle parked at Market Square Shopping Center.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

SKIPJACK RD., 8:40 a.m. Aug. 10 to 9:40 a.m. Aug. 11. A pumping station, water tower and storage tank were vandalized with spray paint.

Sunderland Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CLYDE JONES RD., 9:30 a.m. Aug. 15. An outside wall of an outbuilding at the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints was vandalized with spray paint.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

La Plata Area

ASSAULTS

MONA FARM PL., 5:51 p.m. Aug. 19. A boy, 9, knocked on the door of a neighbor's residence. A man, 51, answered the door and pointed a rifle at the boy. The man was charged with first-degree assault.

CAR JACKINGS

MALL CIR., 1:55 p.m. Aug. 16. A woman in the parking lot of St. Charles Towne Center was approached by a man who demanded the keys to her vehicle. She refused and the man grabbed her arm, but she managed to flee into the mall. The man was last seen fleeing with someone.

Waldorf Area

ASSAULTS

BERRY RD., 11100 block, 6:53 p.m. Aug. 14. A man, 43, was stabbed in his upper body at a residence. A woman, 22, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

GALLERY PL., 3000 block, 7:15 p.m. Aug. 15. A security guard restrained a man, 24, who was arguing with a woman, 20. The man attempted to disarm the guard and then struggled with police officers. He was charged with second-degree assault, having an open container of alcohol, disorderly conduct, failure to obey a lawful order, trespassing, resisting arrest and theft more than $500.

LISA DR., 2500 block, 10:10 p.m. Aug. 17. A man, 29, and a woman, 25, were hit with a bat after they confronted a man who was using the bat to break windows on parked cars in a driveway. The victims man and woman were taken to Southern Maryland Hospital Center with non-life-threatening injuries. A man, 28, fled the area. A warrant was issued for his arrest charging him with first- and second-degree assault, reckless endangerment and malicious destruction of property.

O'DONNELL PL., 10000 block, 2:15 a.m. Aug. 19. A woman was assaulted and a police officer was bitten during a domestic dispute with a man in the a restaurant parking lot. The man, 25, had taken the woman's vehicle. He was charged with assaulting a police officer, second-degree assault, resisting arrest, obstructing and hindering and unlawful taking of a motor vehicle.

HOME INVASIONS

ELL LANE, 5:40 a.m. Aug. 18. A man, 27, kicked open the front door of an apartment and attempted to kick open a bedroom door. He then fired multiple shots through the door. Some of the shots entered an apartment below, but no one was injured. The man fled the scene and has not been located.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JEFFERSON FARM PL., 12000 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 21. A man, 36, and a woman, 27, were arrested at Home Depot for shoplifting. During the arrest, the woman resisted, and a brief struggle ensued. They were charged with theft more than $500. The man was additionally charged with conspiracy to commit theft, possession of marijuana and giving a false statement to a police officer. The woman was additionally charged with second-degree assault, resisting arrest, possession of cocaine and possession of drug paraphernalia.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

California Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

THREE NOTCH RD., 7:27 p.m. Aug. 20. Miscellaneous items and a handicap parking placard were stolen from a vehicle parked at San Souci Plaza.

THREE NOTCH RD., 7:18 p.m. Aug. 19. A satellite radio and 10 CDs were stolen from a vehicle parked at San Souci Plaza. The vehicle's convertible top was cut.

Charlotte Hall Area

ROBBERIES

CHARLOTTE HALL, Aug. 2. Three men armed with knives robbed the Movie Gallery. The men fled in a light-colored Cadillac Escalade.

Leonardtown Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 10:20 a.m. Aug. 20. A CD player, speakers and amplifier were stolen from a vehicle.

Lexington Park Area

ASSAULTS

NATIONAL CIR., Aug. 14. A man, 35, entered a residence by force and assaulted a woman. He was charged with second-degree assault, first- and second-degree burglary and violation of a protective order.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREAT MILLS RD., 3:20 p.m. Aug. 22. Tools were stolen from a work truck parked at St. Mary's Square.

SCOTT CIR., 4:47 p.m. Aug. 14. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Mechanicsville Area

ROBBERIES

MECHANICSVILLE, 1:30 p.m. Aug. 17. A man with a gun robbed the Bank of America and fled in a green, four-door vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JENNIFER DR., 5:50 p.m. Aug. 16. A pressure washer, stone bird bath and stand, two decorative globes and stone stands and nine animal figures were stolen from a residence.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

August 25, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1245 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

DALE CITY AREA ROBBERIES

Endsbrook Lane, 4400 block, 2:15 a.m. Aug. 16. Two males hit a male juvenile several times in the face, then robbed him of a phone. The juvenile was treated for injuries.

Redwing Dr. and Whittier Loop, 4:45 p.m. Aug. 9. A group of males assaulted a male juvenile pedestrian and robbed him of a bottle of soda. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Cherry Hill Rd., 1500 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 14 to 10 a.m. Aug. 15. Cash was stolen from a business entered through an unlocked side door.

Old Stage Coach Rd., 17400 block, 7:57 a.m. Aug. 12. A man jumped over a fence and took 50 aluminum rims from a business.

HAYMARKET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berkley Dr., 15900 block, 8 p.m. Aug. 15 to 2:26 a.m. Aug. 16. A country club was entered by breaking a window of a pool house. Nothing was reported stolen.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Mission Ridge Dr., 10900 block, 11:31 p.m. Aug. 14. A man held a female acquaintance inside a residence against her will. He allegedly had raped her several days earlier. A 42-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blue Gray Cir., 7800 block, 9:30 a.m. Aug. 7 to 2 p.m. Aug. 11. Tools and other property were stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear window.

Pointer Lane, 8100 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 8 to 1:20 p.m. Aug. 9. A laptop computer, a TV and a camera were stolen from a residence entered through a window.

Santa Rose Ct., 13600 block, 8:30 p.m. Aug. 9 to 8:30 p.m. Aug. 10. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Saranac Pl., 12000 block, 1:36 a.m. Aug. 11. A male intruder in a residential garage was opening the door of a vehicle as a resident was closing the garage door. When he saw the resident, the man fled empty-handed.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULTS

Earl Ct., 3500 block, 5:42 a.m. Aug. 11. During an argument, a man hit a female acquaintance several times in the face. The woman was treated for injuries. A 29-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Red Oak Lane, 18900 block, 3:51 p.m. Aug. 12. A man was attempting to take a TV from a residence when a resident saw him. The intruder fled to a nearby house. A 30-year-old Stafford man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Sugar Hill Dr., 1800 block, 2:47 p.m. Aug. 13. A man at community pool grabbed a woman and pulled her to him. The woman escaped and called police. A 45-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Cavalier Dr., 12400 block, 1:04 a.m. Aug. 13. Four males in a residential garage were looking at a handgun, when one picked up the gun and pulled the trigger, accidentally shooting another male in the arm. The man was treated for injuries. A 24-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with reckless handling of a firearm.

Mohican Dr., 11800 block, 2:25 a.m. Aug. 15. Someone fired BBs from a vehicle, hitting two parked vehicles and a residence. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Financial Loop, 1700 block, 6:13 a.m. Aug. 13. A gunman robbed a male motorist of cash at a drive-through area for an ATM.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brussels Way, 3900 block, 6:30 p.m. Aug. 12 to 2 p.m. Aug. 15. A handgun and other property were stolen from a vehicle.

Church Hill Dr., 13800 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 5 to noon Aug. 10. An air conditioner was stolen from a senior center.

Fortuna Ct., 3800 block, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Aug. 11. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 1 to 3 p.m. Aug. 14. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a window.

John Coffee Ct., 2800 block, 4:30 p.m. July 31 to 3 p.m. Aug. 8. Tools were stolen from a garage.

Nanticoke Way, 16500 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 13 to 8 p.m. Aug. 15. A pressure washer was stolen from a storage shed of a business. The shed was entered by breaking a lock.

Occoquan Rd., 12900 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 8 to 11 a.m. Aug. 10. A computer and a TV were stolen from a business entered through an unlocked rear door.

Ogilvie Ct., 3800 block, 10:51 p.m. Aug. 13. Three men, one armed with a gun, entered a residence through an unlocked rear door. They tied up a male resident with an extension cord, took his car keys and robbed two other residents of cash.

Smoketown Rd., 14000 block, noon to 5 p.m. Aug. 9. Two computers were stolen from a church.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

Minnieville Rd., 13100 block, 10:49 p.m. Aug. 14. A man climbed a ladder and looked into a residence. A neighbor notified a resident, and the man fled.

VANDALISM

Antietam Rd., 12000 block, 8:12 a.m. Aug. 15. A male threw a rock at a school, breaking a front door.

Cordell Ave., 3800 block, 1 a.m. Aug. 12 to 12:10 a.m. Aug. 13. Someone spray-painted a school wall, two classroom trailers, a storage container and four telephone boxes.

Marquis Pl., 3800 block, 8 p.m. Aug. 9 to noon Aug. 10. Someone used a flare to burn an inappropriate design into a plastic slide at a school playground. The bottom of the slide was also burned.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Devonshire Ct., 8600 block, Aug. 14. A man assaulted a female relative. An Inwood, N.Y., man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Euclid Ct., 9100 block, 7 p.m. Aug. 10. Someone fired BBs, breaking a window at a business.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Bens Way, 10200 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 13. A man with a T-shirt over his face was fondling himself as a female pedestrian walked by.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cockrell Rd., 9800 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 8. A woman stole lottery tickets from a convenience store.

Corydalis Ct., 10000 block, 5:40 p.m. Aug. 10 to 7 a.m. Aug. 11. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle.

Garden St., 9600 block, 12:30 a.m. to 9:40 p.m. Aug. 8. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Wakeman Ct., 10600 block. An HVAC unit for a train was stolen from a business.

Manassas Park

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 1036 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA ASSAULTS

Hazel Circle Dr., 11800 block, 4 a.m. May 6. Five female juvenile residents at a youth facility assaulted a woman and destroyed several pieces of property before fleeing from the dormitory. Three of the youths assaulted another female juvenile resident. Five Bristow females - a 15-year-old, a 14-year-old and three 16- year-olds - were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Chianti Terr., 8900 block, 3 p.m. May 5 to 9:30 a.m. May 6. A bike was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Open Meadow Lane, 12100 block, 3:30 to 6:30 p.m. May 1. A tablet PC, an MP3 player and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Paddock Ct., 13600 block, midnight May 4 to 6 p.m. May 5. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage door.

Pensacola Pl., 7400 block, 4:30 p.m. May 2 to 6:30 a.m. May 3. Appliances were stolen from a residence under construction that had been entered by breaking a rear basement window.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ashland Ave., April 29. A man forced a female juvenile acquaintance to take inappropriate photographs of herself and attempted to sexually assault her. A 39-year-old man and a 32-year-old woman, both of Manassas, were arrested.

ASSAULTS

Cannonball Ct., 10100 block, 4:35 p.m. May 7. During an argument, a man pulled out a handgun and assaulted a female acquaintance. A 40-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

WEAPONS

St. Johns Ct., 7200 block, 9:46 p.m. May 1. A woman who was cleaning a firearm in a residence accidentally fired a bullet, which ended up outdoors. No injuries were reported. A 31-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Shoppers Sq., 8200 block, 7:22 p.m. May 2. A gunman robbed a restaurant of cash and fled in a vehicle.

ASSAULTS

Dillon Ave., 14800 block, noon May 3. A man knocked on a front door of a residence. When no one answered, he attempted to enter by breaking a rear window. He fled when he saw a resident.

Elmwood Dr., 14800 block, 1:16 a.m. April 4. Someone entered a residence through an unlocked front door, then fled empty-handed after being confronted by a resident.

Horner Rd., 1400 block, 9 a.m. May 3 to 10 a.m. May 7. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a rear door.

Opitz Blvd., 1800 block, 7 p.m. May 5 to 7 a.m. May 6. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing open an interior office door.

Tecumseh Ct., 3000 block, 12:21 p.m. May 3. Two male juveniles attempted to enter a residence through a rear glass door. When a resident saw them, the two fled through the back yard, damaging a fence. Two Woodbridge males, 16 and 17, were arrested.

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 2204 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Shady Grove Metro Station area, 1 a.m. July 28. A sexual assault occurred in a residence. The people involved are acquainted.  

ROBBERIES

Bou Ave., 5700 block, 6:24 p.m. July 26. A male and a female assaulted and tried to rob a person near a craft store. A District male, 13, and a female, 14, of unknown address, were arrested.

McCausland Pl., 1-99 block, 5 to 6:50 a.m. July 23. A male was observed looking into a window.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Brookridge Ct., 9900 block, 1;30 to 2:30 p.m. July 29. A sexual assault occurred. The people involved were acquainted.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Russell and E. Diamond avenues, 11:25 p.m. July 26. A man exposed himself at an intersection. A Gaithersburg man, 44, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Anna Ct., 100 block, 10:30 p.m. July 25. A man assaulted an acquaintance. A Gaithersburg man, 36, was arrested.

Thomas Lea Terr., 8800 block, 2:49 a.m. July 23. A man assaulted an acquaintance. A Gaithersburg man, 21, was arrested.

Turnham Lane, 1-99 block, 10 p.m. July 25. A man assaulted an acquaintance. A Gaithersburg man, 27, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Clopper Rd., 700 block, 4:30 a.m. July 27. Three males assaulted a person and took property.

Rothbury Dr., 9100 block, 11 to 11:25 p.m. July 23. Five or six males attempted to rob people on a path behind a shopping center. Pedestrians were assaulted. Nothing was reported missing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clopper Rd., 900 block, noon July 28 to 6 a.m. July 29. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

E. Diamond Ave., 300 block, 10:26 p.m. July 30. An attempted break-in was reported at a residence.

King James Way, 17200 block, 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. July 26. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Quince Orchard Blvd., 800 block, 4 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. July 26. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Rosewood Manor Lane and Brethren area, and Sparrow Valley Lane and Grazing Way area, 6 p.m. July 25 to 8:15 a.m. July 26. GPS devices, wallets, battery chargers and cash were stolen from eight vehicles. There were no signs of forced entry.

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

Harrington Rd., 600 block, 4 to 4:13 p.m. Aug. 1. A man began making small talk with a male pedestrian. He then struck the pedestrian, causing him to drop his keys and sunglasses. The robber picked up the property and fled with a male accomplice south on Harrington Road toward Cabin John Parkway.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clemson Ct., 1-99 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 3 to 9 a.m. Aug. 4. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 673 words


Anne Arundel County

No report was available from Anne Arundel County police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Duke of Gloucester St. area, 2:15 a.m. April 25. A man attempted to rape a woman he had met that evening. A Severn man, 23, was charged with attempted rape, assault, reckless endangerment and false imprisonment. 

ASSAULTS

Cornhill St., 12:01 a.m. April 28. During an argument, a man pointed a rifle at an acquaintance. An Annapolis man, 29, was charged with first-degree assault, reckless endangerment and use of a firearm in a violent crime.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Admiral Dr., 200 block, 8 a.m. to 11:20 p.m. April 27. Electronics were stolen from a home.

Carrollton Ave., 900 block, 5 p.m. April 24. A bicycle was stolen.

Hilltop Lane, 300 block, 3 to 9 a.m. April 17. A vehicle was entered; nothing was reported stolen.

Second St., 400 block, 12:30 p.m. April 25 to 8:30 a.m. April 26. Cash, clothes, sunglasses and a knife were stolen from a vehicle.

Tyler Ave., 700 block, 10 p.m. April 22 to 7 a.m. April 23. Cash and a parking pass were stolen from a vehicle.

Tyler Ave., 800 block, 8 p.m. April 22 to 9:20 a.m. April 23. Two vehicles were entered; nothing was reported stolen.

Vincent St., 1900 block, 5 p.m. April 21 to 8:30 a.m. April 22. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

Warren Dr., 700 block, 8:45 p.m. April 22 to 1:30 p.m. April 23. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Second St., 500 block, 7 p.m. April 25 to 11 a.m. April 26. A Land Rover was stolen. The vehicle was found April 26 on Cypress Road. A laptop computer had been stolen from it.

Town Pines Ct., 8:30 to 10:15 p.m. April 29. A vehicle was stolen. It was found on fire in Severna Park.

WEAPONS

Marcs Ct., 3 a.m. April 25. A shot was fired.

Howard County

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Prince George's County crime reportPrince George's County crime report


BYLINE: Compiled by Jillian S. Sowah


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1016 words


Prince George's County

According to the Prince George's County Police Department, there will be no weekly crime reports available while the 911 Call Center is being upgraded. The county's report will return once the transition is complete, the department said. For information, call 301-772-4710.

Greenbelt 

These were among incidents reported by the Greenbelt Police Department. For information, call 301-474-7200.

Rewards for information

The Greenbelt Police Department will pay cash rewards of up to $500 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of persons responsible for any of the following unsolved crimes. Call Criminal Investigations at 301-507-6530. All information is confidential.

ROBBERIES

Edmonston Rd., 9300 block, 7:47 a.m. May 1. A gray 1998 Mercury Grand Marquis was stolen using a key robbed from an acquaintance.

Gardenway, unit block, 3:54 p.m. May 5. Three people attacked two pedestrians, then fled with property. A 19-year-old District man and two juveniles were arrested nearby. Charges included robbery and assault. No serious injuries were reported.

Greenbelt Rd., 6000 block, 5:13 p.m. April 28. A man armed with a weapon robbed a store of cash. No injuries were reported.

Hanover Dr., 7200 block, 5:30 a.m. April 30. A gunman robbed a person in a hotel room. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cherrywood Terr., 5900 block, 8:45 p.m. April 29. Electronics were stolen.

Edmonston Ct., 9100 block, 4:15 p.m. May 1. A break-in occurred at a business.

Edmonston Ct., 9100 block, 4:54 p.m. May 3. Electronics were stolen.

Edmonston Rd., 9100 block, May 5. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Edmonston Rd., 9300 block, 6:38 p.m. May 3. A sword was stolen.

Greenbelt Metro Dr., 5600 block, May 1. A wheel was stolen from a vehicle.

Hillside Rd., unit block, 2:47 a.m. April 30. An attempt was made to break into a residence.

Lakecrest and Lakeside drives, April 30. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Mandan Rd., 7300 block, 10:12 p.m. April 30. Electronics were stolen.

Mandan Rd., 7300 block, 7:24 p.m. May 2. Electronics and clothing were stolen.

Springhill Ct., 9100 block, 1:44 p.m. May 2. Electronics were stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Edmonston Terr. and Edmonston Ct., May 4. A white 1994 Honda Civic that had been reported stolen was recovered.

Springhill Lane, 9100 block, April 30. A black 1996 Volkswagen Jetta was stolen.

VANDALISM

Lake Park Dr., 6600 block, May 4. A vehicle's tires were slashed.

Mandan Rd., 7200 block, 9:07 p.m. April 30. A door was damaged.

These were among incidents reported by Hyattsville Police. For information, call 301-985-5060.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 1599 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by the police departments of Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

Seneca Rd., 14600 block, 5:05 p.m. April 21. A person was assaulted by an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Stonebridge View Dr., 14300 block, 7 to 7:30 p.m. April 19. Property was forcibly taken from a person. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lake Potomac Terr., 12200 block, April 17 to April 19. A residence was entered in an unknown manner, and property was stolen.

VANDALISM

Seven Locks Rd., 11600 block, April 18 to April 19. A graffiti incident at a religious institution was reported.

Seven Locks Rd., 11600 block, April 18 to April 21. A graffiti incident at a school was reported.

DISTRICT 2 BETHESDA STATION301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

Ewell Ave., 10400 block, April 15 or 16. A person was assaulted by an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Connecticut Ave., 7900 block, 1:30 to 2:10 p.m. April 20. Vehicles were forcibly entered. Purses, laptop computers, phones and other items were stolen.

ASSAULTS

Bel Pre Rd., 3700 block, 3:55 p.m. April 17. An assault was reported.

Grandview Ave., 11200 block, 11:44 p.m. April 16. An assault was reported.

Littleton St., 12400 block, 10:34 a.m. April 20. A 26-year-old male was arrested in connection with assault.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

University Blvd. W., 12:29 p.m. April 20. A 26-year-old male was arrested after a sexual assault. The assaulted person was threatened with a weapon.

ROBBERIES

Georgia Ave., 14100 block, 2:12 a.m. April 17. A person was assaulted, and property was stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bakersfield Ct., 14400 block, April 12 to April 20. A residence was entered by force. No property was reported stolen.

Georgia Ave., 15400 block, 11 p.m. April 20. A building was entered by force, and property was stolen.

Georgia Ave., 16800 block, 11:14 p.m. April 20. A building was entered by force. No property was reported stolen.

Inwood Ave., 10900 block, 2:15 a.m. April 21. An elementary school was entered by force. No property was reported stolen.

Milshire Ct., 700 block, April 18 to April 19. A residence was entered forcibly. Property was stolen.

New Hampshire Ave., 13400 block, 1:01 a.m. April 21. A building was forcibly entered. Property was stolen.

Village Mart Dr., 18100 block, 11:32 p.m. April 20. A building was entered by force, and property was stolen.

DISTRICT 5GERMANTOWN STATION240-773-6200

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waters Point Lane , April 16. A person was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Bent Creek Terr. and Brandermill Dr., 10:50 p.m. April 21. A 16-year-old male was arrested in connection with assault and robbery.

Frederick Rd., 20000 block, 10:20 p.m. April 21. An armed robbery was reported.

Briarcliff Terr., 13100 block, 12:50 p.m. April 17. A 58-year-old male was arrested after a person forcibly entered a residence and took property.

Dairymaid Dr., 13100 block, 1:30 p.m. April 14. Two males, 14 and 15, were arrested after items were stolen from a vehicle.

September 15, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1301 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA FUGITIVE INCIDENTS

Rowe Blvd., 200 block, 9:44 a.m. Sept. 1. A 25-year-old man, formerly of Annapolis, being detained on kidnapping, sexual assault and robbery charges, overpowered a guard and fled from a courthouse. Police responding to a report of a man acting suspiciously in the Admiral Heights neighborhood recaptured him before midnight near Dewey and Sumner drives. 

ROBBERIES

Broadneck Rd., 600 block, 9:30 p.m. Sept. 2. Two males attacked two male teenagers walking near a school, then fled with a digital media player. A 16-year-old from Glen Burnie was charged with robbery and second-degree assault.

CROWNSVILLE AREA HIT-AND-RUN INCIDENTS

Generals Hwy., 900 block, 4:51 a.m. Sept. 2. A pedestrian was struck by a vehicle while walking on the shoulder of a roadway. The victim, who said the vehicle was yellow, to crawled to the yard of a residence, then was treated for leg injuries at a hospital. Anyone with information about the incident is asked to call 410-222-6155.

EDGEWATER AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chestnut Rd., 2900 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 4. A woman investigating a noise at home was grabbed from behind. The intruder fled after a struggle through a back door. An Annapolis man, 24, was charged with first-, second-, third- and fourth-degree burglary and second-degree assault.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES

Central Ave., unit block, 3:30 p.m. Sept. 3. A man robbed a store of cash at knifepoint.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Laurel Fort Meade Rd., 3400 block, 9:40 a.m. Sept. 2. A man went behind the counter of a fast-food restaurant and robbed it of cash at gunpoint.

PASADENA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Magothy Beach Rd., unit block, 9:07 a.m. Aug. 18. A credit card that had been lost by a shopper was used to make unauthorized purchases in nearby stores.

SEVERN AREA WEAPONS OFFENSES

Annapolis Rd.,Sept. 1. A Severn man, 39; a Baltimore man, 40; and a Severna Park woman, 40, were arrested after police approached them as they were standing by two vehicles - one of which the police had been following - that had stopped by the side of the road. The Severn man was charged with possession of a firearm (a .22-caliber pistol) while drug trafficking and drug- and drug-paraphernalia possession. The others were charged with drug- and drug-paraphernalia possession.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Atwater Dr., 300 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 5 to 11 a.m. Sept. 6. A cellphone was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Severn Ave., 400 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 3 to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 4. A Mercury outboard motor was stolen from a storage bin entered by forcing a lock.

Truxton Park Rd., 10:30 a.m. Sept. 1 to 11 a.m. Sept. 2. A 27-foot Load Star boat trailer was stolen from a trailer parking lot.

Wells Landing, unit block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 3 to 4 a.m. Sept. 4. A portable generator was stolen from a garage at a residence.

First St., 300 block, 11:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 2. A Yamaha boat motor was stolen from a dinghy.

Second St., 300 block, 9 to 10:15 p.m. Sept. 5. A cellphone and a digital media player were stolen from a vehicle.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Guilford Rd., 8600 block, 11:14 a.m. Sept. 4. Three female teenagers threatened a teenager in a fast-food restaurant, then fled with her watch.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frietchie Row, 6500 block, 2:38 p.m. Sept. 5. A break-in occurred at a vacant residence. Two Columbia men, ages 18 and 19, were charged with fourth-degree burglary.

Kilimanjaro Rd., 9500 block, 11 a.m. Aug. 31 to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 3. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window.

Oakland Mills Rd., 7000 block, 2:51 a.m. Sept. 3. Alcoholic beverages were stolen from a deli entered by breaking a front window.

Oakland Mills Rd., 6900 block, 9:02 a.m. Sept. 3. Bicycles were stolen from a shop entered by breaking a front window. One of the bikes was recovered that same day at Jackson Pond.

Stevens Forest Rd., 5600 block, 10 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Aug. 30. A laptop, a cellphone and a digital media player were stolen from a residence.

Stevens Forest Rd.,5600 block, 7 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Sept. 2. A TV and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Wincopin Cir., 10200 block, 9:49 p.m. Sept. 5. An attempt was made to enter an art gallery by breaking glass in a front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cordage Walk, 10700 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 2 to 4:37 a.m. Sept. 3. A black 2007 Nissan Armada was stolen.

Route 175 and Snowden River Pkwy., 6:47 p.m. Sept. 2. A 2010 Chrysler Sebring was stolen.

Wild Lilac, 5400 block, 10:20 a.m. Sept. 5. A blue Audi A8 was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Race Rd., 6500 block, 9:23 p.m. Sept. 3. A construction-site building was entered by breaking through a fence and removing wood from a rear window.

Railroad Ave., 5600 block, 5:05 a.m. Sept. 2. An attempt was made to enter a residence by tampering with a screen door.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Furrow Ave., 9300 block, 10:45 a.m. Sept. 3 to 2 p.m. Sept. 4. Jewelery, a video game system, games and cash were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

JESSUP AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sharewood Dr., 7700 block, 4 to 7 p.m. Sept. 4. Cash was stolen from a purse in a residence entered through a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Jenmar Rd., 8000 block, 3:06 p.m. Sept. 2. A red 2007 Ford Fusion was stolen.

Riggs Hill Rd., 10600 b lock, 12:47 p.m. Sept. 6. A white 2005 Ford F-250 pickup was stolen.

LAUREL AREA ROBBERIES

Norfolk Ave., 9600 block, 5:43 a.m. Sept. 3. A male wearing a ski mask and gloves robbed a pedestrian of cash at knifepoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Canterbury Riding, 9000 block, 2:40 a.m. Sept. 4. A male entered an occupied residence, then fled empty-handed when confronted.

Canterbury Riding, 9000 block, 5:38 a.m. Sept. 5. An attempt was made to break into a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door. A male fled empty-handed when confronted.

Livery Lane, 9200 block, 1:33 a.m. Sept. 7. A break-in occurred at a storage room. Property was removed, but nothing was reported missing.

WOODSTOCK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enfield Dr., 10800 block, 3:25 p.m. Sept. 6. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1019 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Call 410-222-8050 for information.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587, or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy., 5600 block, 2:45 a.m. Sept. 26. A man met with a woman near Belle Grove Road and Ritchie Highway; they then drove to the above location. The woman was later treated for injuries at a hospital. A man, 30, of no fixed address, was charged with felony and misdemeanor sex offenses, second-degree assault and theft, but was not served with an arrest warrant. An investigation is continuing.

ASSAULTS
 

Ritchie Hwy., 5800 block, 3:37 p.m. Sept. 28. Police responding to a report of a theft at a pharmacy chased a man on foot to a highway median, where the man stabbed himself with a hypodermic needle and threatened a police officer, then ran away. At 4:13 p.m., a male armed with a knife robbed a store in the 5000 block of Ritchie Highway. At about 4:30 p.m., a 37-year-old Baltimore man found hiding in the 4500 block of Ritchie Highway was arrested in connection with both incidents. Charges included first- and second-degree assault, theft and possession of drug paraphernalia.

ROBBERIES

11th Ave. E., 200 block, 5:14 p.m. Sept. 28. A male in a school parking lot pushed a boy from a motorized mini-bike, then fled on the bike. An acquaintance of the victim confronted the male in a wooded area at 5:45 p.m. The male fled on foot and the property was recovered.

CROFTON AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Route 3 S., 1200 block, 1:52 p.m. Sept. 30. A break-in occurred at a restaurant. While attempting to open a safe, a Severna Park man, 43, was detained. Charges included second-degree burglary.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 400 block, 8:42 p.m. Oct. 2. Two men robbed a restaurant and a few customers of cash at gunpoint and knifepoint, then fled with a male accomplice who had been standing lookout. One victim, who was cut during a struggle, was treated at a hospital for injuries that were not life-threatening.

Ritchie Hwy., 6700 block, 2:40 a.m. Oct. 2. A male approached a pedestrian from behind, knocked him to the ground and fled with his wallet. No serious injuries were reported.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. Call 410-280-2583o to anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity.

ROBBERIES

Forest Dr., 1000 block, Sept. 30. A gas station was robbed at gunpoint. On Oct. 1, an Annapolis man, 30, was charged with armed robbery, assault, reckless endangerment, weapons offenses and burglary.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., 300 block, 1 to 9:30 a.m. Oct. 1. A green bicycle was stolen from a carport at a residence.

Americana Dr., 600 block, 11:30 a.m. Sept. 30 to 1 p.m. Oct. 2. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle.

Carver St., 1-99 block, 2:30 to 10 p.m. Oct. 1. Two video game consoles were stolen from an apartment entered by forcing a door.

Copeland St., 1900 block, 6:50 a.m. to 3:40 p.m. Sept. 29. A tin containing cash was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a back door.

Gemini Dr., 1200 block, 2 to 5 p.m. Oct. 2. A red Edge mountain bike and a green boy's bicycle were stolen from the front yard of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Madison St., 1100 block, 12:01 to 2 a.m. Oct. 2. A red 2003 Hyundai Elantra was stolen from a parking lot.

West St., 1100 block, noon Sept. 26 to 10:30 a.m. Sept. 30. A blue 2003 Honda CRV was stolen from a used-car lot.

Howard County

COLUMBIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cedar Lane, 5700 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 30 to 1 a.m. Oct. 1. A TV, a laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass near a door.

Cordage Walk,10700 block, 6:18 p.m. Sept. 30. A break-in occurred.

Cradlerock Way, 7000 block, 7:30 a.m. Sept. 29. An intruder found sleeping in a utility room at a commercial property fled empty-handed when confronted.

Gramercy Pl., 10600 block, 1:31 p.m. Oct. 3. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Thunder Hill Rd., 5600 block, 10:48 p.m. Oct. 1. A vacant residence was entered by forcing a window. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Early April Way, 8900 block, 10:38 a.m. Sept. 30. A white 2007 Dodge Charger was stolen.

Kerry Hill Ct., 7300 block, Sept. 22 to Sept. 30. A black 1999 Honda Civic was stolen.

Millbank Row, 10900 block, 8:19 a.m. Sept. 30. A silver-colored 2001 Lincoln Town Car was stolen.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Edgehill Lane, 8200 block, 10:30 p.m. Sept. 30. Two males wearing bandanas over their faces approached two people near a residence who were unloading items from a vehicle and robbed them of a purse at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Rd., 9400 block, 2 to 3 a.m. Sept. 39. Copper wire was stolen from two trailers at a library. Access to the trailers was gained by cutting through a fence.

Oak Forest Dr., 2100 block, 5:30 to 7:30 p.m. Sept. 29. A residence was entered by breaking a front window. Nothing was reported missing.

Water Wheel Ct., 2700 block, 7:31 p.m. Sept. 29. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door. Two people fled empty-handed when confronted.

LAUREL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Johns Hopkins Rd., 10900 block, 10:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. Sept. 28. A residence was entered by breaking a basement window. Nothing was reported missing.

Second St. N., 10000 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 28 to 6:15 a.m. Sept. 29. A mobile-home sales office was entered by breaking glass in the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

WOODBINE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jennings Chapel Rd., 3300 block, Sept. 7 to Oct. 2. Silverware was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

May 8, 2014 Thursday 12:37 AM EST 


Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 1765 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by the police departments of Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 1614 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by the police departments of Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Arlington Alexandria Crime Watch


SECTION: ALEXANDRIA - ARLINGTON EXTRA; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 767 words


The following were among crime reports received recently from the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

SEMINARY RD., 4600 block, Sept. 9 to Jan. 8. A man allegedly sexually assaulted a 13-year-old boy at a school. A District man, 42, was arrested and charged with aggravated sexual battery.  

ROBBERIES

BEAUREGARD ST. N., 1400 block, 12:58 to 1:09 p.m. Jan. 21. A man grabbed a man, 43, who was walking toward a bank, and robbed him of a deposit bag.

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 3800 block, 11:30 to 11:55 a.m. Jan. 17. Two males robbed a check-cashing business of cash at gunpoint.

ST. ASAPH ST. N., 600 block, 11:35 to 11:42 p.m. Jan. 17. Two males robbed a video store of cash.

WASHINGTON ST. N., 600 block, 10:03 p.m. Jan. 17. A male approached a 24-year-old female motorist at a drive-through ATM and robbed her of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CAMERON ST., 1500 block, 11:19 p.m. Jan. 18. A TV was stolen from a classroom trailer entered by forcing open a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ARMISTEAD ST. N., 400 block, 7:45 p.m. Jan. 21 to 5:20 p.m. Jan. 22. A green 1995 Dodge Spirit was stolen.

BURGESS AVE., 200 block, 9:30 p.m. Jan. 18 to 2:30 p.m. Jan. 19. A dark green 1994 Jeep Grand Cherokee was stolen.

EARL ST., 400 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 20 to 8 a.m. Jan. 21. A black 1985 Jeep Wagoneer was stolen.

FLORENCE DR., 3800 block, 7 to 7:05 a.m. Jan. 18. A red 1990 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

HUME AVE., 100 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 18 to 2:30 p.m. Jan. 19. A black 1990 Toyota 4-Runner was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3500 block, 9:50 p.m. Jan. 18 to 12:10 p.m. Jan. 19. A tan 1997 Nissan Altima was stolen.

QUANTRELL AVE., 5800 block, 1:30 to 3:30 p.m. Jan. 20. A gray 1991 Toyota Camry was stolen.

READING AVE., 5700 block, 11 to 11:02 p.m. Jan. 18. A blue 2002 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

The following were among crime reports received recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Arlington County Crime Solvers, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 703-522-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

ROBBERIES

IVES ST. S., 2000 block, 2:20 p.m. Jan. 21. A male got out of a dark red car, knocked a female pedestrian, 70, down and took her purse. The robber fled in the car with another male.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLARENDON BLVD. N., 2300 block, 6 p.m. Jan. 17 to 8 a.m. Jan. 20. An unsuccessful attempt was made to enter an office suite by forcing open a rear door.

CLARENDON BLVD., 2300 block, 5:30 p.m. Jan. 21 to 6 a.m. Jan. 22. An unsuccessful attempt was made to enter an office suite by prying open doors.

FLORIDA ST. N., 3000 block, 1 to 3 p.m. Jan. 17. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by kicking open a basement door.

GEORGE MASON DR. N., 200 block, 9:30 a.m. to 7:50 p.m. Jan. 21. Ten Persian rugs, a TV, a DVD player and a microwave oven were stolen from a residence entered through an open window.

GLEBE RD. S., 2900 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 16 to 8:10 a.m. Jan. 17. Cash was stolen from a desk drawer at an office.

GLEBE RD. S., 2900 block, 11 p.m. Jan. 21 to 5 a.m. Jan. 22. Cash was stolen from a business.

GRANT ST. S., 2700 block, 4:30 to 5:15 p.m. Jan. 20. A TV was stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

OLD DOMINION DR. N., 5200 block, 1 to 2:45 p.m. Jan. 17. Costume jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

PERSHING DR. N., 4300 block, 7:45 a.m. to 6:10 p.m. Jan. 22. A baking pan and a phone book were stolen from an apartment.

QUINCY ST. N., 800 block, 12:30 p.m. Jan. 18 to 8 a.m. Jan. 21. Three laptop computers were stolen from an office.

THOMAS ST. N., 3300 block, 9 a.m. Jan. 17 to 8 p.m. Jan. 19. A residence was entered. Two open cans of soda and clothing were left behind.

16TH RD. S., 2800 block, 9:30 p.m. Jan. 15 to 11:45 p.m. Jan. 17. A Sony Playstation II video-game system and a DVD were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CLEVELAND ST. N., 2000 block. A gold 1985 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

EADS ST. S., 2800 block. A white 1998 Mercury Grand Marquis was stolen.

HENDERSON RD., 4400 block. A green 1999 Dodge was stolen.

SECTION: Metro; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 618 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFT/BREAK-IN

Placid Lake Ct., 8600 block, 5 p.m. Dec. 5 to 2:30 p.m. Dec. 6. Cash, a handgun and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Anchorage Cove, 3600 block, 8 to 9 a.m. Dec. 3. Tools and building supplies were stolen from a vacant residence.

Main St., 17700 block, 9 a.m. Dec. 1 to 9 a.m. Dec. 3. A TV was stolen from a building.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Liberia Ave., 9700 block, Nov. 10. A physician at a medical facility allegedly sexually assaulted a male patient. A 35-year-old Oakton man was arrested.

ROBBERY

Shoppers Sq., 8200 block, 10:15 p.m. Dec. 4. Three men pushed a male pedestrian against a fence, and he was hit with a gun and robbed of a wallet.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Somerset Lane, 7600 block, 10:03 p.m. Dec. 3. A man knocked on a front door of a residence, then attempted to forcibly enter when a male occupant answered. The man damaged the front door and broke a window. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULT

Ridge View Ct.,3200 block, 2:40 p.m. Dec. 7. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance, hitting her repeatedly with a metal rod. The woman was taken to a hospital. A 52-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Blue Pool Dr. and Hildas Way area, Dec. 1. A male sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 16-year-old Woodbridge boy was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Divided Sky Ct., 4200 block, 8:10 p.m. Dec. 5. Two males assaulted a male juvenile and robbed him of marijuana and a cellphone.

Old Bridge Rd., 3000 block, 5:45 p.m. Dec. 5. A male juvenile robbed a female juvenile pedestrian of a cellphone.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 6:30 p.m. Dec. 8. A man attempted to take a pair of shoes from a store. When an employee attempted to stop him, he assaulted the employee.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14600 block, 2:13 p.m. Dec. 7. A man implying he had a weapon robbed a hotel of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

California St., 1400 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 5 to 3:15 p.m. Dec. 6. Cash and several watches were stolen from a residence entered by pushing an air conditioner through a bedroom window.

Emberdale Dr., 14800 block, 10:23 p.m. Dec. 6. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a rear door.

Telegraph Rd., 13300 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 2 to 8 a.m. Dec. 3. Copper and electrical wires, catalytic converters and aluminum wheels were stolen from a business entered by prying a door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERY

Ashton Ave., 8900 block, 8:15 p.m. Dec. 9. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 4:06 p.m. Nov. 23 to 8 p.m. Dec. 1. Cash was stolen from a vending machine.

Owens Ct.,2:33 p.m. Dec. 4. A leaf blower was stolen from a vehicle.

Venture Ct., 12:16 p.m. Dec. 4. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Mathis Ave., 8500 block, 1:23 p.m. Dec. 1. Graffiti was spray-painted on the rear walls of a shopping center.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Bull Run Regional Park area, Nov. 11. A 41-year-old Manassas man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a juvenile. 

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8000 block, 1:15 a.m. Nov. 16. A gunman robbed a convenience store.

Sudley Rd., 8500 block, 4:42 p.m. Nov. 13. A man passed a threatening note to a bank teller. A 43-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cass Pl., 7600 block, 2 to 3 p.m. Nov. 13. A video game system was stolen from a residence entered through the unlocked front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd. and Minnieville Rd. area, Nov. 18. A 30-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of two juveniles in September.

ASSAULTS

Gordon Blvd., 13300 block, 9:20 a.m. Nov. 18. A man entered a motel room, then closed the door and grabbed an employee. When she resisted, the man fled.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 8:27 a.m. Nov. 17. A man in a motel parking lot grabbed a pedestrian by the shoulder. When she resisted, he fled.

ROBBERIES

Annapolis Way, 1200 block, 2:45 p.m. Nov. 16. A man robbed a gas station at gunpoint. A 50-year-old man was arrested.

Turnbuckley Lane, 2200 block, 7:22 p.m. Nov. 14. During a transaction that had been arranged online, two people grabbed two pairs of sneakers from a man. After a struggle, the two fled with the shoes. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayside Ave., 1200 block, 8 a.m. to 7:50 p.m. Nov. 15. A break-in occurred at a residence. A laptop computer was damaged; nothing was reported missing.

Constellation Pl., 1500 block, 1 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 13. A laptop computer and a video game system were among property stolen from a residence.

Eaton Ct., 4500 block, 10 a.m. to 7:25 p.m. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement window.

Fitzhugh Lane, 13500 block, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 14. A TV was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Miranda Lane, 16800 block, 8 a.m. to 5:20 p.m. Nov. 14. Several laptop computers, a TV and a tablet computer were among property were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Parliament Dr., 11800 block, 7:45 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nov. 13. A TV, a computer, a DVD player and a printer were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Princedale Dr., 13400 block, 6:55 to 11:30 a.m. Nov. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Spriggs and Minnieville roads, 6 p.m. Nov. 9 to 6 a.m. Nov. 14. Copper wire and several ladders were stolen from a building under construction that was entered by forcing a rear door.

Springbrook Ct., 14300 block, 7:26 p.m. Nov. 14. Cash, a camera, a cellphone and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Vale Ct., 3400 block, noon to 6 p.m. Nov. 12. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Westminster Lane, 14300 block, 12:01 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 14. Jewelry was among property stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Yosocomico Lane, 2700 block, 9 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. Nov. 14. A laptop computer was among property stolen from a residence entered through the unlocked front door.

Manassas

No report was received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No report was received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report Among incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245. 

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Whisperwood Ct., 14400 block, 3:22 p.m. Nov. 22. Two males forcibly entered a residence, assaulted a male juvenile resident and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Cass Pl., 7600 block, Nov. 16. A man propositioned a female juvenile acquaintance for sex. The girl refused. A 35-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Meadow Ct., 7900 block, November. A man raped a female juvenile acquaintance on two occasions. A 30-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Somersworth Dr., 8500 block, 4:08 a.m. Nov. 26. A man forcibly entered a residence and stabbed a male acquaintance. The victim was treated for injuries.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Forestdale Ave., 3500 block, 2:47 p.m. Nov. 25. Four males attempted to fight a male juvenile at his residence. One of the males cut the juvenile several times. The juvenile was treated for injuries.

ROBBERIES

Old Delaney Rd. and Quate Lane, 3:46 p.m. Nov. 22. A male took a cellphone from a male juvenile and drove away with two other males.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Millwood Dr., 13400 block, 7:26 p.m. Nov. 23. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window.

Robin Glen Way, 14600 block, 9:22 a.m. to 7:35 p.m. Nov. 19. A laptop computer, a tablet computer, a TV and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by the police departments of Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

The Washington Post


March 22, 2012 Thursday  
Every Edition


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 1440 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

CHILD ENDANGERMENT INCIDENTS

Sapphire Ridge Pl., 13200 block, 12:42 p.m. March 8. A 3-month-old infant was pronounced dead at a hospital shortly after the child was found unresponsive and transported from an unlicensed day-care center operating out of a residence. The adults at the facility, a 50-year-old Manassas woman and a 42-year-old Woodbridge woman, were arrested. Of the 23 children at the center, at least five were younger than 12 months old. The women were each charged with five counts of child endangerment. The owner of the residence was out of the country.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wright Lane, 12000 block, 5:45 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. March 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Edgehill Dr., 15300 block, noon Feb. 25 to 5 p.m. March 9. A bicycle was stolen from a residence entered through a garage. 

Fisherman's Cove, 4700 block, 1:09 p.m. March 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a basement door. An occupant, alerted by a dog, saw a man walk away from the premises empty-handed.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lynn Forest Dr., 4400 block, 8:45 a.m. to 2:15 p.m. March 13. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Barron Park area, March 12. A man attacked a juvenile female acquaintance at his residence. A 22-year-old man was charged with sexual assault.

ASSAULTS

Rokeby Rd., 7400 block, 9:54 p.m. March 8. During an argument, a man at a residence kicked a female acquaintance several times in the stomach and back. The woman was treated for injuries at a hospital. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lafayette Ave., 9400 block, 9 p.m. March 12 to 4 a.m. March 13. A jacket containing a wallet was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Outback Ct., 7500 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 13. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

Patterson Lane, 9400 block, 8 a.m. March 8 to 5:30 p.m. March 9. An attempt was made to break into a residence by tampering with a window and the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Silo Mill Ct., 7700 block, 6 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. March 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Somerset Lane, 7600 block, 2 to 7:58 p.m. March 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

TRIANGLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Triangle, March 14. A 41-year-old Triangle man who is incarcerated on unrelated charges at the Rappahannock Regional Jail was charged in the sexual assault and aggravated sexual battery of a juvenile from 1996 to 2001.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 3:07 a.m. March 13. An apartment-rental office was entered by breaking a side window. Nothing was reported missing.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Colchester Rd., 1400 block, 10:13 p.m. March 10. During an argument, four people attacked a male acquaintance, who was later treated for a broken nose and other injuries. Two Woodbridge men, ages 19 and 20, a 24-year-old Triangle man, and a 20-year-old Triangle woman were arrested.

Lamar Rd., 14400 block, 9:38 p.m. March 9. During a dispute at a residence, a man grabbed a kitchen knife, chased a 17-year-old acquaintance from the premises and stabbed the victim once in the arm when he fell. The victim broke free. The assailant returned to the residence, where he threw a brick at a departing vehicle, causing $500 damage. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man is being sought on charges of malicious wounding, throwing missiles at an occupied vehicle and destruction of property. The stabbing victim received treatment at the scene for a minor injury.

Luca Station Way and Old Bridge Rd., 2:57 a.m. March 10. A woman, who had been arguing with another woman, jumped on a vehicle when she tried to drive away from a residence, then fell to the ground when the motorist slammed on the brakes. She was taken to a hospital, where she was treated for non life-threatening injuries. A 24-year-old Lorton woman was charged with malicious wounding and with driving while intoxicated.

Penshurst Lane, 3900 block, March 2. Responding to a report of a 3-month-old infant being treated for severe trauma to the head and body, police arrested a 30-year-old Woodbridge man, who shook the child on at least two occasions. He was charged with two counts of malicious wounding and two counts of felony child abuse.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14500 block, 2:41 p.m. March 9. During an argument in a vehicle, a motorist pulled into a parking lot, then threatened a female passenger at gunpoint. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. No injuries were reported.

Yosocomico Lane, 2700 block, 10:52 p.m. March 11. During an argument, a male struck a female acquaintance in the face. A 16-year-old from Woodbridge was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Build America Dr., 14800 block, 7:30 p.m. March 8. A man robbed a grocery store of cash at gunpoint.

Dale Blvd., 4300 block, 8:49 a.m. March 12. A man robbed an employee of a business at gunpoint.

Dillingham Sq., 12500 block, 9:32 p.m. March 10. A man robbed a restaurant of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cotton Mill Rd., 11900 block, 9:45 a.m. March 7. A laptop, a video camera, a DVD player, a tablet PC and a video game system were among property stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window. A 17-year-old male was arrested.

Cottonwood Ct., 1400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 12:45 p.m. March 8. Two safes and cash were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a door.

Darlington Loop, 2000 block, 8:13 a.m. March 9. An attempt was made to break into an occupied residence. A man fled empty-handed when confronted.

Gableridge Turn, 1800 block, 3:15 a.m. March 11. Three males, who were asked to leave a party at a residence, returned a short time later and kicked in a balcony door and a front door, then tried to fight with people inside. No injuries were reported.

Geddy Ct., 16600 block, 2 to 4:45 p.m. March 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a front door.

Harbor Dr., 12800 block, 4:59 p.m. March 9. A handgun was stolen from a vehicle at a carwash. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Packard Dr., 13300 block, 10 to 10:15 p.m. March 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

Tassia Lane, 15700 block, 11:04 p.m. March 12. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by breaking a window. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dumfries Rd., 10100 block, 9:45 p.m. March 12. Responding to a report of suspicious activity in a vehicle, police arrested a 29-year-old Manassas man. Charges included taking indecent liberties as a custodian, embezzlement and unlawful possession of vehicle-inspection decals.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bonham Cir., 8900 block, 12:01 to 9 a.m. March 5. A tire was stolen from a vehicle.

Center St., 9300 block, Feb. 1 to Feb. 14. Three brass staircase-post fixtures were stolen from a residence.

Magnolia Grove Rd., 10200 block, 6:30 p.m. March 12. A residence was entered through a basement door. A male was seen fleeing the area empty-handed.

Riverdale Pl., 9600 block, March 4 to March 5. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

April 24, 2003 Thursday  
Final Edition


Alexandria Arlington Crime Watch


SECTION: ALEXANDRIA - ARLINGTON EXTRA; Pg. T01


LENGTH: 1496 words


The following were among crime reports received recently from the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

ROBBERIES

STEVENSON SQ., 200 block, 9:50 to 10 p.m. April 13. A man in a parking lot grabbed a purse from a woman, 60, and fled.

WILKES ST., 400 block, 8 to 8:55 p.m. April 13. A disoriented woman found bleeding near a house had been assaulted and robbed. She was treated for a head injury at a hospital. The case was under investigation.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LOMACK CT., 6000 block, noon April 5 to 4 p.m. April 13. Power tools were stolen from an unlocked storage shed.

MONROE AVE. E., 200 block, 9:50 a.m. to 4:56 p.m. April 11. Electronic equipment was stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a door.

SEMINARY RD., 4600 block, 4 a.m. April 14. Computer equipment was stolen from a school entered by breaking a window. Two male Woodbridge residents, ages 19 and 16, were arrested and charged with burglary.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

FAIRFAX ST. N., 900 block, 11 p.m. April 9 to 7:10 a.m. April 10. A maroon 1993 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

LARCHMONT AVE., 3400 block, 1 to 11 a.m. April 13. A teal 1994 Honda Accord was stolen.

WASHINGTON ST. S., 1100 block, noon April 12 to 4 p.m. April 13. A white and blue 1999 Yamaha 350XT motorcycle was stolen.

WASHINGTON ST. S., 1200 block, 7 p.m. April 5 to 6 p.m. April 12. A white 2000 Yamaha jet ski was stolen.

The following were among crime reports received recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Arlington County Crime Solvers, a nonprofit organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 703-522-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COLUMBIA PIKE, 4900 block, 5:55 a.m. April 14. A male was dragging a woman, 32, into a wooded area by a bike trail when a police officer heard the woman screaming and confronted the assailant, who fled. The assailant was stopped by a canine officer. A 17-year-old male was arrested and charged with abduction with intent to defile and attempted sexual assault. 

FAIRFAX DR. N., 5500 block, 7 p.m. April 14. A man grabbed a 23-year-old female jogger's groin, then fled.

ASSAULTS

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4400 block, 9:40 p.m. April 3. Four men forcibly entered a residence, and a male occupant, 41, was hit on the head with a handgun, and a woman, 38, was hit with the butt of a rifle. The male victim opened the front door, and the assailants fled. Nothing was reported missing..

ROBBERIES

ADAMS ST. S., 600 block, 11:50 p.m. April 12. A male assaulted a male pedestrian, 70, knocked him down and robbed him of a wallet.

CHESTERFIELD RD. S., 5000 block, 1:05 a.m. April 4. Three men demanded money from a man, 38, who had just parked his vehicle. The victim ran to an apartment building. The robbers chased him, knocked him to the ground and took cash and a cell phone.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 3700 block, 12:40 a.m. April 7. A male, accompanied by three other males, took a wallet from a 30-year-old man's pocket as he was leaving a restaurant, then knocked him down. The other three kicked the victim while the first man took cash from the wallet.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5200 block, 9:35 p.m. April 9. A male juvenile, accompanied by three other male juveniles, mumbled something to a female motorist, 27, about her purse at a gas station. She said she had nothing. The four males walked around the woman's vehicle, then asked for her purse. When she again said she had nothing, the four walked away.

FERN ST. S., 1200 block, 7:20 p.m. April 5. Two men in an alley demanded a purse from a female pedestrian, 23, threatening to hit her with a metal pipe. When she gave them her purse, they demanded her cell phone and pushed her to the ground when she hesitated.

FERN ST. S., 2200 block, 12:13 a.m. April 5. A gunman robbed a male, 26, of a wallet.

GLEBE RD. N., 300 block, 10 p.m. April 3. A male in a parking lot approached a male, 28, who got into his car and locked the door. The male pulled out a knife and ordered the motorist to open the door. The victim drove away.

LEE HWY. N., 4500 block, 11:35 p.m. April 11. A man entered a store and asked a clerk for change. When the clerk opened a cash register, the robber grabbed cash, struggled with the clerk, then fled with cash.

OLD DOMINION DR. N., 4700 block, 1:45 a.m. April 15. Two men robbed two male pedestrians, ages 18 and 19, at gunpoint of wallets.

EIGHTH RD. S., 5200 block, 9:06 p.m. April 8. Two men demanded money from a male, 53, who was entering the lobby of his apartment building. After the victim gave them cash, one of the robbers hit him in the face and fled with the other man and a third male.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLARK ST. S., 2600 block, 7:30 p.m. April 8 to 9:45 a.m. April 9. Cash was stolen from an office entered by forcing open a sliding window.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 1800 block, 7:40 a.m. to 7:20 p.m. April 3. A residence was entered by prying open a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 5100 block, 11:55 p.m. March 29 to 5 p.m. March 30. Two Motorola two-way radios and chargers, keys and two pairs of hedge clippers were stolen from a condominium office.

MEADE ST. N., 1200 block, 7:45 a.m. to 6:25 p.m. April 3. A portable stereo was stolen from a residence.

PERSHING DR. N., 4300 block, 7:50 p.m. April 6. A man was attempting to remove a stereo from a vehicle when the owners of the vehicle, a man and a woman, both 25, confronted him. The robber ran and the man chased him to a vehicle, which the robber entered. When the victim jumped onto the hood, the driver accelerated then stopped, throwing the victim to the ground. The driver accelerated again, ran over the man and fled. The victim was transported to a hospital.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 3000 block, 11:45 p.m. April 15. An intruder entered an apartment by forcing a window, then fled empty-handed when confronted by a resident.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 3000 block, 11 p.m. April 12 to 3:40 a.m. April 13. Keys were stolen from an apartment entered by forcing a side window.

SPOUT RUN PKWY., 3000 block, 6:30 p.m. April 9 to 8 a.m. April 14. Jewelry and silverware were stolen from an apartment.

WASHINGTON BLVD. N., 2700 block, 5:30 p.m. April 3 to 10:40 a.m. April 4. A business was entered by breaking a window. Nothing was reported missing.

WASHINGTON BLVD. N., 2700 block, 6:30 p.m. April 9 to 2 p.m. April 10. A business was entered by breaking a window. Nothing was reported missing.

11TH ST. N., 2300 block, 6 p.m. April 5 to 5 p.m. April 7. An unsuccessful attempt was made to enter a residence by tampering with a window.

11TH ST. N., 2300 block, 8 p.m. April 9 to 6 a.m. April 10. An unsuccessful attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing open a locked door.

11TH ST. N., 2300 block, 6 to 7:30 p.m. April 12. An unsuccessful attempt was made to enter an apartment by prying a screen of an open window.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 3800 block, 1 p.m. April 3. A man standing on a sidewalk exposed himself to a female motorist, 42.

GRANT ST. S., 1800 block, 5 p.m. April 2. A man in a vehicle asked two female juveniles for directions. As they approached the vehicle, one of the girls noticed that the man was masturbating and pulled the other girl away. The man drove away.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 2700 block, 11:50 p.m. April 13. A man sat next to a woman, 33, in a movie theater and exposed himself. The woman left the theater and called police. A Woodbridge man, 63, was arrested and charged with indecent exposure.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BARTON ST. S., 1600 block. A black 1998 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

BUCHANAN ST. S., 900 block. A blue 1996 Honda Accord was stolen.

CARLIN SPRINGS RD. S., 800 block. A blue Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2000 block. A blue and white 1996 Suzuki GSXR motorcycle was stolen.

GLEBE RD. S., 300 block. A blue 1989 GMC Suburban was stolen.

GLEBE RD. S., 2400 block. A blue 1994 Ford Crown Victoria was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2600 block. A gold 2003 Dodge Neon was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 2900 block. A gold 2003 Dodge Intrepid was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 2900 block. A gold 2003 Dodge Neon was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 2900 block. A white 2003 Dodge Stratus was stolen.

TROY ST. N., 1700 block. A burgundy 1995 Honda Accord was stolen.

WAKEFIELD ST. S., 900 block. A silver 1995 Honda Accord was stolen.

WALTER REED DR. S., 600 block. A green 1994 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

WOODSTOCK ST. S., 2900 block. A blue 2002 Yamaha YZF RI motorcycle was stolen.

EIGHTH RD. S., 5100 block. A green 1993 Mitsubishi Eclipse was stolen.

NINTH ST. S., 2300 block. A black 1999 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

13TH ST. S., 3600 block. A tan 1994 Honda Accord was stolen.

16TH ST. S., 4300 block. A green 1993 Honda Civic was stolen.

18TH ST. S., 800 block. A silver 1996 Honda Accord was stolen.

36TH ST. S., 4600 block. A red 1994 Dodge Caravan was stolen.
