Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 755 words


Anne Arundel County

No report was available from Anne Arundel County police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Duke of Gloucester St. area,2:15 a.m. April 25. A man attempted to rape a woman he had met that evening. A Severn man, 23, was charged with attempted rape, assault, reckless endangerment and false imprisonment.

ASSAULTS

Cornhill St.,12:01 a.m. April 28. During an argument, a man pointed a rifle at an acquaintance. An Annapolis man, 29, was charged with first-degree assault, reckless endangerment and use of a firearm in a violent crime.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Admiral Dr.,200 block, 8 a.m. to 11:20 p.m. April 27. Electronics were stolen from a home.

Carrollton Ave.,900 block, 5 p.m. April 24. A bicycle was stolen.

Hilltop Lane,300 block, 3 to 9 a.m. April 17. A vehicle was entered; nothing was reported stolen.

Tyler Ave.,700 block, 10 p.m. April 22 to 7 a.m. April 23. Cash and a parking pass were stolen from a vehicle.

Tyler Ave.,800 block, 8 p.m. April 22 to 9:20 a.m. April 23. Two vehicles were entered; nothing was reported stolen.

Vincent St.,1900 block, 5 p.m. April 21 to 8:30 a.m. April 22. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

Warren Dr.,700 block, 8:45 p.m. April 22 to 1:30 p.m. April 23. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle.

Marcs Ct.,3 a.m. April 25. A shot was fired.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ18


LENGTH: 1721 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received complete reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRAEMAR CRESCENT WAY, 14800 block, July 17 or July 18. Property was stolen from an open garage and from two unlocked vehicles.

FALCONBRIDGE TERR., 12400 block, July 19 or July 20. Property was stolen from an open garage and from a vehicle in the garage. 

GREENBRIAR RD., 12700 block, July 21 or July 22. A residence was entered through an unlocked basement door. Nothing was reported missing.

GREENBRIAR RD., 12700 block, July 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MIDWAY AVE., 13200 block, 2 to 3:30 p.m. July 24. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 800 block, 3:30 to 4:30 p.m. July 22. Property was stolen from a gas station entered by force.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

INDECENT EXPOSURE

EDSON LANE AND WOODGLEN DRIVE, 1:45 p.m. July 22. A man on a bench near a trail fondled himself and was seen by a woman walking her dog along the trail. The woman left the area and asked another person to contact police. The man fled before police arrived.

ROBBERIES

BROOKDALE ROAD AND COOPER LANE, 11:30 p.m. July 22. Two males accosted a female pedestrian walking home from a Metro station. Both grabbed at her belongings and when she tried to hold on to them, one of the males pulled out a silver handgun. They snatched the property from her hands and fled in a white "police style" older-model sedan.

16TH ST., 8500 block, 6:30 p.m. July 21. Two males, one of them with tattoos on both arms, in a market demanded cash and grabbed a cash box. A person in the market contacted police, and the robbers fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

EAST WEST HWY., 4400 block, July 20 or July 21. Cash was stolen from a custom tailor and dressmaking business entered by prying open a front door.

EAST WEST HWY., 4400 block, July 20 to July 23. Property was stolen from the inner office of a psychotherapist.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

FENTON ST., 8400 block, 11 p.m. July 14. A male at a bus stop asked a female if he could use her cellphone. She complied, then had to chase him down to retrieve her phone. The male then sexually assaulted her and fled.

ROBBERIES

CEDAR TREE AND SCARLET SAGE DRIVES, 11:30 p.m. July 13. Three males assaulted a male and took his property.

FEBRUARY CIR., 11500 block, 12:15 a.m. July 10. Three males assaulted a male with an unidentified weapon and took his property.

FIDLER LANE, 1100 block, 10:30 p.m. July 13. Two men in an elevator assaulted a person, took property and fled.

OUTLET DR., 13800 block, 10:23 p.m. July 17. A group of about five males threatened a boy, 13, took his property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BIG HORN DR., 12900 block, midnight to 6 p.m. July 10. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

BIG HORN DR., 12900 block, 9:15 a.m. to 6:40 p.m. July 13. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

BRUTON PARISH WAY, 3500 block, 6 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. July 12. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

CAMERON ST., 8700 block, 9:35 p.m. July 13. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CAMERON ST., 8700 block, 6 to 11:30 p.m. July 13. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GIST AVE., 900 block, 3:16 a.m. July 13. Property was stolen from a business entered by force.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 12000 block, 3:25 a.m. July 13. Property was stolen from a dental office entered by force.

SCHINDLER DR., 900 block, 10:30 p.m. July 13. Property was stolen from a middle school. Three males were arrested and charged with commercial burglary.

SHEPPERTON TERR., 2900 block, 10 a.m. to 4:20 p.m. July 16. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

STRAUSS TERR., 2900 block, 7:45 a.m. to 6:45 p.m. July 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

STRAUSS TERR., 2900 block, 3 p.m. July 11. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

TREETOP LANE, 1900 block, 11:18 a.m. July 11. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

District 4 Wheaton Station Telephone: 240-773-5500

INDECENT EXPOSURE

ELKIN ST., 11600 block, 7:30 a.m. July 17. A girl, 15, noticed a person standing outside her window, looked out and saw a man fondling himself. At 1:07 a.m. on June 25, the same girl reported a male knocking on her bedroom window. She did not know if the same male was involved in both incidents.

ROBBERIES

RANDOLPH RD., 2500 block, 10 p.m. July 16. A man pulled out a weapon and demanded property.

SANDY SPRING RD., 2900 block, 10:34 p.m. July 10. Three males accosted a person on a basketball court behind a church with an unknown weapon, took property and fled.

VALLEYWOOD DRIVE AND ANDREW STREET, 7:55 p.m. July 15. A heavyset gunman stole property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CARMODY DR., 1900 block, 11:30 p.m. July 12. A man on a stepladder attempted to break into a residence through a bedroom window. He fled on foot when a resident arrived.

GALVEZ ST., 13300 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. July 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

TEABERRY RD., 12700 block, 8:15 to 11:39 a.m. July 11. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

ZION RD., 19900 block, 7:30 a.m. to 6:05 p.m. July 13. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

District 5 Germantown Station Telephone: 301-840-2650

INDECENT EXPOSURE

GREAT SENECA HIGHWAY AND WISTERIA DRIVE, 8:35 a.m. July 17. A male followed a woman who was jogging, passed her and went down a foot path. When the woman jogged by the path, she saw the man was nude and fondling himself.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HALETHORPE LANE, 20200 block, July 20 to July 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MUSTARD SEED CT., 18600 block, noon to 3:30 p.m. July 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

ASSAULTS

MONTGOMERY VILLAGE AVENUE AND INTERSTATE 270, 6 p.m. July 22. During a road-rage incident, one of two bald men with goatees in a red Ford Escort pulled out a small black revolver and pointed it at the driver of another car. The men sped off in the Escort, which had West Virginia license plates.

ROBBERIES

AMITY DRIVE N. AND WASHINGTON GROVE LANE, 1:25 a.m. July 22. A group of about four males robbed a youth at gunpoint of his property and fled in a newer-model red four-door vehicle.

GIRARD ST., 500 block, 5:40 p.m. July 18. Two men assaulted and robbed a man and fled on foot.

LOST KNIFE CIR., 18400 block, 11 p.m. July 19. Two men assaulted a man, demanded his property and fled.

ROTHBURY DR., 9100 block, 10 p.m. July 21. Four males and a female assaulted a man and took his property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FREDERICK AVE. S., 16500 block, noon July 18. Two women in a retail store told a person they had won the lottery but were unable to cash the ticket because they were not U.S. citizens. The person gave them "good faith" money and was given shredded paper in return.

MEDICAL CENTER DR., 9700 block, 11 a.m. July 20. One of three males in an elevator pretended to get his arm stuck in the elevator door, and someone in the group stole a wallet from an elderly man.

VILLAGE AVE. E., 8800 block, 2 a.m. July 18. Property was stolen from a community center entered by force. Four males were seen running from the center.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

EXPLOSIVES ARRESTS

ROSE PETAL WAY, 1 to 100 block, 12:03 a.m. July 24. Two Rockville men, both 19, and a Potomac man, 18, were arrested and charged with possession of explosive materials with intent to create a destructive device following a traffic stop. One of the Rockville men was also issued a citation for possession of alcohol.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

AVERY RD., 14500 block, 9 a.m. July 21 to 5:30 a.m. July 22. Golf flags were stolen from a golf course.

BEALL AVE., 400 block, noon to 1 p.m. July 23. Cash was stolen from a classroom.

EDMONTON DR. W., 1 to 100 block, 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. July 24. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

GLENORA LANE, 11:30 p.m. July 28 to 10:30 a.m. July 29. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

JEFFERSON ST. E., 600 block, noon July 12 to 9 a.m. July 19. A laptop computer was stolen from an office.

LINCOLN ST., 600 block, 12:30 to 2:56 a.m. July 29. Two wallets, a cellphone and a car key were stolen from a residence.

MIDWAY AVE., 13200 block, 2 to 3:30 p.m. July 24. A laptop computer and a video game console were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

NEAL DR., 900 block, 1:30 p.m. July 27 to 12:19 p.m. July 29. A chop saw was stolen from a construction site.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 200 block, noon to 5 p.m. July 23. A wallet and a bus pass were stolen from an office.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 700 block, 12:01 a.m. to 8 a.m. 700 block, a CD player, an amplifier, a set of speakers, a speaker box and a wiring harness from a digital music player were stolen from a vehicle.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 800 block, 3:58 p.m. July 22. A business was entered through a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ASSAULTS

MAPLE AVE., 7500 block, 8:45 p.m. Aug. 1. A man was arrested on an open warrant and charged with first- and second-degree assault and false imprisonment in connection with a June 24 domestic assault at the 600 block of Houston Ct.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 1300 block, 12:49 p.m. Aug. 2. A theft occurred. A man was arrested and charged with theft under $500.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

WILLOW AVE., 7200 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 1 to 7 a.m. Aug. 2. A 1990 Honda Civic was stolen.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 602 words


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.  

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Whisperwood Ct., 14400 block, 3:22 p.m. Nov. 22. Two males forcibly entered a residence, assaulted a male juvenile resident and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Point Pleasant Lane, 16900 block, 11:15 to 11:27 a.m. Nov. 20. Several firearms were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tarleton Ct., 13800 block, noon Nov. 17 to 10 a.m. Nov. 24. A bag was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Cass Pl., 7600 block, Nov. 16. A man propositioned a female juvenile acquaintance for sex. The girl refused. A 35-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Meadow Ct., 7900 block, November. A man raped a female juvenile acquaintance on two occasions. A 30-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Somersworth Dr., 8500 block, 4:08 a.m. Nov. 26. A man forcibly entered a residence and stabbed a male acquaintance. The victim was treated for injuries.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULTS

Bradys Hill Rd., 4000 block, 8:26 p.m. Nov. 23. A man entered a residence and pulled a handgun on a female acquaintance. A 60-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Forestdale Ave., 3500 block, 2:47 p.m. Nov. 25. Four males attempted to fight a male juvenile at his residence. One of the males cut the juvenile several times. The juvenile was treated for injuries.

ROBBERIES

Old Delaney Rd. and Quate Lane, 3:46 p.m. Nov. 22. A male took a cellphone from a male juvenile and drove away with two other males.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 19 to 9:40 a.m. Nov. 20. A laptop computer and other items were stolen from a business entered by forcing a door.

Millwood Dr., 13400 block, 7:26 p.m. Nov. 23. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window.

Robin Glen Way, 14600 block, 9:22 a.m. to 7:35 p.m. Nov. 19. A laptop computer, a tablet computer, a TV and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

O'Connell Ct., 10300 block, 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. Nov. 20. A handgun and electronics were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Liberia Ave., 9000 block, 7 a.m. Nov. 15 to 9:45 a.m. Nov. 16. A black 2013 Nissan Leaf was stolen from a dealership.

Mathis Ave., 8900 block, Nov. 19 to 3 a.m. Nov. 20. A lavender 1997 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 873 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Naughton Ct., 10000 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Oct. 12. A residence was entered by breaking a basement window. A Nokesville man, 19, and a Bristow man, 19, were arrested.

DALE CITY AREA ASSAULTS  

Cloverdale Rd., 15100 block, 2:21 a.m. Oct. 8. During an argument, a man attacked a male acquaintance. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested. The victim was treated for non-life-threatening injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Westminster Lane, 14300 block, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 14. A laptop, a TV and other electronics were stolen from a residence entered through the front door.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULTS

Mountain Laurel Loop, 3300 block, 12:20 p.m. Oct. 8. A juvenile destroyed property at a residence and attacked a female acquaintance and a police officer responding to the report of a disturbance. A 16-year-old Woodbridge male was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Macon Way, 3500 block, 9:22 p.m. Oct. 12. Several gunshots were heard.

LAKE RIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Smoketown Rd., 12900 block, 6:15 a.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a front window.

MANASSAS AREA ROBBERIES

Urbanna Rd., 8000 block, 7:45 p.m. Oct. 8. Two men knocked a male from a bicycle and robbed him of a cellphone. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Flagler Cir., 7900 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 17. Two TVs and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Graham Ct., 18200 block, 9:01 p.m. Oct. 16. A man tried to force his way into an acquaintance's residence by kicking at a door, then attacked a neighbor who intervened. A 32-year-old Dumfries man was arrested. No injuries were reported.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Minnieville Rd., 13500 block, Oct. 13. A 52-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested in connection with groping incidents at an auto-repair business Jan. 19 and July 8.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Cardinal Dr. and I-95, 5:57 p.m. Oct. 13. During an argument inside a moving vehicle, a passenger made threats and fired a handgun through an open window. The motorist and a juvenile passenger got out of the vehicle at a parking lot. A 55-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. No injuries were reported.

Opal Lane, 13100 block, 6:08 p.m. Oct. 15. During an argument, a man threatened a female acquaintance at gunpoint. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Coachman Terr., 15200 block, 1:45 a.m. Oct. 16. A man hailed a cab, then robbed the driver of cash at gunpoint.

Grist Mill Terr., 15300 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 13. A man robbed a deliveryman of cash and a pizza at gunpoint.

Tilletson Pl., 1700 block, 3:27 a.m. Oct. 9. Two men robbed a pedestrian of cash at gunpoint. The victim was treated for injuries sustained when he was struck with the weapon.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayfield Dr., 3200 block, 9:45 to 11:45 a.m. Oct. 15. A residence was entered through a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Carter Lane, 1500 block, 12:40 p.m. Oct. 14. A TV was stolen from a building entered by forcing a rear window.

Edgewater Dr., 14800 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 14 to 1:20 p.m. Oct. 15. A residence was entered by forcing a front window. Nothing was reported missing.

Gregg St., 4200 block, 2 to 8 a.m. Oct. 12. A laptop, a cellphone and a wallet were stolen from a residence entered by removing an air-conditioner from a window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13700 block, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 14. Property was stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Lynwood Dr., 5000 block, 5 to 10 p.m. Oct. 14. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Mapledale Ave., 14200 block, 7 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Oct. 13. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement window.

Tag Ct., 6100 block, 12:20 to 12:45 p.m. Oct. 12. A residence was entered through a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

HOMICIDES

Braxted Lane, 8600 block, 9:45 p.m. Oct. 14. During an argument at a residence, a 28-year-old man was stabbed. He was pronounced dead at the scene. An 18-year-old Manassas man was charged with first-degree murder.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sassafras Ct., 9700 block, Oct. 14 to 15. Two laptops and two watches were stolen from a residence.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Meeker Ct., 7 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 16. Prescription medicine was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 556 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ASSAULTS

Sequoia Park Way, 7900 block, 11:23 a.m. Aug. 23. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 42-year-old Bristow man was arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dr David Cline Lane, 17900 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 21 to 4:30 a.m. Aug. 22. Two laptop computers, three video game systems and other items were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door. 

GAINESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lee Hwy. and Gainesville Square Shopping Center, 9:45 to 10 p.m. Aug. 27. A man pushed a female pedestrian down an embankment and sexually assaulted her.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wellington Rd., 5500 block, 5:20 p.m. Aug. 21 to 7:20 a.m. Aug. 22. Copper, truck tires and other property were stolen from a scrap yard entered by cutting a gate lock.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Keystone Rd. area, 2009 to 2014. A man reportedly sexually assaulted a female acquaintance several times. A 41-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd., 2800 block, 6:49 p.m. Aug. 25. A woman arranged to meet a man in a parking lot. When the man arrived, the woman was with a male acquaintance, who shot the man in the face. The pair fled. The injured man was taken to a hospital. The alleged assailant abandoned a vehicle in a school parking lot, then flagged down a motorist and forced him to drive to another location, where he fled on foot. A 31-year-old Stafford woman and a 28-year-old Woodbridge man were arrested.

Gordon Blvd., 12500 block, 10:09 p.m. Aug. 21. During an argument, a man threw a bottle at a female acquaintance, hitting her head. He then choked her until she lost consciousness. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Queensbury Ct., 12500 block, 6:03 p.m. Aug. 21. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance in the face, knocking him down. The injured man's head struck the pavement, rendering him unconscious. He was treated for injuries.

WEAPONS

Birchdale Ave. and Dale Blvd., 9:30 p.m. Aug. 25. During a fight on a basketball court involving two groups, gunshots were fired. A bullet hit an occupied parked vehicle. No injuries were reported.

Lakota Dr., 7000 block, 6:13 p.m. Aug. 23. Several gunshots were heard. A side of a residence and a vehicle were hit. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Cloverdale Rd., 14800 block, 2:04 a.m. Aug. 24. Two males stole beer from a convenience store. They assaulted the employee who had attempted to stop them and implied they had a knife.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cardin Pl., 15000 block, 4 to 5 p.m. Aug. 21. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Thornwood Lane, 9200 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 25 to 8 a.m. Aug. 26. A purse containing cash, medicine and jewelry was stolen from a residence, which was entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Elm Ct., Aug. 19 to 9:35 a.m. Aug. 20. A gray mountain bike and lock were stolen from the front area of a residence.

VANDALISM

Martin Dr., 8 to 9 p.m. Aug. 26. Tires of a vehicle were slashed.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 1062 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA ASSAULTS

Dodsworth Dr., 13500 block, 6:31 p.m. April 8. During an argument, a man fired an air pistol at a juvenile relative, hitting him in the abdomen. A 19-year-old Bristow man was arrested.

Linton Hall Rd., 8700 block, 8:51 p.m. April 7. During an argument, a man chased a male acquaintance with a large knife. The acquaintance locked himself inside a vehicle. The man attempted to enter and damaged the vehicle. 

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blowing Leaf Pl., 3700 block, 8 p.m. April 3 to 5 a.m. April 4. A GPS device, a tool set and other items were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Fort Henry Ct., 1700 block, 9:37 p.m. April 8. Three armed, masked males entered a residence through an unlocked front door. A fourth male stayed outside. When a resident called police, they fled. One of the males fired a weapon at the residence. Two Triangle males, 13 and 16, and two Dumfries males, 15 and 17, were arrested.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Yellowthroat Ct., 8800 block, noon April 2 to 3 p.m. April 9. An attempt was made to enter a residence by kicking and prying a basement door.

HAYMARKET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Heathcote Blvd., 15100 block, 7 p.m. April 2 to 8:30 p.m. April 4. Cash was stolen from a business entered by prying a rear door.

Heathcote Blvd., 15100 block, 3:30 p.m. March 28 to 6:30 p.m. March 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a front door.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Mountwood Dr., March. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance and a male juvenile. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Portsmouth Rd., 10000 block, 9:40 p.m. April 7. A man grabbed a pedestrian from behind and attempted to drag her to a nearby alley. The woman fought back, and the man fled.

Portwood Turn, 8100 block, 8:47 a.m. April 3. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Cub Run Ct. and Irongate Way, 10:28 a.m. April 4. A man robbed a female pedestrian of her purse at gunpoint. When the man fled, the woman chased him, and he assaulted her.

NOKESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maplewood Dr., 8100 block, 4:17 a.m. April 9. A man attempted to enter a residence by pushing on a basement door. He fled when a resident yelled at him.

Schaeffer Lane, 10400 block, March 29 to April 5. Miscellaneous items were stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Radford Ct., 14200 block, 10:27 p.m. April 6. During a party at a residence, a man sexually assaulted a woman. When another man confronted the assailant, the assailant hit the man in the head with the flat part of a machete. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 1:30 a.m. April 9. During an argument, a man stabbed a male acquaintance with a knife. A 33-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Dale Blvd., 2900 block, 12:29 a.m. April 9. After an argument between a woman and a male acquaintance, the acquaintance drove away with another person. The woman followed the vehicle and ran her vehicle into theirs several times. When the first vehicle pulled over, the woman hit their vehicle again, then exited and spray-painted the trunk. A 21-year-old Stafford woman was arrested.

Tarpon Lane, 5000 block, 1:11 a.m. April 10. A man entered a residence and assaulted a male acquaintance.

WEAPONS

Elm Farm Rd., 3400 block, 1:10 a.m. April 6. Several gunshots were heard.

Red Wing Dr. and Blue Jay Ct., 1:25 a.m. April 5. Several gunshots were heard.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 2800 block, 10:50 p.m. April 5. A man in a fast-food restaurant pushed a woman to the ground and robbed her of a cellphone.

Dillingham Sq., 3300 block, April 4. A person knocked a male pedestrian to the ground and robbed him of a wallet.

Keating Dr., 13400 block, 12:05 a.m. April 6. Two men and a third person restrained a man and a woman in a residence and robbed them of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Creekview Cir., 12200 block, 11 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. April 4. Two TVs and a video-game system were stolen from a residence.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 4:05 a.m. April 7. Cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a business.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

WEAPONS

Signal Hill Dr. and Richmond Ave., 5:53 p.m. April 5. After nearly colliding with another vehicle, a motorist exited his vehicle, pointed a handgun at the other driver and told him to get back in his car. They both drove away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bruton Parish Ct., 8600 block, 9 to 9:20 a.m. April 8. A laptop, a tablet and a purse were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a door.

Centreville Rd., 9200 block, 12:35 a.m. April 7. A man demanded narcotics from a pharmacy. He fled on a bike with the drugs.

Oliver Ct., 8800 block, noon to 2 p.m. April 3. Cash, a laptop, a video-game system, video games and electronic accessories were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Portner Ave., 8900 block, 10:20 a.m. April 5. A laptop, a black bag and hand tools were stolen from a church entered by breaking a basement window.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crozet St., March 31 to 11:02 a.m. April 7. A chainsaw, a weed whacker and a blower were stolen from storage cabinets on a truck.

VANDALISM

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 7:09 p.m. April 8. A man kicked the door of a business, breaking the glass. A man was arrested.

Yost St., 3 a.m. April 6 to 8:30 a.m. April 7. A soft top of a vehicle was pulled away. A glove box and a center console were damaged.

The Washington Post


July 14, 2002 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 296 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 3200 block, 10:56 a.m. July 8. The Bank of Southern Maryland was robbed by a man who fled the scene in a blue or gray vehicle with a vinyl top.

SMALLWOOD VILLAGE, 100 block, 9:15 p.m. July 9. The CVS Pharmacy was robbed at gunpoint.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

WALDORF, June 21. A male youth, 12, sexually assaulted a boy, 4. He was charged with second-degree sexual offense.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRIARWOOD PLACE, 10200 block, 1:15 to 7 a.m. July 1. Stereo equipment was stolen from a 1998 Dodge Neon entered by smashing a window.

CRAIN HWY., 2200 block, 6 p.m. July 6. A man, 32, stole a friend's checkbook, forged a check and attempted to cash it. He was charged with forgery, uttering and theft.

DORCHESTER CIR., 5000 block, 9:30 p.m. July 6 to 11:45 a.m. July 7. Property was stolen from a concession stand at the Dorchester Recreation Center.

LAKE DR., 8 a.m. July 5. A woman, 36, used a crowbar to enter a residence. She was charged with third-degree burglary.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RANDALL'S DR., 9600 block, June 11 to 18. Six extension ladders and a 14-foot plank of wood were stolen from the back yard of a residence.

-- Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: July 14, 2002


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DOCUMENT-TYPE: LIST


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

Washingtonpost.com


February 2, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 2116 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, Inc., a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Rockville Pike, 1500 block, 9:17 p.m. Jan. 14. A man groped a person at a retail store. A 32-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested. 

ROBBERIES

Lawrence Dr., 300 block, 8:50 p.m. Jan. 15. Two men armed with a weapon threatened a person and fled with property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Congressional Lane, 200 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 15 to 1:01 a.m. Jan. 16. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Police said that in several of the incidents, a light brown pickup truck has been seen in the area and that some men who were confronted with the stolen property said that they were working for a gutter company.

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T15


LENGTH: 417 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.charlescountysheriffsoffice.org. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

MARSHALL CORNER RD., 7000 block, 12:30 p.m. Feb. 8. A male youth, 14, punched out a ticket booth window at McDonough High School. He was charged with destruction of property under $ 500.

ARSON

CHAPEL POINT RD., 10:57 p.m. Feb. 9. A Molotov cocktail was thrown at a building, causing a small fire.

ASSAULTS

ROBINSON PLACE, 3000 block, 2 p.m. Feb. 9. A man, 29, entered a residence and grabbed a woman, 31, by the throat. He also broke a telephone. He was charged with second-degree assault, third-degree burglary and destruction of property under $ 500.

ROBBERIES

OLD WASHINGTON RD., 3200 block, 11:01 p.m. Feb. 12. A man, 18, punched a man, 21, several times, knocked him to the ground and took his money. He was apprehended a short time later. He was charged with second-degree assault and robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 2100 block, 11:30 p.m. Feb. 11. A man, 22, broke into a nightclub. He was charged with second-degree burglary, theft over $ 500 and destruction of property.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

SMALLWOOD DR., 12:51 a.m. Feb. 11. A woman, 20, was urinating in the woods when a man approached and demanded that she remove her clothes or he would kill her. She complied and he sexually assaulted her. The suspect was described as in his late twenties or early thirties and wearing a hooded jacket and jeans.

VEHICLE THEFTS

BELFAST RD., 800 block, 9 a.m. to noon. Feb. 6. A 1996 Volvo was stolen at a residence.

ST. MARK'S DR., 9:41 p.m. Feb. 8. Three male youths were riding in a stolen vehicle. Police stopped the vehicle, and the three youths fled. Two youths, ages 16 and 17, were apprehended. They were charged with theft of a motor vehicle. The driver escaped and was described as 16 to 18 years old, about 5 feet 11 inches tall, weighing 150 pounds and wearing a gray sweat shirt and blue jeans.

-- Bonnie Smith

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Rockville Pike, 200 block, 12:30 to 4 p.m. Aug. 1. A wallet was stolen from a desk in an office.

Wootton Pkwy., 2300 block, 9:30 to 10 p.m. Aug. 4. A purse and clothes were stolen from a backpack at a swim center.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore Ave., 7300 block, 4:24 p.m. Aug. 6. Two males took a bicycle from a residence. The bike was abandoned a short time later at New York Avenue, where it was recovered.

Holton Lane, 1200 block, 10:30 p.m. Aug. 2 to 6:30 a.m. Aug. 3. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by smashing a window.

Merwood Dr., 1100 block, 6:30 p.m. Aug. 2 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 3. A vehicle was entered by force.

New Hampshire Ave., 7600 block, 7 to 7:15 p.m. Aug. 3. Property was stolen from a person shopping.

Pine Ave., unit block, 10:45 a.m. Aug. 8. Property was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

New Hampshire Ave., unit block, 12:30 a.m. Aug. 6. A vehicle was reported stolen. It was recovered at 2:45 p.m. on New York Avenue.

The Washington Post


October 13, 2002 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T17


LENGTH: 458 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

NANJEMOY, 8 p.m. Oct. 4. A man, 20, sexually assaulted and stabbed a woman, 62. He was charged with first-degree rape, first- and second-degree assault, first-degree burglary and theft less than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

ST. PATRICK'S DR. AND LANCASTER CIR., 11:20 p.m. Oct. 5. A man, 22, assaulted police officers and attempted to flee on foot after he had been involved in a single-vehicle crash, which damaged property. He was charged with two counts of second-degree assault, two counts of resisting arrest, attempting to flee and elude and making a false statement.

VICTORIA PLACE, 1:15 p.m. Oct. 5. A man, 37, broke into a residence, assaulted two of the occupants and destroyed property. He also assaulted police officers with a weapon and resisted arrest. He was charged with four counts of first-degree assault, second-degree assault, destruction of property over $ 500, false imprisonment, resisting arrest and stalking.

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 3500 block, 4:23 a.m. Oct. 4. The Super 8 Motel was robbed by a man with a knife. He fled the scene on foot.

MALL CIRCLE, 11100 block, 1:30 p.m. Oct. 7. A suspect holding a 2-by-4 board approached a male youth, 17, and demanded money. The youth complied, and the suspect fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

QUIGLEY CT., 4000 block, 6:30 p.m. Oct. 3 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 4. Clothing, a cell phone and CDs were stolen from a vehicle.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

TANGLEWOOD DR., 2000 block, 9:45 p.m. Oct. 5 to 2:30 a.m. Oct. 6. A rock was thrown through a glass door at a residence.

VEHICLE THEFTS

DORSET DR., 10000 block, 7:51 p.m. Oct. 2. A man, 31, forced his way into a residence and stole property, including keys to a 1998 GMC Sierra truck. He fled the scene in the truck. A warrant for first-degree burglary, theft of a motor vehicle, unauthorized use of a motor vehicle, theft over $ 500 and theft under $ 500 has been issued.

OLD WASHINGTON RD., 2100 block, 10:30 a.m. Oct. 2. A 1994 Toyota Corolla was stolen from a parking lot.

VEHICLE THEFTS

BRUNS AVE., 10000 block, Oct. 2 to 4. A 2002 Suzuki GSXR1000 motorcycle was stolen from a shed at a residence.

-- Bonnie Smith

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 1542 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA CHILD ENDANGERMENT INCIDENTS

Sapphire Ridge Pl., 13200 block, 12:42 p.m. March 8. A 3-month-old infant was pronounced dead at a hospital shortly after the child was found unresponsive and transported from an unlicensed day-care center operating out of a residence. The adults at the facility, a 50-year-old Manassas woman and a 42-year-old Woodbridge woman, were arrested. Of the 23 children at the center, at least five were younger than 12 months old. The women were each charged with five counts of child endangerment. The owner of the residence was out of the country.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wright Lane, 12000 block, 5:45 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. March 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window. 

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Edgehill Dr., 15300 block, noon Feb. 25 to 5 p.m. March 9. A bicycle was stolen from a residence entered through a garage.

Fisherman's Cove, 4700 block, 1:09 p.m. March 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a basement door. An occupant, alerted by a dog, saw a man walk away from the premises empty-handed.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lynn Forest Dr., 4400 block, 8:45 a.m. to 2:15 p.m. March 13. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Barron Park area, March 12. A man attacked a juvenile female acquaintance at his residence. A 22-year-old man was charged with sexual assault.

ASSAULTS

Rokeby Rd., 7400 block, 9:54 p.m. March 8. During an argument, a man at a residence kicked a female acquaintance several times in the stomach and back. The woman was treated for injuries at a hospital. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lafayette Ave., 9400 block, 9 p.m. March 12 to 4 a.m. March 13. A jacket containing a wallet was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Outback Ct., 7500 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 13. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

Patterson Lane, 9400 block, 8 a.m. March 8 to 5:30 p.m. March 9. An attempt was made to break into a residence by tampering with a window and the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Silo Mill Ct., 7700 block, 6 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. March 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Somerset Lane, 7600 block, 2 to 7:58 p.m. March 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

TRIANGLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Triangle, March 14. A 41-year-old Triangle man who is incarcerated on unrelated charges at the Rappahannock Regional Jail was charged in the sexual assault and aggravated sexual battery of a juvenile from 1996 to 2001.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 3:07 a.m. March 13. An apartment-rental office was entered by breaking a side window. Nothing was reported missing.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Colchester Rd., 1400 block, 10:13 p.m. March 10. During an argument, four people attacked a male acquaintance, who was later treated for a broken nose and other injuries. Two Woodbridge men, ages 19 and 20, a 24-year-old Triangle man, and a 20-year-old Triangle woman were arrested.

Lamar Rd., 14400 block, 9:38 p.m. March 9. During a dispute at a residence, a man grabbed a kitchen knife, chased a 17-year-old acquaintance from the premises and stabbed the victim once in the arm when he fell. The victim broke free. The assailant returned to the residence, where he threw a brick at a departing vehicle, causing $500 damage. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man is being sought on charges of malicious wounding, throwing missiles at an occupied vehicle and destruction of property. The stabbing victim received treatment at the scene for a minor injury.

Luca Station Way and Old Bridge Rd., 2:57 a.m. March 10. A woman, who had been arguing with another woman, jumped on a vehicle when she tried to drive away from a residence, then fell to the ground when the motorist slammed on the brakes. She was taken to a hospital, where she was treated for non life-threatening injuries. A 24-year-old Lorton woman was charged with malicious wounding and with driving while intoxicated.

Penshurst Lane, 3900 block, March 2. Responding to a report of a 3-month-old infant being treated for severe trauma to the head and body, police arrested a 30-year-old Woodbridge man, who shook the child on at least two occasions. He was charged with two counts of malicious wounding and two counts of felony child abuse.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14500 block, 2:41 p.m. March 9. During an argument in a vehicle, a motorist pulled into a parking lot, then threatened a female passenger at gunpoint. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. No injuries were reported.

Yosocomico Lane, 2700 block, 10:52 p.m. March 11. During an argument, a male struck a female acquaintance in the face. A 16-year-old from Woodbridge was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Build America Dr., 14800 block, 7:30 p.m. March 8. A man robbed a grocery store of cash at gunpoint.

Dale Blvd., 4300 block, 8:49 a.m. March 12. A man robbed an employee of a business at gunpoint.

Dillingham Sq., 12500 block, 9:32 p.m. March 10. A man robbed a restaurant of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cotton Mill Rd., 11900 block, 9:45 a.m. March 7. A laptop, a video camera, a DVD player, a tablet PC and a video game system were among property stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window. A 17-year-old male was arrested.

Cottonwood Ct., 1400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 12:45 p.m. March 8. Two safes and cash were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a door.

Darlington Loop, 2000 block, 8:13 a.m. March 9. An attempt was made to break into an occupied residence. A man fled empty-handed when confronted.

Gableridge Turn, 1800 block, 3:15 a.m. March 11. Three males, who were asked to leave a party at a residence, returned a short time later and kicked in a balcony door and a front door, then tried to fight with people inside. No injuries were reported.

Geddy Ct., 16600 block, 2 to 4:45 p.m. March 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a front door.

Harbor Dr., 12800 block, 4:59 p.m. March 9. A handgun was stolen from a vehicle at a carwash. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Packard Dr., 13300 block, 10 to 10:15 p.m. March 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

Tassia Lane, 15700 block, 11:04 p.m. March 12. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by breaking a window. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dumfries Rd., 10100 block, 9:45 p.m. March 12. Responding to a report of suspicious activity in a vehicle, police arrested a 29-year-old Manassas man. Charges included taking indecent liberties as a custodian, embezzlement and unlawful possession of vehicle-inspection decals.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bonham Cir., 8900 block, 12:01 to 9 a.m. March 5. A tire was stolen from a vehicle.

Center St., 9300 block, Feb. 1 to Feb. 14. Three brass staircase-post fixtures were stolen from a residence.

Magnolia Grove Rd., 10200 block, 6:30 p.m. March 12. A residence was entered through a basement door. A male was seen fleeing the area empty-handed.

Riverdale Pl., 9600 block, March 4 to March 5. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Riverdale Pl., 9600 block, 9:40 p.m. March 6. Property was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window. Some of the property was recovered in the back yard.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Commerce Ct., 8700 block, 6:20 to 6:30 p.m. March 6. A green 2005 Nissan Altima was stolen.

VANDALISM

Commerce Ct., 8800 block, 4:30 p.m. March 6 to 7 a.m. March 7. Graffiti was spray-painted on a building.

Metcalf Blvd., 9400 block, 5:30 p.m. March 5 to 9:30 a.m. March 6. An unsuccessful attempt was made to remove a muffler from a vehicle.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lapaz Pl., 9:30 a.m. March 10. Two construction company vehicles were filled with water drawn from a municipal hydrant. A 60-year-old Springfield man and a 43-year-old Woodbridge man were arrested.

William St., 9000 block, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. March 12. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement window

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Kent Dr., 100 block, 7:30 p.m. March 10 to 7:45 a.m. March 11. A black go-kart was stolen from the front yard of a residence.

The Washington Post


August 25, 2002 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 355 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

FENWICK CIR., 11:15 a.m. Aug. 5. A man, 19, had consensual sexual intercourse with a female youth, 12. He was charged with second-degree rape.

ARSON

STRAUSS AVE., 1:23 p.m. Aug. 19. The front door of a single-family home was set on fire.

ASSAULTS

OLD WASHINGTON RD., 12:29 a.m. Aug. 18. Two men, ages 40 and 41, assaulted a police officer. They were stopped when their vehicle crossed the center line. The 40-year-old man was charged with DWI, fleeing and eluding on foot, reckless driving, failure to drive right of center, speeding, resisting arrest and assault. The 41-year-old was charged with assault, resisting arrest and hindering arrest.

ROBBERIES

ST. IGNATIUS DR., 1000 block, 5:15 a.m. Aug. 18. A male youth, 16, was approached by a suspect and asked if he had any money. The youth displayed money, and the suspect grabbed the youth and forced him into a vehicle. The suspect then stole the money, released the youth and fled.

ST. PATRICK'S DR., 11:45 p.m. Aug. 16. A woman, 18, at the ATM at Suntrust Bank was approached by two men, one armed with a handgun. They demanded cash. One of the men assaulted the woman with the gun before they both fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 2200 block, 4:42 a.m. Aug. 18. Liquor was stolen from Waldorf Liquors. The store was entered by smashing the front window.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 12. A woman, 35, was involved in incidents of sexual abuse against a female youth, 16. She was charged with child abuse.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 344 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Prince Cole Ct., 4:41 a.m. March 9. A man entered a residence through an unlocked door and sexually assaulted a female resident.  

ASSAULTS

Irongate Way, 8300 block, 11:40 a.m. Feb. 10. During an argument, a woman assaulted a female acquaintance. A 20-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Blendia Lane, 10600 block, 6:30 a.m. March 6. A man threw tree branches at a rear glass door of a residence, then exposed himself to a female occupant.

NOKESVILLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Fitzwater Dr., 12900 block, 11:18 a.m. March 6. A man gave a bank teller a note demanding cash and implied he had a weapon. He fled with cash.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Culpeper Dr., February. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 45-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Habrown Ct., 13100 block, 3:56 a.m. March 5. During an argument, a woman attempted to stab a male acquaintance. A 33-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Creek Moor Ct., 2600 block, 4 p.m. March 3 to 11:49 p.m. March 4. Jewelry and other property were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement door lock.

Hamilton Dr., 4400 block, 7:26 p.m. March 10. Two males attempted to enter a residence through a rear window. They fled after a neighbor confronted them.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fry St., 9200 block, 4:55 p.m. March 7. A man entered a building. A 45-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Walden St., 12:01 to 8:23 a.m. March 6. Nine chain saws and other property were stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Madera Ct., 6:57 p.m. March 11. A vehicle was stolen and later recovered. A 17-year-old Manassas Park male was arrested.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 422 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

MALCOLM RD., 3300 block, 11:25 p.m. Oct. 25. A woman, 93, was sexually assaulted. The suspect fled the scene in a white pickup truck.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MALCOLM RD., 3200 block, 7:48 a.m. Oct. 29. A man, 27, was arrested on a warrant charging him with failure to appear, theft over $ 300, second-degree assault, driving while suspended, nonsupport, destruction of property under $ 500 and failing to stop at a red light.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PORT TOBACCO RD., 8700 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 1 to 2:50 p.m. Nov. 4. Firearms were stolen from a shed behind a residence.

ASSAULTS

BANNISTER CIR., 1100 block, 4:15 p.m. Nov. 2. Two female youths, both 17, were involved in a fight. One of the youths kicked a dog. They were charged with second-degree assault. The youth who kicked the dog also was charged with animal abuse.

ROBBERIES

BARNSWALLOW PL., 11200 block, 6:45 p.m. Nov. 6. A woman, 32, was robbed by two suspects, one of whom implied he had a gun. The suspects fled in a late model, four-door Nissan Sentra, silver/pearl in color.

ROOKSHEAD PL., 2600 block, 7:25 p.m. Nov. 6. Five suspects armed with handguns approached three male youths, all 17, and a man, 18. They stole clothing, property and money and fled the scene.

SMALLWOOD DR., 1200 block, 6:17 p.m. Nov. 5. Two armed suspects robbed employees at Funcoland.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WOLVERINE PL., 6000 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 3 to 5:50 a.m. Nov. 4. Stereo equipment was stolen from several vehicles.

VEHICLE THEFTS

WIMBLEDON PL., 10200 block, 4:50 a.m. Nov. 1. A 1995 Honda Accord was stolen from a residence. The vehicle contained more than $ 500 worth of property.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

MIRKWOOD LANE, 5:15 p.m. Nov. 6. Three suspects threw rocks at a parked school bus.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WILLETTS CROSSING RD., 10000 block, Oct. 31 to Nov. 3. Money and property were stolen from a residence entered through a broken window.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 588 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

WEAPONS

Wythe Ct., 2900 block, 3:30 a.m. Oct. 10. Several gunshots were heard.

MANASSAS AREA

PROSTITUTION

New Market Ct., 7200 block, 10:53 p.m. Oct. 16. A 22-year-old Sacramento, Calif., woman was arrested and charged with prostitution and possession of marijuana.

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, Oct. 15. A male assaulted two male juveniles in a parking lot and robbed them of a cellphone. A 16-year-old Woodbridge boy was arrested. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8100 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 17 to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 21. An attempt was made to enter a business by damaging a rear door.

TRIANGLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Sharon Rd., 18300 block, 3:52 p.m. Oct. 16. Two males knocked a male juvenile pedestrian to the ground and searched his pockets. They fled empty-handed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Linfield Dr., 4 a.m. Oct. 22. A man hit a female acquaintance several times and demanded her wallet and cellphone. He dragged her into a residence, where he assaulted her, including sexually, until she lost consciousness. She was treated for injuries. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Haddock Rd., 13100 block, Oct. 15. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and attempted to choke her. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Indiana Ave., 1500 block, 9:42 p.m. Oct. 20. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance.

Oberlin Dr., 2100 block, 8:10 a.m. Oct. 16. A man assaulted a female acquaintance, threatened her with a handgun and prevented her from leaving a residence. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENTS

Findley Rd., 3900 block, 6 a.m. Oct. 17. After an investigation by Prince William County detectives and federal agents, three juveniles were removed from a residence. A 33-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested and charged with reckless endangerment.

ROBBERIES

Gideon Dr., 14400 block, 11:38 a.m. Oct. 16. A gunman robbed a convenience store of a cash drawer.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Garber Way, 2800 block, 1:59 a.m. Oct. 22. Cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a business entered by breaking a front glass door.

Hampshire Ct., 13200 block, 7:20 p.m. Oct. 19 to 11 a.m. Oct. 20. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, Oct. 11 to 13. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 12:33 a.m. Oct. 23. A man attempted to enter a residence through a window. He fled when a resident saw him.

Lord Culpeper Ct., 15200 block, 12:30 p.m. Oct. 15. Cash, a computer and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through a rear basement door.

Reef Knot Way, 16800 block, 5 a.m. Oct. 22. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear door.

Swallow Ct., 14800 block, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 17. Cash, a video game system and an MP3 player were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Walnut St., 1500 block, Sept. 13 to Oct. 2. Power tools were stolen from a garage entered through a side door.

Manassas

This was among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Mathis Ave., 9100 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 18. A juvenile stabbed another juvenile, who was treated for injuries.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Cabbel Dr.,5 p.m. Oct. 22 to 7 a.m. Oct. 23. Windows of a vehicle were broken.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. LZ13


LENGTH: 812 words


Loudoun County 

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

Ashburn Area

ROBBERIES

APOLLO AND ASHBURN VILLAGE TERRACES, 7:55 p.m. March 18. Three people forced two people from a vehicle and robbed them of cash, two cellphones and a camera. The assailants fled in a waiting vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASHBURN RUN PL., 21400 block, 11 p.m. March 5 to 6:30 a.m. March 6. A laptop, a Global Positioning System device and a DVD player were stolen from an unlocked vehicle. 

MERION ST., 21500 block, 8 p.m. March 4 to 6 a.m. March 5. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

CHARTER OAK DR., 20300 block, 10 p.m. March 6 to 10 a.m. March 7. Four vehicles were marked with paint.

Leesburg Area

ASSAULTS

FALLS VIEW SQ., 42700 block, 6:45 p.m. March 10. An assault occurred.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BRANDON PARK AREA, noon March 14. A sexual assault occurred.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BABSON CIR., 300 block, 2:49 p.m. March 9. A fraud incident occurred.

BATTLEFIELD PKWY., 800 block, 7:45 a.m. March 5. A theft occurred.

CATOCTIN CIR., 1 to 100 block, March 5. A fraud incident occurred.

HARRISON ST., 200 block, 12:32 p.m. March 7. A theft occurred.

JAMES MONROE HWY., 12700 block, 7:45 a.m. March 12. A carton of cigarettes was stolen from a business.

VESTALS PL., 43300 block, 5 p.m. March 6 to 11:35 a.m. March 8. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

Middleburg Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FEDERAL, WASHINGTON, LIBERTY AND MADSON STREETS, March 14 to 15. Cash and other items were stolen during break-ins at seven businesses. An attempt was made to break into an eighth business.

Potomac Falls Area

VANDALISM

HALCYON PL., 47400 block, March 13. A fence was marked with graffiti.

Sterling Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ATLANTIC BLVD., 21600 block, 3 p.m. March 9 to 6 a.m. March 10. Copper fittings, tools and aluminum cable were stolen from storage trailers at a construction site.

BEARS SCHOOL RD., 24000 block, 7:07 p.m. March 18. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

DICKENSON AVE. S., 1000 block, noon March 10 to 11 a.m. March 12. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

DULLES EASTERN PLAZA, 45500 block, 6 to 7 p.m. March 10. Global Positioning System devices were stolen from two vehicles entered by damaging windows.

DULLES TOWN CIR., 21000 block, 1 to 8:45 p.m. March 15. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

FILLMORE AVE. S., 600 block, March 7 to 8. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

GLENGYLE LANE AND MCPHERSON CIR., 5 p.m. March 14 to 10:15 a.m. March 15. Two unlocked vehicles were entered. Nothing was reported missing.

GLENGYLE LANE AND MCPHERSON CIR., 5 p.m. March 14 to 10:15 a.m. March 15. A cellphone and a radio were stolen from a vehicle. There was no sign of forced entry.

GUM SPRING RD., 24400 block, 6 p.m. March 15 to 8 a.m. March 16. A computer and tools were stolen from a business. There was no sign of forced entry.

HAMPSHIRE STATION DR., 46600 block, 9 p.m. March 14 to 11:54 a.m. March 15. Global Positioning System devices were stolen from two vehicles entered by damaging windows.

HICKORY RD. N., 100 block, 3:23 to 3:36 a.m. March 16. A vehicle parked near a residence was entered. The owner of the vehicle found it with a door open. Nothing was reported missing.

SHADY POINT SQ., 46900 block, 3 a.m. to 5 p.m. March 18. An attempt was made to enter a ground-floor apartment by cutting a window screen.

SOUTHERN OAKS TERR., 46700 block, 3:30 p.m. March 13 to 10:18 a.m. March 15. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by damaging a window.

SOUTHERN OAKS TERR., 46700 block, 3:30 p.m. March 13 to 10:18 a.m. March 15. A vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

STERLING BLVD. S., 22300 block, noon to 5:45 p.m. March 16. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by damaging a window.

TOTTENHAM CT., 1000 block, 12:30 to 10:50 a.m. March 8. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

CHARING CT., 100 block, 11:30 p.m. March 13 to 11:43 a.m. March 14. The surface of a vehicle was scratched.

CHARLOTTE AND AMHURST STREETS, 3 p.m. March 5 to 1:45 p.m. March 7. A trash can, a drainage pipe and a pedestrian bridge were marked with graffiti.

DINWIDDIE ST. N., 1400 block, March 4. A screen to a sliding glass door was damaged at a residence.

LAUREL AVE. W., 400 block, 9 p.m. March 6 to 2 a.m. March 7. Several buildings were marked with graffiti.

LIVINGSTONE STATION ST., 45600 block, 3:47 p.m. March 12. A lawn ornament was thrown through a window at a residence.

WATFORD CT., 700 block, noon March 6 to 10 a.m. March 7. Several fences were marked with paint.

-- Compiled by SANDY MAUCK

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 455 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ASSAULTS

DIGGS RD., 9800 block, 10:50 p.m. Sept. 26. A man, 18, hit another man, 23, with a baseball bat and fled the scene. He was located a short time later. He was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

HOMICIDES

LIVINGSTON RD., 9:50 a.m. Sept. 27. A man, 27, was found shot to death. His brother, 25, was charged with first- and second-degree murder, use of a handgun in commission of a felony and first-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

NITAS PLACE, 10000 block, 5 a.m. Sept. 28. A man, 20, sexually assaulted and stabbed a woman, 62. She was admitted to Civista Medical Center with critical injuries. Police were seeking the man on charges of first-degree rape and first-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

CRAIN HWY., 3500 block, 1:30 a.m. Sept. 26. A man, 25, struck an officer after he had been arrested during a traffic stop. He was charged with DWI, possession of marijuana, possession of marijuana paraphernalia, assault, resisting arrest and escape.

GROUSE PLACE, 4500 block, 1:30 a.m. Sept. 28. A man, 18, hit another man, 46, with a bottle during an argument. The victim was flown to Washington Hospital Center with head injuries. The attacker was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

MCCOY DR., 700 block, 10:56 a.m. Sept. 27. Three suspects approached three men, ages 20, 21 and 22. One of the suspects shot the 22-year-old man, causing non-life-threatening injuries. The three suspects then assaulted the other men. They fled the scene in a newer model, champagne-colored Chevrolet Cavalier.

SMALLWOOD DR., 1200 block, 1:09 a.m. Sept. 28. A man, 22, was shot in the hand while in the parking lot of Legends Nightclub.

ROBBERIES

AMBERLEAF PLACE, 2000 block, 11:20 p.m. Sept. 25. Three suspects stole money and two cell phones from two men, 18 and 19.

SMALLWOOD DR., 1100 block, 11:15 p.m. Sept. 28. Two suspects hit a man, 40, in the head with a bottle and fled with his wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 3200 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 24. A suspect reached over the counter and stole money from the cash register at Waldorf Pet Shop. The suspect fled the scene.

-- Bonnie Smith
